1000 NE.name: 1000 NE
1000 NE.overview: Initial import from http://www.stevenac.net/wot/tl1000.htm and copyrighted by Steven Cooper. Used by permission, not GFDL.

A beginning.name: A beginning
A beginning.overview: The Wheel of Time is © Copyright Robert Jordan ↗. The phrases The Wheel of Time™ and The Dragon Reborn™ are trademarks of Robert Jordan.

A Comprehensive Discussion of Pre-Breaki.name: A Comprehensive Discussion of Pre-Breaking Relics
A Comprehensive Discussion of Pre-Breaki.overview: A Comprehensive Discussion of Pre-Breaking Relics is one of Min Farshaw 's books. She was studying it just before Semirhage captured Rand al'Thor with the Domination Band.

A Crown of Swords.name: A Crown of Swords
A Crown of Swords.overview: A Crown of Swords (abbreviated aCoS ) is the seventh book in The Wheel of Time series. It was published by Tor Books and released on May 15, 1996. It is 880 pages long.

A Fire Within the Ways.name: A Fire Within the Ways
A Fire Within the Ways.overview: A Fire Within the Ways is a short story written by Brandon Sanderson as part of the Unfettered III anthology. It was initially written, but later cut, from A Memory of Light and is from the point of view of Perrin Aybara.

A Journey to Tarabon.name: A Journey to Tarabon
A Journey to Tarabon.overview: A Journey to Tarabon, by Eurian Romavni, is a book that Egwene al'Vere reads before visiting Tanchico in Tel'aran'rhiod.

A Memory of Light.name: A Memory of Light
A Memory of Light.overview: A Memory of Light (abbreviated aMoL ) is the fourteenth and final book in The Wheel of Time series. It was due for publication in late 2012, however Tor later announced that the final volume would be released on January 8, 2013.

A Study of Men, Women and the One Power.name: A Study of Men, Women and the One Power Among Humans
A Study of Men, Women and the One Power.overview: A Study of Men, Women and the One Power Among Humans is an Ogier book written by the Ogier author Ledar, son of Shandin son of Koimal, and, according to Loial, reports on how After Breaking Aes Sedai treat men who can channel. In terms of Ogier time, the book is relatively recent, having been written a scant 300 years ago.

A Study of the War of the Shadow.name: A Study of the War of the Shadow
A Study of the War of the Shadow.overview: A Study of the War of the Shadow, by Moilin daughter of Hamada daughter of Juendan, is a book read by Loial which he cites as a reference on some of the Forsaken. Moiraine is trying to get additional information on Be'lal and the book says he is called 'Netweaver'.

Abayan.name: Abayan
Abayan.overview: Abayan was a kingdom of the Free Years, founded after the Trolloc Wars out of the ruins of the kingdom of Jaramide. It was later annexed as part of Artur Hawkwing's Empire and its territory today is occupied by the kingdom of Arad Doman

Abila.name: Abila
Abila.overview: Abila is a somewhat large town in Amadicia.

Abor'maseleine.name: Abor'maseleine
Abor'maseleine.overview: Abor'maseleine was an Ogier-built city in Aridhol, one of the Ten Nations after the Breaking.

Abrishi.name: Abrishi
Abrishi.overview: In the Sharan culture the Abrishi seem to be wise men, that know the prophecies regarding the Last Battle. One of them, called Mintel, adopted Demandred, who called himself Bao while in Shara, because he was fulfilling the Sharans prophecies about the last days. In particular Mintel seems also to be a dreamwalker.

Abunai.name: Abunai
Abunai.overview: Abunai is a village or town in Seanchan. It lies on the Sea of L'Heye, possibly near the equator as it is always warm there. Bethamin was born there and is therefore not used to cold weather.

Academy.name: Academy
Academy.overview:
An academy is a school of learning and research. Rand al'Thor started several academies in cities under his control, so that "knowledge would not be lost again," as it was in the Breaking.

Known academies include:

- the School of Cairhien , located in Lord Barthanes 's former manor house.
- one in Caemlyn , which Elayne Trakand has taken over and renamed the Academy of the Rose .

Academy of the Rose.name: Academy of the Rose
Academy of the Rose.overview: The Academy of the Rose is the school in Caemlyn created by Rand al'Thor and taken over by Elayne Trakand.

Adanza.name: Adanza
Adanza.overview: Adanza was one of the great cities during the Age of Legends. It is noted to have great beauty in both its sights and its people.

Adar.name: Adar
Adar.overview: Adar is the fifth month in the Farede calendar. In most years, it is equivalent to the real world period from April 13 to May 10. Tirish Adar occurs during Adar, Feast of Neman on the 9th, and Feast of Freia on the 21st.

Adim.name: Adim
Adim.overview: Adim is a thirteen year old boy, who has an uncle named Almen Bunt.

Aelgar.name: Aelgar
Aelgar.overview: Aelgar was one of the Ten Nations and fell in the aftermath of the Trolloc Wars. It was renowned for its wealth and power. The associated denonym is Aelgari.

Aes Sedai.name: Aes Sedai
Aes Sedai.overview:
The Aes Sedai ( Old Tongue: Servant of All ) are women who can channel the One Power, and have been trained in the White Tower of Tar Valon. They have passed the tests for earning both the ring and the shawl and are bound by the Three Oaths. They are the only organization of female channelers in the Westlands (and until recently, they believed themselves to be the only legitimate channeling organization in the known world), giving them a vast amount of power and influence over the nations of the world, providing advisors to kings and queens.

Each Aes Sedai belongs to one of the seven Ajahs, with the exception of their leader, the Amyrlin Seat, who is "of all Ajahs and none."

Aes Sedai (Age of Legends).name: Aes Sedai (Age of Legends)
Aes Sedai (Age of Legends).overview: Aes Sedai, in the Old Tongue, means "servants of all," and the Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends lived up to this definition. They aided mankind as scientists, healers and philosophers. Women used saidar and men saidin, as today, although it is believed that channelers in the Age of Legends were much stronger, or at least more knowledgeable in the Power than their modern equivalents; it is believed that they could fly, and things that would seem miraculous today were supposedly commonplace to them. Some of their lost Talents, such as Traveling and Dreaming, have only just been rediscovered. One thing is clear, however; the greatest works were wrought by male and female channelers working together.

Aes Sedai symbol.name: Aes Sedai symbol
Aes Sedai symbol.overview: The Aes Sedai symbol is a round black-and white disc. The two colours are divided by a sinuous line in the middle. It has long been associated with the Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends. It's a graphical representation of the philosophical understanding of the duality of life; active-passive, male-female, material-immaterial which underpinned the culture of the Age of Legends. In the Third Age, it has been split into the white Flame of Tar Valon; some said it stood for the Light, and the black Dragon's Fang representing the evil.

Aesdaishar Palace.name: Aesdaishar Palace
Aesdaishar Palace.overview:
The Aesdaishar Palace is the royal palace of Kandor. It is located in the capital city of Chachin. The current resident of the palace is Queen Ethenielle Kirukon Materasu. The word Aesdaishar means "All Glory" in the Old Tongue.

The Aesdaishar Palace is located on a cleared mountain-top and is a small settlement in itself, consisting of a complex of buildings, domes and towers. The palace rears more than 5,000 feet above the rest of the city below, and offers stunning vistas of Chachin and the surrounding countryside. However, the attraction of these views has waned in recent years since Prince-Consort Brys, the Queen's son Diryk and a Malkieri noblewoman named Iselle Arrel fell to their deaths from a balcony in 979 NE.

Aethan Dor.name: Aethan Dor
Aethan Dor.overview: The Aethan Dor is an Aiel warrior society. The name means "Red Shields" in the Old Tongue.

Aethelaine.name: Aethelaine
Aethelaine.overview: Aethelaine is the local lady of Jurador.

After Breaking.name: After Breaking
After Breaking.overview:
After Breaking, often abbreviated AB for historical purposes, was a period of time following the Breaking of the World which lasted for roughly 1,350 years. During this time, man rebuilt its civilization which had been destroyed by male Aes Sedai who had gone mad. Due to the events leading up to the Breaking of the World, trust was always in short supply, the Ten Nations that controlled the majority of the Westlands emerged from the Breaking.

This era of time lasted until the fragile peace of the new age was shattered by the onslaught of the Trolloc Wars. After the Trolloc Wars ended, the massive amount of lost records resulted in a debate over exactly what year it was under the After Breaking system. This confusion was the reason for the replacement of this system with that of the Free Years.

Age of Legends.name: Age of Legends
Age of Legends.overview: The Age of Legends, also called the Second Age, is the name given to the time preceding the Time of Madness and the Breaking of the World. During this time, channelers were far more common and Aes Sedai - trained channelers, both male and female - were able to make angreal, sa'angreal, and ter'angreal, and sometimes held important civic positions. Channelers also appeared to be much more powerful in general, evidenced by the fact that they were able to do a lot more individually with the One Power and that all of the Forsaken are much, much more powerful individually than today's Aes Sedai. One of the most powerful institutions in the world was the Hall of Servants, to which all channelers were accountable. The most respected, influential and accomplished Aes Sedai in the Hall was Lews Therin Telamon, also called the Dragon by his followers. Additionally, with the sole exception of Elan Morin Tedronai, he was also the most powerful of the Aes Sedai.

Aiel.name: Aiel
Aiel.overview: The Aiel (pronounced: eye-EEL) are a race of people who live between the "wetlanders" in the Westlands and the Sharans in the east, in a desert which the Aiel call the Three-fold Land and which everyone else calls the Aiel Waste. They have earned a reputation as exceptionally skilled warriors; little else is known about them in the wider world. Physically, Aiel can be recognized through their unusually tall height, characteristic pale eyes and light-colored hair, as well as their distinctive clothing.

Aiel law.name: Aiel law
Aiel law.overview: The legal system used by the Aiel is relatively basic, as society is largely kept in check by the honor-based system of ji'e'toh. Most formal laws have something to do with disputes over water, murder, theft, or harm caused to certain persons. It is possible to incur toh without breaking the law, but it is nearly impossible to break the law without incurring some kind of toh.

Aiel terms.name: Aiel terms
Aiel terms.overview: Aiel terms are those terms that the Aiel use in their culture. Many are derived from the Old Tongue.

Aiel War.name: Aiel War
Aiel War.overview: The Aiel War was a massive invasion of the Aiel into the Westlands in numbers never known in prior history. Although it was referred to as a war by Wetlanders, the Aiel simply considered it as punishment for Laman Damodred 's offense.

Aiel warrior societies.name: Aiel warrior societies
Aiel warrior societies.overview:
Aiel warrior societies form a large part of Aiel culture.

Each society has different customs and duties in battle as well as histories and practices that make them unique. Members of the same society will never fight each other, leaving lines of communication open in battle. All female Aiel warriors belong to the Far Dareis Mai, the other eleven societies are strictly male.

Aiel Waste.name: Aiel Waste
Aiel Waste.overview: The Aiel Waste is a desert region named for the Aiel people who live there. The Aiel themselves refer to it as the Three-fold Land.

Aile Dashar.name: Aile Dashar
Aile Dashar.overview: Aile Dashar is an archipelago that is controlled by the Atha'an Miere and Amayar. The islands are located northwest of Arad Doman.

Aile Jafar.name: Aile Jafar
Aile Jafar.overview: Aile Jafar is an archipelago that is controlled by the Atha'an Miere and Amayar. The islands are situated just west of Tarabon. The Seanchan currently occupy the islands.

Aile Somera.name: Aile Somera
Aile Somera.overview: Aile Somera is an archipelago that is controlled by the Atha'an Miere and Amayar. Aile Somara is located west of Toman Head.

Aine.name: Aine
Aine.overview: Aine is the fourth month in the Farede calendar. In most years, it is equivalent to the real world period from March 16 to April 12. The spring equinox/first day of spring is celebrated during this month.

Ajah.name: Ajah
Ajah.overview: Ajah (pronounced: AH-jah) is the name given to one of the seven different groups of Aes Sedai: the Blue, Green, Yellow, Red, White, Gray and Brown. Each Ajah has its own specific purpose and rules, and is governed by its own internal leader(s). Upon joining her Ajah, each new Aes Sedai is given a vine-embroidered shawl fringed in the color of her Ajah of choice.

Akein.name: Akein
Akein.overview: Akein is a horse owned by Tuon Athaem Kore Paendrag, who received it as a gift from Matrim Cauthon.

Akuum.name: Akuum
Akuum.overview: The River Akuum is a major waterway in Arad Doman. It flows out of the Mountains of Mist and flows north and west to its junction with the Dhagon. The city-state of Katar is located south of the river.

Al'cair'rahienallen.name: Al'cair'rahienallen
Al'cair'rahienallen.overview:
Al'cair'rahienallen, meaning "Hill of the Golden Dawn" in the Old Tongue, was the capital city of Almoren, which was part of the Ten Nations.

During their reconstruction after the Breaking of the World, Ogier built a waygate to Al'cair'rahienallen. It later became the city of Cairhien.

Alcair Dal.name: Alcair Dal
Alcair Dal.overview: Alcair Dal is a meeting place for the Aiel clan chiefs. The name means "The Golden Bowl" in the Old Tongue. It is a round canyon that has excellent acoustics and it is located near Rhuidean and Cold Rocks Hold.

Alcruna.name: Alcruna
Alcruna.overview:
Alcruna is a small village located in northern Tarabon near the Almoth Plain. The village is located on the river Andahar upstream of Tanchico.

The Children of the Light massacred the entire village, under the direction of Jaichim Carridin who commanded the Hand of the Light in Tarabon. Alcurna is the village Geofram Bornhald led his Legion to in TGH. Geofram met a Questioner here named Einor Saren and received his orders from him.

Aldael Mountains.name: Aldael Mountains
Aldael Mountains.overview: Aldael Mountains is a mountain range in the Seanchan continent.

Aldazar.name: Aldazar
Aldazar.overview: Aldazar is the horse owned by Furyk Karede. He is a bay horse. His name means "eagle" in the Old Tongue.

Aldeshar.name: Aldeshar
Aldeshar.overview: Aldeshar was a kingdom of the Free Years, founded in the years after the end of the Trolloc Wars. It rose out of the ruins of western Coremanda. During the Free Years Aldeshar was counted as one of the most powerful of the nations, and was the last to fall to Artur Hawkwing during the Consolidation. Aldeshar's territory lies within the modern borders of western Andor and Murandy.

Aldieb.name: Aldieb
Aldieb.overview: Aldieb is a white mare belonging to Moiraine Sedai. Her name means West Wind in the Old Tongue, the wind that brings the spring rains. She is described as very graceful. She has been ridden to and from many places. She has been to the Two Rivers, Shadar Logoth, Caemlyn, the Ways, Fal Dara, the Blight, the Eye of the World, Ghealdan, Illian, Tear, the Aiel Waste, Rhuidean, Jangai Pass, and Cairhien. Following Moiraine's disappearance and presumed death, she was stabled indefinitely at the Sun Palace.

Aleth-Loriel.name: Aleth-Loriel
Aleth-Loriel.overview:
Aleth-Loriel was a place during the time of the Trolloc Wars that is remembered in the song “The Fall of Aleth-Loriel”. Moiraine claims its fall was as a result of the marriage of Rhea and Caar al Thorin al Toren. Its location is not known. The Wheel of Time Companion describes its fall as a result of Mordeth 's evil in Aridhol.

Thom Merrilin sang the song in the Stag and Lion in Baerlon.

Algai'd'siswai.name: Algai'd'siswai
Algai'd'siswai.overview:
Algai'd'siswai or " Dancers of the Spear " in the Old Tongue, is the name given to Aiel warriors, to separate them from civilian Aiel such as Wise Ones, roofmistresses, children, and crafts people.

Algai'd'siswai usually arm themselves with one to four shortspears, a hide buckler, and a horn short bow. Aiel warriors are renowned for their stealth and fighting prowess, and make some of the finest scouts and special tactics squads in the world.

Algode.name: Algode
Algode.overview: Algode is a fiber plant that is only grown in the Aiel Waste.

Alguenya.name: Alguenya
Alguenya.overview:
The River Alguenya rises in the open countryside northwest of Kinslayer's Dagger and flows south past that range into Cairhien. It joins the Erinin just north of the towns of Aringill and Maerone. It is a major river in Cairhien, as it flows through the capital and links it to other trading destinations such as the city of Tear.

During the Free Years, the River Alguenya was the eastern border of the kingdom of Shandalle, the homeland of Artur Hawkwing.

Alianelle Spring.name: Alianelle Spring
Alianelle Spring.overview:
Alianelle Spring is an oasis that lies between Cairhien and Tar Valon.

When Gawyn Trakand and some of his Younglings are near Dumai's Wells, they stop to refill their water reserves as the next opportunity would be Alianelle Spring, four days journey from the Wells.

Alight in the Snow.name: Alight in the Snow
Alight in the Snow.overview: Alight in the Snow is a book belonging to Graendal.

Alindaer.name: Alindaer
Alindaer.overview: Alindaer (pronounced: AL-ihn-dayr) is one of six satellite villages of Tar Valon connected to the city by long white bridges like stone lacework.

Alindaer Gate.name: Alindaer Gate
Alindaer Gate.overview:
Alindaer Gate is the southernmost of the three bridge gates on the west side of the city of Tar Valon leading to the settlement of Alindaer. The gate is about an hour's horse ride from the White Tower.

In the book New Spring, Moiraine and Siuan use the Alindaer Gate to leave Tar Valon on the first day of the census that would be used to find the identity of the Dragon Reborn.

Alkindar.name: Alkindar
Alkindar.overview:
Alkindar is a town in Altara, located on west bank of the River Eldar on the Great North Road, between Ebou Dar and Lugard.

Alkindar has a companion town called Coramen, which is on the east bank of the Eldar. There is a ferry that connects the two towns. When Valan Luca 's Traveling Show is traveling through Altara, they pass through Alkindar and take the ferry across to Coramen. Despite the heavy presence of Seanchan troops on both sides of the river, Tuon Athaem Kore Paendrag keeps her word to Matrim Cauthon not to betray them.

All Summers.name: All Summers
All Summers.overview: All Summers is a prosperous neighborhood in the City of Tear. It was struck by a bubble of evil.

Allorallen.name: Allorallen
Allorallen.overview: Allorallen was a city of Jaramide. During the Trolloc Wars, Allorallen was destroyed, and the entire country fell at the war's end. Arad Doman 's present-day capital Bandar Eban was built over the ruins of Allorallen.

Almandaragal.name: Almandaragal
Almandaragal.overview: Almandaragal is a lopar that is kept by Suroth Sabelle Meldarath.

Almindhra.name: Almindhra
Almindhra.overview: Almindhra was a First Counselor of Tova.

Almizar.name: Almizar
Almizar.overview: Almizar is a town in Amadicia. It lies in farming country a hundred miles southwest of Amador near the Tarabon border. It is a prosperous town with six watchtowers but no wall. The streets are paved with granite blocks, and lined with solid buildings of brick or stone, some gray, some black, many three or four stories high and most roofed in dark slate, the rest in thatch.

Almoren.name: Almoren
Almoren.overview: Almoren was one of the Ten Nations which was destroyed during the Trolloc Wars.

Almoth.name: Almoth
Almoth.overview: Almoth was a nation that arose from the War of the Hundred Years after Artur Hawkwing 's empire collapsed.

Almoth Plain.name: Almoth Plain
Almoth Plain.overview:
Almoth Plain lies on the Aryth Ocean between the nations of Arad Doman to its north and Tarabon to its south, who have squabbled with each other to lay claim to the region for 300 years, since the dissolution of the nation of Almoth. The region is not a united country and has no central government. Each of the independent towns and villages is governed by a mayor and a Village Council. Falme, located on the tip of the Toman Head peninsula, is the region's largest population center. Little more than a large, unwalled town, the streets of Falme are cobblestone and its tall houses are roofed with slate.

Men wear full-sleeved shirts, baggy trousers, and knee-length vests. Women wear long dresses. Both wear long sheepskin coats with the fleece turned in. Clothes are usually decorated with brightly-colored spirals embroidered on the chest.

There is a belief on Toman Head that the armies of Artur Hawkwing sent across the Aryth Ocean centuries ago will one day return. The Watchers Over the Waves have towers on the high cliffs surrounding the harbor at Falme where they keep watch for the return of Hawkwing's descendants.

Alqam.name: Alqam
Alqam.overview:
Alqam is an area on the Seanchan continent.

Kennar Miraj has troops that come from Alqam. People from Alqam have pale eyes.

Altara.name: Altara
Altara.overview:
Altara (al-TAH-rah; /æɫˈtɑːɹɑ/) is a country located in the south-central part of the Westlands.

The sign of Altara is two golden leopards on a field checked four-by-four in red and blue.

Alum.name: Alum
Alum.overview:
Alum is a valuable chemical compound, used for many purposes across the Westlands. The largest alum deposits in the known world come from Ghealdan, and the trade levies and taxes on alum by itself have supported the Ghealdanin throne for generations. Tear and Arafel also have significant deposits which bring significant revenue to those countries.

In 1000 NE large alum deposits were discovered in the vicinity of Danabar, an estate belonging to Elayne Trakand. These deposits were used to guarantee bank loans which helped fund Elayne's claim to the Lion Throne.

The name of the compound is in reference to real world potassium alum which is used in a variety of disciplines from medicine to water treatment.

Amadaine.name: Amadaine
Amadaine.overview:
Amadaine is the seventh month in the Farede calendar. In most years, it is equivalent to the real world period from June 8 to July 6. Asadine occurs on the 3rd, Sunday occurs between the 13th and 14th during Amadaine, the Feast of Maia occurs on the 6th, and Bailene on the 9th.

In 998 NE, The Great Hunt of the Horn was called in Illian on the Feast of Teven during Amadaine.

Amadame.name: Amadame
Amadame.overview: Amadame is the seventh month in the Farede Calendar.

Amadicia.name: Amadicia
Amadicia.overview: Amadicia is a southern nation of the Westlands. It is the home of the Children of the Light.

Amador.name: Amador
Amador.overview: Amador is the capital city of Amadicia. It is also where the Children of the Light have their main fortress. Even though Amador is part of Amadicia the king is not the true ruler of the city. It is one of the large cities in the Westlands that was neither built by Ogier nor founded on an Ogier-built city. It is currently under Seanchan occupation.

Amaetheon.name: Amaetheon
Amaetheon.overview:
Amaetheon occurs on the sixth day of Shaldine.

It is celebrated everywhere except in the Borderlands, this is a feast remembering the dead, but is celebrated in a joyful way.

Amayar.name: Amayar
Amayar.overview:
The Amayar are the peaceful native people of the Sea Folk islands, including Tremalking. They follow a peaceful doctrine known as the Water Way, similar to the Way of the Leaf, but not quite as pacifistic. The Amayar have a strong belief that "reality" is in fact not real, but only a passageway to another existence.

It is not generally known in the wider world, but the Amayar are the craftsmen of the highly valued Sea Folk Porcelain. The Amayar formed during the Breaking of the World. They sought help from the Sea Folk, who gave them gift of passage. Any Amayar who needs passage on a ship is given it for free, although no Amayar has asked for passage in living memory, not liking to travel far from shore. The Amayar are technically ruled by a number of Atha'an Miere Governors, but as the Atha'an Miere seldom leave their ships, the Amayar generally govern themselves with virtually no interference.

The Amayar are physically shorter and much fairer than the Atha'an Miere, with lighter hair and blue or hazel eyes, indicating that they are not kin to their sea-bound friends. Marriage between the Amayar and Atha'an Miere is all but unknown, as each group finds the others' ways to be strange and unpleasant. Despite this, the two get along very well, probably due to the easygoing and fair nature of the Amayar.

Amayar culture is rural. For the most part, they raise sheep, goats, and small cattle, oxen, and horses. Although they do not receive the credit for manufacturing Sea Folk porcelain, they barely give it a thought, as they like the prices that they receive and mainlanders keep away from their homes in their ignorance.

It is believed that all of the Amayar are now dead. When the female statue of the Choedan Kal melted during the Cleansing of saidin, the Amayar interpreted this as the end of the Time of Illusion and committed mass suicide.

Amyrlin's Study.name: Amyrlin's Study
Amyrlin's Study.overview:
The Amyrlin's Study is the location in the White Tower where the Amyrlin Seat conducts most of her business, save for ceremonial events and addresses to the Tower. The study is connected directly to the Amyrlin's personal chambers.

The Study has a tall golden marble fireplace from Kandor, gilded stand lamps, a polished redstone floor from the Mountains of Mist, pale striped wooden panels carved with marvelous beasts and birds, and tall gleaming pearly stone arched windows made of stone salvaged from a submerged city

The Anteroom of the Study is an empty room with the Keeper of the Chronicles 's writing desk and a row of chairs against the wall where Aes Sedai wait to speak to the Amyrlin, and tall outer doors.

The study bears remnants left behind from many past Amyrlin Seats. However, when Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan seized the position, she drastically overhauled the room, adding personal and controversial decor. Elaida added a thronelike chair with an ivory Flame of Tar Valon on the back and a massive writing table carved ornately in triple-linked rings with boxes of Altaran lacquerwork sitting on it. One box was worked in fighting golden hawks in a blue sky with white clouds. Elaida also added a white vase on a white plinth holding roses grown with the One Power, and a painting depicting Rand al'Thor 's duel with Ba'alzamon at Falme above the fireplace.

Amyrlin Seat.name: Amyrlin Seat
Amyrlin Seat.overview: The Amyrlin Seat is the leader of the Aes Sedai in the White Tower in Tar Valon. Her full title is "Watcher of the Seals. The Flame of Tar Valon. The Amyrlin Seat," but she is usually just referred to as the Amyrlin. The word "Amyrlin" is a corruption of the name of an artifact in the Age of Legends called the Ring of Tamyrlin.

Anangore.name: Anangore
Anangore.overview:
Anangore is the ninth largest city in Seanchan.

The city is located in the west of the continent, about one to two hundred miles south of the equator.

Ancarid.name: Ancarid
Ancarid.overview: Ancarid is a town in Seanchan where Furyk Karede 's family comes from.

Ancient and Honorable League of the Nets.name: Ancient and Honorable League of the Nets
Ancient and Honorable League of the Nets.overview:
The Ancient and Honorable League of the Nets is a guild of fishermen in Ebou Dar, the capital of Altara.

Persons belonging to the League are identified by a double earring in their left ear. White stones are used to identify persons who have boats in their service in addition to the boat that they captain. A single white stone would signify that the person owns two boats, one that they captain and one that sails for them under another person.

Jasfer Anan is part of the League. He has two stones in his earring, denoting ownership of three boats.

Ancohima.name: Ancohima
Ancohima.overview:
Ancohima was the capital city of Aelgar, a part of the Ten Nations. It was Ogier-built had a waygate. It's former location is not known.

The name does not have any discernible translation in the Old Tongue.

Andahar.name: Andahar
Andahar.overview: The River Andahar rises in the Mountains of Mist and flows south and west through the kingdom of Tarabon into the Aryth Ocean, flowing into the sea at the city of Tanchico. It is the major east-west trade artery of the country and has many tributaries, which help water the southern, warm kingdom and keep its fields fertile.

Andilay root.name: Andilay root
Andilay root.overview:
Andilay root is helpful for fatigue. It "clear the head and dint the burn in tired muscles."

During the Last Battle, Nynaeve al'Meara successfully used andilay root and simple stitches to help the ailing Alanna Mosvani, whom Moridin had captured and stabbed inside the Pit of Doom to make Rand al'Thor go into the Warder rage upon her death. Thanks to Nynaeve's healing methods, by many a Yellow sister derogatively referred to as "primitive", she was able to prevent Alanna's immediate death.

Andor.name: Andor
Andor.overview:
Andor is a country in the heart of the Westlands. It is the largest and most populous country in the West. After the Borderlands, it also has the largest and most well-trained army.

Formerly a province under gubernatorial rule, it was declared a sovereign nation, and is the oldest and largest of the nations formed after Artur Hawkwing 's empire collapsed. The capital of Andor is Caemlyn.

Angarai'la.name: Angarai'la
Angarai'la.overview: Angarai'la, the River of Souls, is a stream in Shara. Angarai'la flows through a rift valley called Abyrward.

Ankor Dail.name: Ankor Dail
Ankor Dail.overview: Ankor Dail is a city-fortress in Shienar. It is in the southeast of the nation near the easterly source of the River Erinin.

Annals of the Final Night.name: Annals of the Final Night
Annals of the Final Night.overview: Annals of the Final Night by Marsim of Manetheren, is a history of the War of Power. It was studied by Saerin to learn about Mesaana.

Anolle'sanna.name: Anolle'sanna
Anolle'sanna.overview: Anolle'sanna was a city in the nation of Aramaelle, which was part of the Ten Nations. Aside from the name, nothing else is known about it. The name has no discernible translation in the Old Tongue.

Ansaline Gardens.name: Ansaline Gardens
Ansaline Gardens.overview:
The Ansaline Gardens were a location in the Age of Legends where people could visit and relax. It appears to have been a substantial restaurant with an attached gambling area where games such as those involving chinje wheels could be played. Stylized sculptures of humans and animals by the famed artist Cormalinde Masoon were also displayed there. Only the finest food and drink was served at the Gardens.

The Gardens were a favorite haunt of many of the Age, including Balthamel and Graendal before and possibly after they turned to the Shadow. The Gardens were destroyed in the third year of the War of the Shadow.

Graendal created a facsimile of the Gardens in Tel'aran'rhiod for a meeting of the Forsaken in the spring of 1000 NE.

Antaeo.name: Antaeo
Antaeo.overview: The River Antaeo is a tributary of the River Erinin, flowing out of the Black Hills and into that river more than a hundred miles northwest of Tar Valon. The town of Denhuir is located not far north of its headwaters.

Apple Blossoms in the Wind.name: Apple Blossoms in the Wind
Apple Blossoms in the Wind.overview: Apple Blossoms in the Wind is a sword form. It is meant to be used against multiple opponents. It uses three quick strikes to push opponents back.

Apple Blossoms on the Wind.name: Apple Blossoms on the Wind
Apple Blossoms on the Wind.overview: Apple Blossoms on the Wind is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it. Possibly it was intended to read Apple Blossoms in the Wind, another sword form.

April.name: April
April.overview: April is the fourth month in the Gregorian calendar. It occurs in Wheel of Time world during Aine 17 to Adar 18.

Aptarigine Cycle.name: Aptarigine Cycle
Aptarigine Cycle.overview: The Aptarigine Cycle is a story told by Gleeman. It especially appeals to women and girls.

Arad Doman.name: Arad Doman
Arad Doman.overview: Arad Doman is a country that lies to the far west of the Westlands, along the coast of the Aryth Ocean. The sign of Arad Doman is the Sword and Hand.

Arafel.name: Arafel
Arafel.overview: Arafel is one of the four Borderland nations which lie on the threshold of the Great Blight, sitting between Kandor to the west and Shienar to the east. Arafel's flag is made up of three white roses on a field of red, quartered with three red roses on a field of white.

Aramaelle.name: Aramaelle
Aramaelle.overview: Aramaelle was one of the Ten Nations destroyed in the Trolloc Wars. It was one of the Borderlands of its day, although that term did not come into use until some time later.

Arc of the Moon.name: Arc of the Moon
Arc of the Moon.overview: Arc of the Moon is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it. Rand al'Thor used the form during his practice duel against five other men in Caemlyn.

Archer (Constellation).name: Archer (Constellation)
Archer (Constellation).overview: One of the constellations seen over the night skies of the Westlands.

Aren Mador.name: Aren Mador
Aren Mador.overview:
Aren Mador was the capital city of Essenia, which was part of the Ten Nations.

During their reconstruction after the Breaking of the World, Ogier built a waygate to Aren Mador. The city later became Far Madding.

Aridhol.name: Aridhol
Aridhol.overview: Aridhol was one of the Ten Nations, allied after the Breaking of the World to preserve society and what remnants of civilization they could. It was located north of present-day Andor, and south of present-day Saldaea in what is now unclaimed territory.

Arien.name: Arien
Arien.overview:
Arien is a village on the Caemlyn Road in Andor between Whitebridge and Four Kings. It is the next village east of the Grinwell farm, being a full day's walk away.

Rand al'Thor and Mat Cauthon passed through Arien on their way to Caemlyn, and performed at the village's only inn in return for dinner and bed. The next morning they were given a lift for several miles down the road by cart-driver Eazil Forney.

Arindrim.name: Arindrim
Arindrim.overview: A wine-producing area. The Aes Sedai Embassy that Elaida had sent to Cairhien to escort Rand to the White Tower were staying with Lady Arilyn. Egwene went to the palace and, detecting channeling inside, used Air and Fire to replicate Moiraine ’s eavesdropping trick on the inside, and heard that a wine from Arindrim was to be served to the Aes Sedai.

Arinelle.name: Arinelle
Arinelle.overview:
The River Arinelle is one of the largest and most important rivers of the Westlands. It rises in the Mountains of Dhoom and flows south through the Blight and into Saldaea. By the time the river reaches the capital at Maradon it is already navigable by fairly large merchant and trade craft.

The river flows south and west, for a time serving as Saldaea's southern border, before turning into the unclaimed and heavily forested lands between the Mountains of Mist and the River Haevin. The river is joined by several tributaries, including the Ivo, before turning sharply eastwards to form the northern border of Andor. Here, where the river is joined by a smaller trbiutary flowing out of the Mountains of Mist, the river passes the fog-shrouded and cursed city of Shadar Logoth. Traders and merchantment plighing the river give the ancient city a wide berth. After being joined by the Haevin, the Arinelle turns south and passes through the Andoran town of Whitebridge before it flows into the Manetherendrelle.

The Manetherendrelle-Arinelle river netwrok is the largest and most extensive on the continent, and is navigable for roughly three thousand miles from Maradon to the city of Illian. The only bridges over the river are located in Maradon and Whitebridge. All other crossings must be achieved by either ferry or swimming.

The river passes just within viewing distance of the Tower of Ghenjei, a relic from the Age of Legends located between Shadar Logoth and Whitebridge. The purpose and origins of this tower are not known to the river traders, who avoid it.

Aringill.name: Aringill
Aringill.overview:
Aringill is a moderately-sized port town on the west bank of the River Erinin, on the border with Cairhien. Aringill is Andor 's largest and most important port, linking it by water with the city of Tar Valon upriver and with Tear downriver.

There is a smaller Cairhienin port village located on the opposite bank of the Erinin, called Maerone.

During the recent civil war in Cairhien, many thousands of refugees from Cairhien attempted to cross into Andor via Aringill, leading to some difficulties for the government of Andor.

Armahn.name: Armahn
Armahn.overview:
The Armahn is a river flowing through the north of Murandy. It springs from the hills north of the Andoran border and converges with the Reisendrelle north of Lugard.

A group of Andoran and Murandian nobles camp near the River Armahn. They intended to stop Egwene al'Vere and the Rebel Aes Sedai from marching through Andor and Murandy. Possibly connected with the minor Andoran House, Armaghn.

Armies of the Night.name: Armies of the Night
Armies of the Night.overview:
The Armies of the Night was a nickname given by the invading army, under the command of Luthair Paendrag Mondwin, to the native forces of the Seanchan continent during the Conquest.

During the initial clashes with the natives, the sight of thousands of enemy troops entering battle accompanied by strange and exotic animals resembling Shadowspawn, led by Aes Sedai using the One Power as an offensive weapon, led some to believe that the Shadow had seized control of the entire land.

Garbled communications to this effect made their way back to the Westlands via the messenger network maintained by The Watchers Over the Waves from Falme, and formed the basis of some of the legends which grew up concerning the fate of Luthair's forces after contact was lost during the War of the Hundred Years, allbeit with the name Armies of Night.

It was eventually discovered that the Armies of Night were actually nothing more than native forces using exotic animals and led by female channelers. Luthair's forces adopted the tactics of the natives, taming the exotic creatures to use themselves and making controlled use of the One Power through leashed channelers. Ironically, when the Seanchan Hailene and Corenne forces invaded the Westlands in 998 NE, they found their own forces being dubbed the Armies of Night by some of the natives, most notably in Falme where the old legends lingered the longest.

Arran Head.name: Arran Head
Arran Head.overview: Arran Head is the headland at the southeastern tip of Altara 's southern peninsula, at the opposite end of the peninsula to Ebou Dar. It marks the point where Kabal Deep opens out into the Sea of Storms. The Venir Mountains run from Arran Head along the peninsula almost to Ebou Dar.

Arrays.name: Arrays
Arrays.overview:
Arrays is a game wealthy women play using playing cards.

The game is played by laying down cards in descending order to form a specific pattern. Only certain suits can be lain upon certain other suits. One possible pattern is (in order) the Ruler of Cups, the Lord of Winds, the Ruler of Flames, the Lady of Rods, the Five of Coins, and the Four of Cups. It is uncertain whether this is a complete set, as no other cards were mentioned with regard to it, but Aes Sedai Siuan Sanche (of the Blue Ajah ) told Aes Sedai Cetalia Delarme (also of the Blue Ajah) that she thought it was a winning game; however, being a fisherman's daughter (and therefore having never been wealthy enough to afford playing cards), Siuan had only ever read of the game.

Arrow (Birgitte).name: Arrow (Birgitte)
Arrow (Birgitte).overview: Arrow is the name of Birgitte Silverbow 's horse.

Arrow (Moiraine).name: Arrow (Moiraine)
Arrow (Moiraine).overview: Arrow was a bay mare owned by Moiraine Damodred.

Artur Hawkwing's Empire.name: Artur Hawkwing's Empire
Artur Hawkwing's Empire.overview: Between FY 963 and FY 994, the nations of the Westlands were unified under a single ruler, the High King Artur Paendrag Tanreall, better known as Artur Hawkwing. Artur Hawkwing's Empire consisted of the lands between the Great Blight and the Sea of Storms, the Aryth Ocean and the Spine of the World, with the sole exception of the city-state of Tar Valon and its rulers, the Aes Sedai.

Artur Hawkwing's invasion of Shara.name: Artur Hawkwing's invasion of Shara
Artur Hawkwing's invasion of Shara.overview:
Artur Hawkwing 's invasion of Shara ( FY 993 ) was one out of two simultaneous campaigns launched by Hawkwing to conquer lands outside the Westlands, the other being an invasion of the Seanchan continent. The invasion was commanded by one of Hawkwing's daughters, and consisted of 2,000 ships and up to 300,000 troops.

At the time of the invasion, the Sea Folk recorded that the Imperial force landed in several locations on the western and southern coasts of Shara. The Sharans were caught by surprise, and Hawkwing's forces had some initial military success. Later reports stated that the Imperial ships were ablaze in the bays and inlets where they had landed; this could suggest that the Sharans had cut off the Imperial forces' only chance to retreat, trapping them on Sharan soil. The Imperial army was not heard from again, indicating that it had either been annihilated or forced to surrender.

Aryth Ocean.name: Aryth Ocean
Aryth Ocean.overview:
The Aryth Ocean (pronounced: AH-rihth) is the large body of water located to the west of the Westlands. It is called the Eastern Sea by the Seanchan. The Atha'an Miere refuse to cross the Aryth Ocean, claiming that the Isles of the Dead lie on the other side.

Ishamael claims that the ocean is analogous to the World Sea of the Age of Legends. The Aryth Ocean is the largest sea in the world and is considerably larger than the Morenal Ocean that separates Shara from Seanchan. It is unknown why the Seanchan prefer to take the much longer route across the Aryth during their current military campaign, although ocean currents and the weather may play a role.

The Sea Folk island archipelagos of the Aile Jafar, Aile Somera, and Aile Dashar lie in the Aryth Ocean. The island of Tremalking and the peninsula of Windbiter's Finger mark the boundary between the Aryth Ocean and the Sea of Storms. Bandar Eban, Falme, and Tanchico are major ports on the Aryth Ocean in the Westlands, while Shon Kifar and Rampore are major cities on the eastern coast of Seanchan. The town or city of Merinloe also lies close to the Aryth Ocean in Seanchan.

Asadine.name: Asadine
Asadine.overview:
Asadine occurs ten days before Sunday, Amadaine 3; a day of fasting, with no food taken between sunrise and sunset.

Celebrated in the Borderlands and in Cairhien.

Borderlanders consider the day after Asadine to be a lucky day to wed.

Asar Don.name: Asar Don
Asar Don.overview:
The Asar Don was a place in the Age of Legends, only mentioned once by Moghedien as the site of a defeat of the Shadow.

The name contains the word 'don', indicating "importance" in the Old Tongue, though that is not a useful clue. Having it prefixed with 'the' however indicates it was likely not a city, but whether it was a building or an institution or a natural feature is not known.

Asha'man.name: Asha'man
Asha'man.overview: The Asha'man (AH-shah-mahn; /ˈaːʃɑˌmɑn/; Old Tongue: Guardian ) are the male counterpart to current Aes Sedai. They are trained at the Black Tower, a converted farmhouse near Caemlyn. Though they were originally formed by Rand al'Thor, the Asha'man are trained and led by Mazrim Taim.

Ashandarei.name: Ashandarei
Ashandarei.overview:
Ashandarei are polearm weapons with a short sword blade on top. They can be used as for either stabbing or slashing. A two handed weapon, an ashandarei is best used with open space and is ineffective without room to move it.

In Old Tongue, ashandarei literally means "sword spear."

Asinbayar.name: Asinbayar
Asinbayar.overview:
Asinbayar is the fourth largest city in Seanchan.

Asinbayar is located on the north-central peninsula of the Seanchan continent. Suroth Sabelle Meldarath is the High Lady of Asinbayar.

Asnelle.name: Asnelle
Asnelle.overview: Asnelle is a region or fief located in Saldaea, it belonged to the former Queen Tenobia.

Asping rot.name: Asping rot
Asping rot.overview: Asping rot is an herb that can be brewed into a tea. It is a very potent poison. A single drop of asping rot can kill quickly, though peacefully, within an hour of taking it. Verin Mathwin used the tea to get around her dark oaths and pass on information to Egwene al'Vere.

Assemblage.name: Assemblage
Assemblage.overview:
The Assemblage is a governing body in Illian that shares power with the Council of Nine and the King. The Assemblage was created by Nicoli Merseneos den Ballin at the same time as the Council of Nine.

It is assumed that the Assemblage focuses primarily on matters of trade. It is not known what has happened to their status or members after Rand al'Thor gained the Laurel Crown.

Assembly of Lords.name: Assembly of Lords
Assembly of Lords.overview:
The Assembly of Lords is the ruling council of the kingdom of Tarabon and is, in theory, one of three balanced forces which controls the kingdom, alongside the King and the Panarch.

The Assembly is a hold-over from the nation of Balasun, which controlled much of Tarabon's territory before the time of Artur Hawkwing. The Assembly was resurrected by Haren Maseed and Tazenia Nerenhald, the first Panarch and Queen of the new nation, in FY 1006. Over the next five centuries the power of the monarch gradually outstripped that of the Panarch and Assembly, however.

By 500 NE it had become tradition that the monarch was always male and the Panarch always female. The Assembly had lost most of its temporal and law-making powers aside from the ability to elect a new Panarch.

Atha'an Miere.name: Atha'an Miere
Atha'an Miere.overview: The Sea Folk, or more properly Atha'an Miere (ah-thah-AHN mee-EHR; /a.θɑˈʔɑːn miˈɛɹ/) Old Tongue: People of the Sea ": pronounced a-tha-AHN mee-AIR), are a seafaring people who live on ships and the islands in the Aryth Ocean and Sea of Storms; indeed, they take every effort to be born, give birth, marry, and die on board their ships. They only show up on the mainland to trade goods, until prophecy seemed to be fulfilled (see Coramoor, below). They typically have a dark complexion, and are seen as "exotic" by mainlanders.

Attack on the Black Tower.name: Attack on the Black Tower
Attack on the Black Tower.overview: The Attack on the Black Tower was a failed attempt by Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan to vanquish Rand al'Thor 's growing Asha'man army at the source.

Atuan's Mill.name: Atuan's Mill
Atuan's Mill.overview:
Atuan's Mill is a town on Toman Head, a few days east of Falme.

Residents of the town are fearful after a visit by the Seanchan invaders. They provide inconsistent and imprecise information on the invaders to the party chasing Fain to get back the Horn of Valere and Ruby-hilted dagger.

Aturo's Orchard.name: Aturo's Orchard
Aturo's Orchard.overview: Aturo's Orchard is a small village on the edge of Almoth Plain and Toman Head.

August.name: August
August.overview: August is the eighth month in the Gregorian calendar. It occurs in Wheel of Time world during Tammaz 26 to Maigdhal 28.

Avharin Market.name: Avharin Market
Avharin Market.overview: The Avharin Market is a marketplace in Far Madding, possibly named for Einion Avharin. The Golden Wheel Inn is located just off the Avharin market.

Aybara clan.name: Aybara clan
Aybara clan.overview: The Aybara clan is a family in the Two Rivers.

Ayyad.name: Ayyad
Ayyad.overview: The Ayyad are the people in Shara who can channel the One Power. They live in towns separate from the rest of the Sharan people; other Sharans intruding in these towns are killed. Permission must be granted for the Ayyad to leave these places, although anyone seeing one outside the village would just assume one had permission anyway. They tattoo their faces to allow identification; anyone bearing these tattoos are confined and isolated to Ayyad villages. All their lives they remain separate in the villages according to Jain Farsrider. Once in a while a woman is seen on the outskirts of the village.

Baerlon.name: Baerlon
Baerlon.overview:
Baerlon is a town in Andor where the ores from the Mountains of Mist are transported for smelting.

Several other communities in the area have been ignored so the crown of Andor could hold on to this land, which is very important to the economy of Andor.

The town is surrounded by a log wall nearly twenty feet tall, with large gates that open only from sunup to sundown, a safety precaution followed because the city lies in the middle of the wilderness.

Baerlon is the town in which Rand first meets Min, and where Moiraine uses the Mirror of Mists to escape from an impending attack from the Children of the Light at the Caemlyn Gate.

Min was raised in an old mining community outside of Baerlon.

Baijan'm'hael.name: Baijan'm'hael
Baijan'm'hael.overview: Baijan'm'hael is a word in the Old Tongue meaning "Attack Leader." It is a title in the Asha'man military rank that was held by Manel Rochaid before his death and is considered to be below Tsorovan'm'hael.

Bailene.name: Bailene
Bailene.overview:
Bailene is celebrated on the ninth day of Amadaine.

It is celebrated in Arad Doman, Tarabon, Amadicia, and in Tear.

Balasun.name: Balasun
Balasun.overview: Balasun was a kingdom that existed in the Free Years. It was established after the end of the Trolloc Wars, rising out of the former territories of Aelgar and the southernmost stretches of Safer. After the War of the Hundred Years its territory became part of the kingdom of Tarabon, although the southernmost stretches were consumed by the wilderness of the Shadow Coast.

Banath people.name: Banath people
Banath people.overview: The Banath people were a group of savages roaming on a location known as Almoth Plain in the Third Age.

Bandar Eban.name: Bandar Eban
Bandar Eban.overview:
Bandar Eban is the capital of Arad Doman and the prime port city of the northwest. It is located on the coast of the Aryth Ocean, lying on the mouth of the river Dhagon.

Massive gates penetrated the city walls and opened up to streets of packed earth, with wooden boardwalks at the sides. Arandi Square, the main city square, was set with copper fountains in the shape of horses leaping from a frothy wave. The buildings were tall and square, shaped like boxes stacked atop one another. Rows of square wooden houses filled the city, rolling down a gentle incline to the massive port, the widest part of the city. Banners flew above, or hung from every building, some used as business signs, family names, or location names. The wealthy part of the city was located on the heights in the east. One of the grandest mansions was the seat of House Chadmar. There was a king's palace, but it was inferior to the homes of the Council of Merchants. Bandar Eban's Terhana Library was considered to be among the best in the world. According to Cadsuane Melaidhrin one of the greatest as well.

Banikhan Mountains.name: Banikhan Mountains
Banikhan Mountains.overview:
The Banikhan Mountains are a range of peaks in Saldaea lying close to World's End. They are also known as the Sea Wall. Ice peppers grown on the landward slopes of the mountains, and gemstones are mined from some the peaks as well. The town of Kayacun lies close to the mountains.

In the spring of 1000 NE, al'Lan Mandragoran began his epic ride across the length of the Borderlands near Kayacun in preparation for Tarmon Gai'don.

Banner-General.name: Banner-General
Banner-General.overview: The Banner-General was a rank in the armies used during the period a few centuries before the Trolloc Wars until the War of the Hundred Years that commanded a number of troops known as a Banner. This comprised of either 1500 horsemen or 3000 infantry.

Banner.name: Banner
Banner.overview: A banner is a military unit led by a Banner-General. There are two types of banners, foot and horse.

Banner of Light.name: Banner of Light
Banner of Light.overview:
The Banner of Light is the most commonly used banner by the Dragon Reborn and his forces. The banner's symbol is that of the ancient Aes Sedai before the Breaking. In the time period of the books, it is also called al'Thor's Banner.

The False Dragon Guaire Amalasan used a modified version of the Banner of Light during his conquests, with the only difference being that the background was blue instead of red.

Bannerman.name: Bannerman
Bannerman.overview: Bannerman is a non-commissioned officer rank in the armies of the Westlands. It has been in use since the time of the War of Power in conflicts such as the Trolloc Wars and the War of the Hundred Years. The use of it declined following the War of the Hundred Years. Nations on the main continent no longer fielded the large armies which required the position. The use of it has resurfaced recently and can be found in the following armies: the Band of the Red Hand and the Queen's Guards of Andor. It was brought back into usage by Matrim Cauthon and Birgitte Silverbow respectively.

Barashta.name: Barashta
Barashta.overview: Barashta was a major city of Eharon between the Breaking of the World and the Trolloc Wars. It was located in the Rahad section of Ebou Dar.

Barsabba.name: Barsabba
Barsabba.overview:
Barsabba is a city in Seanchan.

Suroth Sabelle Meldarath is High Lady of Barsabba.

Barsine.name: Barsine
Barsine.overview: Barsine was a city of Jaramide, one of the Ten Nations. It was famed for its golden spires and the lace it exported. Barsine was the first major city destroyed during the Trolloc Wars circa 1000 AB, and its fall was the first sign that the Trolloc raids were of a greater intensity and more significant than normal.

Basharande.name: Basharande
Basharande.overview: Basharande was a kingdom of the Free Years. It was founded after the end of the Trolloc Wars, and was established on the former territory of Jaramide. It was later absorbed by the growing might of Artur Hawkwing's Empire. Basharande was one of the Borderlands in its day and also a militarily strong nation. The lands it once held are now controlled by Saldaea.

Bashere (location).name: Bashere (location)
Bashere (location).overview: Bashere is a geographical region of the Borderland nation of Saldaea, presumed to be the seat of rule for House Bashere. Its lord is Davram Bashere. Its name may or may not derive from the old nation of Basharande which existed in the western Borderlands during the Free Years.

Battle at Lord Algarin's manor.name: Battle at Lord Algarin's manor
Battle at Lord Algarin's manor.overview:
The Battle at Lord Algarin's manor was a skirmish between shadowspawn and the camp of the Dragon Reborn. The shadowspawn were deployed by the order of Sammael, or someone who looked like him, to the displeasure of Moridin.

Tens of thousands of Trollocs, led by a hundred Myrddraal, launched a surprise attack on the Dragon Reborn and his forces at Lord Algarin Pendaloan 's manor. Logain Ablar had just finished relaying important information to Rand al'Thor when they sensed the presence of shadowspawn. Concurrently, Loial and the other Ogier spotted the incoming force and raised the alarm, hoping to warn Rand and the others before it was too late. In addition to Rand, Min Farshaw, Cadsuane Melaidhrin, Verin Mathwin, Nynaeve al'Meara, Alivia, Logain, and an unspecified number of Asha'man with their bonded Aes Sedai, there were fifty Maidens of the Spear led by Nandera, and a force of Saldaeans present in some of the outbuildings surrounding the manor.

Opening himself to saidin, Rand was horrified when Lews Therin seized control away from him. He began weaving a complex array of Earth, Air and Fire into what he finally remembered as Blossoms of Fire. The weave created a thin, tall shaft of fire that gave off a shrill whine. When the last thread of air completed the weave, the shafts exploded into columns of flame thirty feet wide. Next, Lews Therin wove Deathgates, moving gateways that opened and closed regularly as they cut into the Trolloc lines. Rand later explained that shadowspawn cannot survive passage through a gateway and that pockets of Trollocs would be found dead in random locations. When Rand finally answered the man's call for him to raise his hands, Lews Therin wove one last weave from the Age of Legends, creating Arrows of Fire. These appeared as red filaments that seemed to flash into existence from each of his fingertips. Where they struck, they boiled and destroyed flesh, blowing holes in the bodies of Trollocs. The Asha'man present copied the new weaves, using them with deadly effect. Logain would later angrily ask if he was saving these weaves for his favorites like Taim, chafing at Rand's unwillingness to see that the M'hael was building his own Black Tower.

Despite being rent with lightning and fire, the Trollocs managed to set fire to the buildings the Saldaeans were staying in. Rand pleaded with Lews Therin to put the fires out but to no avail. As Lews Therin continued to bring death to the shadowspawn, Rand yelled to Logain to extinguish the fires and save the Saldaeans. After killing a Myddraal that nearly took his head off, he realized that the battle was over and all of the shadowspawn dead. Rand soon found that Lews Therin would not release the Source. Instead, he was drawing in as much saidin as he could safely hold without burning himself out. When Logain pointed this out to the rest of the company, they all reacted with great concern. Lews Therin finally agreed to release when Rand promised that they could die together at Tarmon Gai'don.

Battle near Shadar Logoth.name: Battle near Shadar Logoth
Battle near Shadar Logoth.overview:
The Battle near Shadar Logoth occurred in 1000 NE, when Rand al'Thor planned to finally cleanse saidin of the Dark One 's taint using the power of the Choedan Kal and the aid of Nynaeve al'Meara.

For the cleansing of saidin Rand choose his seat on a hill some miles north of the dead city of Shadar Logoth, using the power of the two sa'angreal to direct and nullify the taint against the evil residing in the damned city.

However, the massive beacon of saidin and saidar drawn through the Choeden Kal made them an easy target for every one of the Forsaken and possibly other Darkfriend channelers to attack while they were vulnerable. As a countermeasure, several of Rand's allies, including Aes Sedai and Asha'man, stood ready to defend Rand and Nynaeve against the forces of the Shadow.

Battle of Cuallin Dhen.name: Battle of Cuallin Dhen
Battle of Cuallin Dhen.overview:
The Battle of Cuallin Dhen was fought circa 300 NE between the nations of Andor and Tear. The location of this battle and what war it was fought during is not known.

The battle had turned into a rout of the Andoran forces when the then-Queen Modrellein rode, reportedly alone and unarmed, into the midst of the Tairen army while carrying Andor's banner. This encouraged the Andorans to regroup and attack, and win the day. Modrellein's actions are generally held as an example of the valor expected of a Queen of Andor even in times of war.

Battle of Dumai's Wells.name: Battle of Dumai's Wells
Battle of Dumai's Wells.overview:
The Battle of Dumai's Wells occurs at the beginning of 1000 NE. An extremely bloody battle, the One Power was used to devastating effect, and the world was changed forever in the end as the first Aes Sedai swore fealty to the Dragon Reborn, prompted by both his ta'veren twisting of chance, and the threat of Mazrim Taim and the Asha'man.

The battle began at Dumai's Wells, when the Shaido attacked the loyalist Tower Aes Sedai's wagon train and escalated when Rand's forces, led by Perrin Aybara, accompanied by the Salidar Aes Sedai from the Caemlyn Embassy, arrived to rescue him. Mazrim Taim, acting independently of Perrin, arrived during the battle with the Asha'man via gateways; the Asha'man were responsible for breaking the ranks of Shaido attempting to reach Rand after their betrayal of the Tower Aes Sedai.

Battle of Emond's Field.name: Battle of Emond's Field
Battle of Emond's Field.overview: The Battle of Emond's Field consisted of a series of raids on the town of Emond's Field by Trolloc forces brought to the Two Rivers through the Ways. The attacks culminated in a final confrontation between the people of Emond’s Field and the Trolloc armies after Loial and Gaul succeeded in permanently locking the Manetheren Waygate, cutting off reinforcements. During the ensuing battle, the Emond’s Field defenders were nearly overrun by overwhelming numbers but were saved from annihilation by the timely arrival of unexpected reinforcements from both Deven Ride and Watch Hill.

Battle of Falme.name: Battle of Falme
Battle of Falme.overview:
The Battle of Falme is the name given to the fight on Toman Head where the Seanchan Ever Victorious Army was first defeated by the allied forces. During the battle Matrim Cauthon blew the Horn of Valere, forging a link with the relic and summoning the legendary Heroes of the Horn to fight under the Dragon Banner, purging the Seanchan from Falme and driving back the Whitecloaks.

At the same time Rand al'Thor did battle with Ishamael in the sky, emerging victorious while also receiving the first of his two never-healing wounds.

Battle of Four Kings.name: Battle of Four Kings
Battle of Four Kings.overview:
The Battle of Four Kings was fought during the War of the Hundred Years in what was then the western part of Andor.

In FY 1063 no less than four rival kings envious of the growing power of Andor united their armies and invaded the kingdom, marching on Caemlyn. Queen Maragaine led the Andoran army into battle, meeting them some distance west of the River Cary. In a furious battle, in which Queen Maragaine is often depicted personally leading a charge, the Andorans broke the invading force and routed it, securing the future survival of the kingdom.

The battle is noteworthy as one of the two most serious recorded threats to Andor's survival during the War of the Hundred Years, the other being the invasion of Andor launched by Esmara Getares thirty years later.

The town of Four Kings later grew up on the site of the battle.

Battle of Jeramel.name: Battle of Jeramel
Battle of Jeramel.overview:
The Battle of Jeramel was a major military engagement fought in early 1000 NE between the armies of Amadicia, under King Ailron, and the invading forces of the Seanchan. The numbers involved on either side are not known, but it is known that the Children of the Light under Lord Captain Commander Eamon Valda fought alongside the Amadician troops, while the Seanchan were accompanied by sul'dam and damane.

The battle was fought near the Amadician town of Jeramel and resulted in a crushing defeat for the Amadicians, mainly due to the enemy's use of the One Power. The Amadician army was destroyed and King Ailron was killed in the fighting. The Children of the Light suffered significant losses but were able to withdraw without routing.

In the aftermath of the battle, a new king loyal to the Seanchan was appointed. Eamon Valda signed a peace treaty and entered into an alliance with the Seanchan, but this proved unpopular with his troops. When Captain Galad Damodred slew Valda in single combat, the remaining Children proclaimed him Lord Captain Commander and followed his lead in breaking the alliance and leaving the country to find allies prepared to fight against the Seanchan. However, the Hand of the Light under High Inquisitor Rhadam Asunawa split off from the Children at this point, presumably to reaffirm their alliance with the Seanchan. Many of them were either killed or were left behind when Damodred took the Children out of Amadicia.

Battle of Kolesar.name: Battle of Kolesar
Battle of Kolesar.overview:
The Battle of Kolesar is a military engagement remembered by Mat Cauthon.

During this conflict, Classen Bayor lost his cavalry in some marches.

Battle of Maighande.name: Battle of Maighande
Battle of Maighande.overview:
The Battle of Maighande was fought in 1301 AB and is counted as the single most decisive battle of the Trolloc Wars. This engagement broke the back of the Shadowspawn armies and began the slow process of driving their remnants from the Westlands, which continued for the next fifty years.

The battle came approximately ten years after the fourth but most devastating attempt by the Shadowspawn to seize Tar Valon. The Amyrlin Seat, Rashima Kerenmosa, who served as both a military leader and general as well as a politician, is believed to be the architect of Maighande. The surviving remnants of the Ten Nations brought their armies, bolstered by new tactics, to bear against the Trolloc forces.

The location of the battlefield at Maighande is not known. The precise number of troops involved is also unknown, although tales and legends of the battle suggest it was the biggest battle of the wars and was epic in scope, suggesting hundreds of thousands of soldiers were present. The Ten Nations were badly bloodied by this time, as both Manetheren and Aridhol had fallen, and Aramaelle, Almoren and Coremanda had either fallen or were on the verge of collapse by this point. We can only know then that troops from Tar Valon, Aelgar, Eharon, Essenia, Jaramide and Safer (which all survived the wars, albeit not for long) fought at the battle. If this were the case, Tar Valon was completely surrounded by forces of the Shadow by the time of the battle.

The battle was a significant victory for the Light, the greatest victory over the Shadow since the War of the Shadow. It was not matched until the Battle of Talidar a thousand years later, and maybe not until the Last Battle.

Rashima Kerenmosa died in the battle, along with her five Warders. According to legend, a vast pile of Trolloc and Myrddraal corpses surrounded their bodies, along with the bodies of nine Dreadlords.

Battle of Malden.name: Battle of Malden
Battle of Malden.overview: The Battle of Malden was fought in early 1000 NE, in and around the town of Malden in central-western Altara.

Battle of Maradon.name: Battle of Maradon
Battle of Maradon.overview: The Battle of Maradon is series of battles in the defense of the capital city of Saldaea against a massive Trolloc force advancing south from the Blight. The forces of the Light, led by Great Captain Rodel Ituralde fought a retreating battle attempting to contain the invasion and prevent the Trolloc force from breaking through to ravage the southern lands. Heavily outnumbered, the forces of the Light were eventually forced to conduct fighting in the streets of Maradon, trying to cause as much damage to the Trolloc forces as possible, before help arrived led by Rand al'Thor, who was finally able to turn back the Trolloc tide and save what remained of the city.

Battle of Soremaine.name: Battle of Soremaine
Battle of Soremaine.overview: The Battle of Soremaine is the site of one of the major battles of the Whitecloak War.

Battle of Talidar.name: Battle of Talidar
Battle of Talidar.overview: The Battle of Talidar was a major battle fought between the people of the Westlands, led by the High King Artur Hawkwing, and an invading army of Shadowspawn. It is the largest and most significant victory of the Light over the Shadow since the Battle of Maighande during the Trolloc Wars.

Battle of Tar Valon.name: Battle of Tar Valon
Battle of Tar Valon.overview: The Battle of Tar Valon was a major engagement fought in the spring of 1000 NE between the White Tower Aes Sedai and the Seanchan. The battle proved to be the catalyst for the healing of the Aes Sedai following their year-long schism.

Battle of Tarwin's Gap.name: Battle of Tarwin's Gap
Battle of Tarwin's Gap.overview:
The Battle of Tarwin's Gap was an engagement between the forces of Shienar and invading Shadowspawn. Although the Shienaran forces were severely outnumbered, they emerged victorious when Rand al'Thor emerged as Dragon Reborn at the Eye of the World and destroyed much of the Shadowspawn army.

Prior to the battle, the situation had looked bleak to the Shienarans, with Agelmar Jagad being pessimistic about the chances of victory. Nevertheless, the Shienarans were determined to either stop the invasion at Tarwin's Gap, or die trying. In the end, the Shienaran army had to do very little fighting before the Shadowspawn were forced to flee.

Battle of the Shining Walls.name: Battle of the Shining Walls
Battle of the Shining Walls.overview:
The Battle of the Shining Walls was the final and decisive battle of the Aiel War, fought in the final month of 978 NE outside the Shining Walls of Tar Valon, between four clans of the Aiel and armies from ten of the fourteen kingdoms of the Westlands, who had been unified as the grandiosely-titled Grand Alliance.

Those who remember the battle have labelled it the Blood Snow, particularly those who participated in it as it was fought in freezing winter conditions, and the loss of life in the battle was tremendous.

Battle of the Tarendrelle River.name: Battle of the Tarendrelle River
Battle of the Tarendrelle River.overview: The Battle of the Tarendrelle River was a conflict that occurred in the middle years of the Trolloc Wars between the nation of Manetheren and a vast host of Shadowspawn. It resulted in a victory for the forces of Shadow and led to the subsequent invasion and destruction of Manetheren.

Bay of Remara.name: Bay of Remara
Bay of Remara.overview: The Bay of Remara is a large bay at the far southeast corner of the Westlands at the end of the Spine of the World. The Drowned Lands lie to the east. Tear ends at the western shore at the city of Godan. The city-state of Mayene lies on the peninsula to the southeast.

Bearer of the Sword of the Thousand Lake.name: Bearer of the Sword of the Thousand Lakes
Bearer of the Sword of the Thousand Lake.overview:
Bearer of the Sword of the Thousand Lakes is a title Lan Mandragoran claimed for himself just prior to ordering his army of twelve thousand to charge one hundred fifty thousand Shadowspawn at Tarwin's Gap.

Though no specific mention of a Sword of the Thousand Lakes is made in the histories, Malkier was described as "a kingdom necklaced by a thousand lakes." The same document also reports that prior to moving him out of the country, Lan was given the ancient sword of the Malkieri kings; a Power-wrought blade. It is likely then that the sword given to him as a babe in arms was that same Sword of a Thousand Lakes that he cites as he claims this title.

Beat the Brushes.name: Beat the Brushes
Beat the Brushes.overview: Beat the Brushes is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Bel Tine.name: Bel Tine
Bel Tine.overview:
Bel Tine, also known as Festival, is the Westlands celebration of spring's arrival.

It is not set to a specific date, and comes later in northern lands than in the south. It's typically celebrated "when spring had well and truly arrived, the first lambs born and the first crop up."

The night preceding Bel Tine is known as Winternight.

Bela.name: Bela
Bela.overview:
Bela is the shaggy brown mare owned by Tam al'Thor, ridden by Egwene al'Vere on Bel Tine 998 NE in her escape from the Two Rivers after Trollocs attacked Emond's Field seeking Rand, Mat, and Perrin. Egwene rode the horse to Tar Valon, and Siuan Sanche used her to escape from Tar Valon.

Egwene also rode a dream version of Bela to Salidar from the Aiel camp in Cairhien through Tel'aran'rhiod. Egwene rode the real Bela out to conduct her nighttime raid on the chains outside Tar Valon during the siege.

Bela was also ridden by Siuan twice: once when Siuan escaped the White Tower, and the second time when she went into Tar Valon to rescue Egwene. She can be assumed to have returned to the White Tower with the rest of the rebel Aes Sedai.

Bela is taken on Faile 's ill-fated mission to fetch the Horn of Valere. After Olver is left with the Horn, he jumps on her to escape the Trolloc camp. She is hit in the flank by a Trolloc arrow and dies. However, according to "The Wheel of Time Companion", Bela unaccountably survived.

Bellon.name: Bellon
Bellon.overview: Bellon is a town in Amadicia. It lies twenty miles east of Amador on the River Gaean. It has an inn named Bellon Ford Inn.

Bent Peak.name: Bent Peak
Bent Peak.overview: The Bent Peak is a sept of the Daryne Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Bent Valley Hold.name: Bent Valley Hold
Bent Valley Hold.overview: Bent Valley Hold is a settlement belonging to the Haido sept of the Shaarad Aiel in the Aiel Waste. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Bethal.name: Bethal
Bethal.overview: Bethal is a good sized town in Ghealdan. Most of the buildings there have slate roofs.

Bili Under the Hill.name: Bili Under the Hill
Bili Under the Hill.overview: Bili Under the Hill is a children's book about a hero named Bili. He went searching for gold and received three answers. The next day, he found that ten years had passed and he possessed a bag that was always full of gold.

Biteme.name: Biteme
Biteme.overview: A biteme is a small, almost invisible biting insect. Their buzzing can be very annoying.

Bitter Water.name: Bitter Water
Bitter Water.overview: The Bitter Water is a sept of the Taardad Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Black Ajah.name: Black Ajah
Black Ajah.overview:
The Black Ajah of the Aes Sedai is a secret Ajah, consisting of Darkfriend Aes Sedai who masquerade as sisters of other Ajahs and who have forsaken their Three Oaths in order to serve the Dark One. Reports of its existence have been vehemently denied by the White Tower for millennia, however the mass execution of most Black sisters among the rebel Aes Sedai proves the Black Ajah does indeed exist. The leader of the Black Ajah is a very powerful woman, who sits at the head of the Supreme Council and answers directly to the Forsaken.

Although they are channelers, the Black Ajah members do not necessarily stand higher than non-channeling Darkfriends. The Black Ajah have tried to assert their superiority over non-channelers before, but failed; despite the One Power, many Black Sisters fell to assassins, and they were forced to publicly admit they were merely the equal of other Darkfriends.

Black Cliffs.name: Black Cliffs
Black Cliffs.overview: The Black Cliffs is a sept of the Nakai Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Black Fever.name: Black Fever
Black Fever.overview:
The Black Fever was a plague that devastated the Westlands over the course of several years, culminating in FY 939. The plague moved across the continent from east to west and killed over ten percent of the population, including the King and Queen of a small kingdom named Shandalle. Their deaths allowed their son, Artur Paendrag Tanreall, to assume the throne. The plague left much of the continent weak and divided, and the false Dragon Guaire Amalasan was able to take advantage of this to conquer vast stretches of territory before opposition could assemble against him.

The Black Fever was the prelude to the War of the Second Dragon and the rise of Artur Hawkwing.

Black Hills.name: Black Hills
Black Hills.overview: The Black Hills is a region that lie between the Borderlands and the Caralain Grass. There is at least one village in this area, called Denhuir.

Black Lance's Last Strike.name: Black Lance's Last Strike
Black Lance's Last Strike.overview:
Black Lance's Last Strike is a sword form. It is a simple form, depending entirely upon speed to draw a sword from the scabbard and thrust it into the enemy's neck. It is, however, an all-or-nothing move; if it fails, the swordsman usually dies.

Gareth Bryne used this form to kill an assassin sneaking up on Siuan Sanche during the Seanchan raid on the White Tower. The assassin was a Seanchan Bloodknife.

Black Oaths.name: Black Oaths
Black Oaths.overview:
The Black Oaths are the oaths that are sworn on the Oath Rod by the Black Ajah after they use it to un-swear their original Three Oaths as Aes Sedai. The Oaths are as follows:

- I shall obey all commands given by those placed above me in service to the Great Lord ;
- I shall prepare for the day of the Great Lord's return;
- I shall hold close the secrets of the Black Ajah, unto the hour of my death.

These Oaths make it effectively impossible for someone to betray the Black Ajah. Even though Sheriam Bayanar only joined the Black Ajah hoping it would advance her political career, these oaths forced her to steal the dreamer ter'angreal after Mesaana ordered her to do so.

However, the Black Ajah Hunters were able to force Talene Minly into confessing by making her forswear all oaths that bound her on the Oath Rod, and then having her re-swear the Three Oaths.

Verin Mathwin also found a loophole to circumvent the third Oath by poisoning herself and revealing the secrets of the Black Ajah to Egwene al'Vere as she was dying, as the Oath forbids her from betrayal until the hour of her death, rather than the very moment of death.

Re-swearing different Oaths also means that even though the Black Ajah are freed from the original oaths, they retain an ageless look and a shortened lifespan by still being bound to the Oath Rod; thus their appearances and lifespans never rouse suspicion from other Aes Sedai. Indeed, this is partly the reason why Ishamael devised the Black Oaths when he created the Black Ajah, other than wanting to permanently bind the Black Ajah to the Shadow.

Black Pebbles on Snow.name: Black Pebbles on Snow
Black Pebbles on Snow.overview: Black Pebbels on Snow is a sword form. Aside from the fact that it was used by an unnamed assassin on Lan Mandragoran, nothing is known about it.

Black Rock.name: Black Rock
Black Rock.overview: The Black Rock are a sept of the Shaarad Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Black Tower.name: Black Tower
Black Tower.overview: The Black Tower is the headquarters of the Asha'man, the organization of male channelers started by Rand al'Thor and trained by Mazrim Taim. It originated as a converted farmhouse located less than two leagues south of Caemlyn.

Black Water.name: Black Water
Black Water.overview: The Black Water is a sept of the Nakai Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Black Years.name: Black Years
Black Years.overview:
