The Fingers of the Dragon is the delta formed by the River Erinin flowing into the Sea of Storms. The city of Tear lies just north of the Fingers. By order of the High Lords of Tear, no town or city is allowed to be constructed further south along the Fingers lest it threatens Tear's supremacy.

Tairen pilots are required by law for any ship attempting to navigate the Fingers, although the Sea Folk are capable of traversing the Fingers without any outside help and the presence of a pilot is a mere formality, and the pilots are generally ignored.

The Fingers are also used by the occasional fisherman. One fisherman allegedly found several pieces of cuendillar in the Fingers.

Finn.name: Finn
Finn.overview:
Collectively, the name of two species of extradimensional humanoids, the Aelfinn and their counterparts the Eelfinn. Each live in a dimension quite different from that of the real world, seemingly apart yet connected.

The Tower of Ghenjei leads to the realms of the Finn. Each can also be reached individually using a certain ter'angreal.

It appears that multiple ta'veren can physically disrupt the connection of the ter'angreal in Tear to the Aelfinn's realm as seen by the discord created when Mat and Rand both entered the door as well as by Moiraine 's comment following the incident.

Fireheart.name: Fireheart
Fireheart.overview: Fireheart is the name of Elayne Trakand 's horse.

Firewisp.name: Firewisp
Firewisp.overview: Firewisp is a horse, formerly belonging to a soldier in the Band of the Red Hand. Firewisp is now owned by Edesina Azzedin.

First Age.name: First Age
First Age.overview: The First Age, the Age before the Age of Legends, ended many thousands of years before the time of the novels. Little is known of this period of history, save that the portal stones come from this epoch. There are stories of this time which gleemen still tell, although they are no doubt heavily corrupted from the original events. It is implied that this era is the one in which the readers live - that is to say modern day, real life. This view is contested by some, but is hinted at by several legends mentioned throughout the series and certain artifacts in the Panarch's Palace.

First Among Servants.name: First Among Servants
First Among Servants.overview: In the Age of Legends, the First Among the Servants was the equivalent of what the Aes Sedai (Servants of All) called the Amyrlin Seat in the Third Age. Lews Therin Telamon was the First Among the Servants.

First Battle of Cairhien.name: First Battle of Cairhien
First Battle of Cairhien.overview:
The First Battle of Cairhien was fought in 976 NE during the opening weeks of the Aiel War. Having achieved complete surprise over the Cairhienin forces, the Aiel clans under Janduin marched directly on the capital. During a furious engagement the main army of Cairhien was defeated and put to rout. The Aiel sacked the city, burning the Topless Towers but ensuring that no damage came to Cairhien's Royal Library.

When it became clear that King Laman Damodred had escaped the battle and was fleeing south towards Tear, the Aiel abandoned their assault on the city to pursue him, the start of a long, two-year chase that would eventually lead to the Battle of the Shining Walls.

The Second Battle of Cairhien was fought twenty-three years later during the Shaido War. At that time, the city of Cairhien still showed signs of damage from the first battle, such as not having completed repairs to the Topless Towers and the large number of displaced farmers living in the slums of the Foregate.

First Chair.name: First Chair
First Chair.overview: First Chair is the title of the Head of the Brown Ajah Council. Unlike the rest of the Ajahs, the Brown does not have a single Head but a council, with the leader of this council considered first among equals, but with at least some additional authority when compared to other Brown Ajah Council members, as evidenced by her ability to unilaterally select Juilaine, one of the Too Young Sitters.

First Gardener.name: First Gardener
First Gardener.overview: First Gardener is the Seanchan title given to the leader of the Gardeners, the Ogier branch of the Deathwatch Guard. The title is currently held by Hartha.

First Lieutenant.name: First Lieutenant
First Lieutenant.overview:
First Lieutenant is a military rank in the Ever Victorious Army of the Seanchan.

It is also a rank among the Winged Guards of Mayene.

First of Mayene.name: First of Mayene
First of Mayene.overview:
The First of Mayene is the title given to the ruler of the city-state of Mayene. The title was originally ceremonial and given the full title "First Lord"' or "First Lady."

The title was created in FY 1004 and given to a man claiming to be Tyrn sur Paendrag Mashera, the son of Laiwynde sur Paendrag and grandson of Artur Hawkwing, who has sought refuge in Mayene after an assassination attempt. Tyrn's claims were not recognized outside of Mayene, but within the city he was regarded as a symbol of Mayene's independence during the War of the Hundred Years and given the title First Lord as a ceremonial and figurehead position.

Tyrn died in FY 1054 and his daughter Miselle sur Paendrag took the position of First Lady. During her rule the title was given more power and authority, and began its transition into the current role of today. Different Mayener houses have taken control of the position since Miselle's time, but only claimants with provable blood relations to Miselle and Tyrn can hold the position, in a manner not dissimilar to the fact that only descendants of Ishara Casalain can claim the Lion Throne of Andor.

The First of Mayene wears a crown called the Diadem of the First, a golden hawk in flight that is affixed to a slim circular band.

The current ruling family of Mayene, House Paeron, claims descent from Artur Hawkwing. The current First is Berelain sur Paendrag Paeron, who uses the appellation 'sur Paendrag' to demonstrate herself to be in line of Artur Hawkwing, whose formal name was Artur Paendrag Tanreall.

It is customary for the Firsts of Mayene to undergo basic, yet evenly rigorous physical training as to never be unprepared for a physical attack or assassination attempt, due to Mayene's longstanding status as the target of assimilation by neighboring Tear, which desires hegemony over the city-state. An example of this training can be seen when Berelain was able to handily defend herself against Faile Bashere 's confrontation of her, in which Berelain was able to throw Faile to the ground and disarm her.

First Prince of the Sword.name: First Prince of the Sword
First Prince of the Sword.overview:
First Prince of the Sword is the title given to the eldest brother of the Queen of Andor. The First Prince has a distinct role in the government, acting as the commander-general of the Queens's armies and as her military advisor.

A prospective First Prince can be made to take oaths to protect and defend his sister, the Daughter-Heir of Andor, while both are still children as Gawyn Trakand was required to do before Elayne when he was "barely old enough to peer into her cradle."

An Andoran Prince in line to assume the position of First Prince of the Sword has customary military training in Tar Valon, among the Warders.

If the Queen of Andor has no brothers, she may appoint someone to the role, generally a male relative. When Morgase Trakand was Queen of Andor, she appointed Lord Gareth Bryne to the role.

First Reasoner.name: First Reasoner
First Reasoner.overview: First Reasoner is the title of the Head of the White Ajah.

First Selector.name: First Selector
First Selector.overview: First Selector is the title of the Head of the Blue Ajah. The First Selector could be more or less autocratic, depending on the woman holding the post. She always has an advisory council with a variable number of members. Beyond that, there is no constant organizational structure.

First Twelve.name: First Twelve
First Twelve.overview: The First Twelve is used for the senior Wavemistresses or Sailmistresses present in any gathering. The First Twelve Sailmistresses of a Clan chose the Wavemistress. The First Twelve Wavemistresses elect the Mistress of the Ships.

First Weaver.name: First Weaver
First Weaver.overview: First Weaver is the title of the Head of the Yellow Ajah.

Fists of Heaven.name: Fists of Heaven
Fists of Heaven.overview: The Fists of Heaven is an elite Seanchan military group conveyed to battle by to'raken. These are perhaps the only specialized airborne soldiers in all of Randland. Members of the Fists of Heaven are generally female and of small stature because of the space limitations aboard a to'raken. Included in them is another elite group, the Bloodknives.

Five-finger.name: Five-finger
Five-finger.overview: Five-finger is an herb, which, when mixed with ground ivy and sunburst root, creates a greasy ointment which is used treat pain and possibly inflammation in areas of bruising.

Five Sisters (Constellation).name: Five Sisters (Constellation)
Five Sisters (Constellation).overview: One of the constellations seen over the night skies of the Westlands.

Flatwort tea.name: Flatwort tea
Flatwort tea.overview: Flatwort tea is helpful for fatigue. It "clear the head and dint the burn in tired muscles."

Flute.name: Flute
Flute.overview:
A flute is an instrument of the woodwind family which produces sound via the movement of air across an opening without the use of reeds.

Flutes are often used by Gleemen and Bards, the most notable being Thomdril Merrilin, to entertain their audience with a variety of songs, the tunes of which are often known by different names in different areas of even the same kingdom.

Fog and Steel.name: Fog and Steel
Fog and Steel.overview: Fog and Steel, by Madoc Comadrin, is a book on military strategy.

Folding the Air.name: Folding the Air
Folding the Air.overview: Folding the Air is a sword form. It was used by Gawyn Trakand to knock aside Marlesh 's use of Leopard's Caress during their training.

Folding the Fan.name: Folding the Fan
Folding the Fan.overview:
For other similarly named sword forms, see Folding the Air and Unfolding the Fan .

Folding the Fan is a sword form used to sheathe a swordsman's weapon. It is typically used at the end of another form. After killing an unnamed woman and her companions in the Murandian hills, Rand al'Thor started to sheathe his blade woven from saidin with Folding the Fan, forgetting he had neither scabbard nor steel.

Foregate.name: Foregate
Foregate.overview:
Foregate was a sprawling secondary city outside the walls of the city of Cairhien.

By and large the buildings in Foregate were made of wood, and some of them had multiple stories. There were inns, taverns, homes, and shops galore. For the highly status-conscious and reserved Cairhienin nobility, Foregate was beneath their notice. The population was mostly commoners.

When the Shaido laid siege to Cairhien, Foregate was destroyed and burned to the ground. The population moved inside the walls and remained there.

Foregate has not yet been rebuilt.

Forel Market.name: Forel Market
Forel Market.overview:
Forel Market is a village in Andor.

When Elayne Trakand and her group are making their way to Caemlyn after Traveling from Altara, they stop in Forel Market. They are forced to stay in The White Swan due to heavy rains. While there, Elyane hears three different rumors. The first is that the Dragon Reborn is bringing Elayne to Caemlyn. The second is that Rand has sword fealty to Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan. The third, and the only one that is true, is that Rand has been crowned king of Illian.

Forest of Shadows.name: Forest of Shadows
Forest of Shadows.overview:
The Forest of Shadows, or Great Blackwood, is a large, impenetrable forest that lies between the Two Rivers and Ghealdan just east of the Mountains of Mist. It lies south of the White River and the village of Deven Ride. Although it was once presumably possible to traverse the river and forest, as the whole region was once part of the kingdom of Manetheren, in modern times the river flows so fast it is almost uncrossable, and the forest is so overgrown, wild, and dangerous that people simply don't bother making the attempt.

Garen's Wall is located in the eastern part of the forest. Due to its remoteness and unexplored nature, the forest is sometimes rumored to hold great treasures, and several Hunters of the Horn visited the forest under the impression that the Horn of Valere may be hidden there.

Forkroot.name: Forkroot
Forkroot.overview: Forkroot is an herb that interferes with an individual's ability to touch the One Power. In larger doses it also incapacitates and eventually renders the channeler unconscious.

Forsaken.name: Forsaken
Forsaken.overview:
The 13 Forsaken were channelers who served the side of the Shadow in the War of Power. They were known to followers of the Shadow as "Those Chosen To Rule The World Forever," or simply the Chosen. Among the Atha'an Shadar ( Seanchan Darkfriends ) they are known formally as Da'concion (or "the Chosen Ones"). The Aiel call them the Shadowsouled.

Although during the War of Power there were dozens of Forsaken leading the armies of the Shadow, as time passed, the term "Forsaken" came to refer to only the thirteen most powerful among them, who were caught in the sealing of the Bore and imprisoned with the Dark One. The horrific deeds of each were remembered long after their disappearance. In the Third Age, these thirteen were such infamous symbols of the Shadow that mothers would use stories of their exploits to frighten children.

A well known catechism about the Forsaken is as follows: "The Dark One and all the Forsaken are bound in Shayol Ghul, bound by the Creator at the moment of Creation, bound until the end of time," or a similar variant. This is incorrect, of course, as the Forsaken were not even born until the Age of Legends, and it is unclear if there even was an original "moment of Creation"—nor is the imprisonment forever. Due to the general weakening of the Seven Seals, some, perhaps all thirteen, had escaped by 997 NE, and all were certainly free by 998 NE.

Fortress of the Light.name: Fortress of the Light
Fortress of the Light.overview:
The Fortress of the Light is the headquarters of the Children of the Light. It is in Amador and is where the Lord Captain Commander of the Children resides.

The Fortress was overrun when the Seanchan invaded the country.

Four Holes.name: Four Holes
Four Holes.overview: The Four Holes is a sept of the Taardad Aiel. The sept hold is unknown. Aviendha once heard that Wise Ones of the Jagged Spire and Four Holes septs could Heal using the One Power. She thought it was a boast.

Four Kings.name: Four Kings
Four Kings.overview:
Four Kings is a village in Andor located at the junction of the Caemlyn Road and the road leading south to Lugard. It is a drab, careworn place used mostly as a stopover by merchants' wagon trains. The Dancing Cartman, an inn that's run by Saml Hake, is located there, along with several other hostelries including the Royal Inn.

Four Kings is located on the site of the Battle of Four Kings, where Andor won a major victory over four rival kingdoms during the War of the Hundred Years.

Siuan Sanche had an agent who worked as the " eyes-and-ears " for either her personal network or the Blue Ajah network in the Four Kings. The woman was only one she could trust between Tar Valon and Lugard after she had been deposed as the Amyrlin Seat, but the woman had disappeared. This meant she had to go to Duranda Tharne in Lugard instead.

Four Kings Road.name: Four Kings Road
Four Kings Road.overview: Four Kings Road is a road in Andor that runs from Kore Springs to Four Kings.

Four Stones.name: Four Stones
Four Stones.overview: The Four Stones is a sept of the Taardad Aiel. The sept hold is unknown. On their way to Alcair Dal, Rand al'Thor and the Jindo are joined by other Taardad septs including the Nine Valleys, Chumai, Four Stones, Bloody Water and Miadi septs.

Fourth Age.name: Fourth Age
Fourth Age.overview:
The Fourth Age of the Wheel of Time is the age prophesied to follow the Third Age and the Last Battle against the Dark One. It is an age that lies in the near future from the perspective of the people of the world; alternately it is a very distant age long past.

Several excerpts of the histories of the Fourth Age exist. According to these fragments, cities such as Great Aravalon, a possible incarnation of Tar Valon, and Taralan will exist in the Fourth Age. A place known as the Court of the Sun will also exist.

Foxtail.name: Foxtail
Foxtail.overview: Foxtail is an herb that can be found in the Two Rivers region. It can be prepared as a medicinal sleep aid that does not make the user groggy by boiling it with marisin.

Free Years.name: Free Years
Free Years.overview:
The Free Years, often abbreviated as FY for historical purposes, was also known as the Gazaran Calendar. It was the calendar system succeeding that of the After Breaking years. The Free Years were proposed by Tiam Gazar, following the Trolloc Wars as a result of humankind's freedom from the Trolloc threat. A new system had been in need at the time, as the exact year after the Breaking was under question.

During the rise of Artur Hawkwing, the Gazaran Calendar was replaced with Hawkwing's new system, the years From the Founding.

From the Founding.name: From the Founding
From the Founding.overview: A calendar established by Artur Hawkwing during his reign, the years of From the Founding (FF) replaced the system of the Free Years. This system lasted for the shortest time of all known calendar systems, lasting only until after the War of the Hundred Years, when it was replaced by the Farede calendar. In the present time, Hawkwing's calendar is only referred to by historians.

Fyall.name: Fyall
Fyall.overview: Fyall is a village in Ghealdan.

Gaelin (river).name: Gaelin (river)
Gaelin (river).overview:
The River Gaelin is a major river that courses through the land of Cairhien. It rises in the Spine of the World, just north of the Jangai Pass, and flows westwards along the feet of Kinslayer's Dagger. It flows into the Alguenya just north of the city of Cairhien.

It is presumed that the Gaelin may assist in the transportation of minerals from mines such as the Dragon's Dagger to the capital, but this is not confirmed.

Gahaur.name: Gahaur
Gahaur.overview: Gahaur is a geographical region of the Borderland nation of Saldaea. Lady Zavion hails from this area.

Gai'shain.name: Gai'shain
Gai'shain.overview:
Gai'shain ( Old Tongue: "those sworn to peace in battle") are Aiel who have been captured in a battle or raid. As part of their toh, they are required to wear white and serve their captors faithfully for a year and a day, touching no weapon and doing no violence. The only way to take such a prisoner is to touch a person without killing them while they are holding a weapon. After their time, they return to their clan as if nothing had happened.

It is far from unknown for Aiel taken gai'shain by an Aiel of the opposite sex to end up married to their captor.

Wise Ones, blacksmiths, children, and pregnant women or women with a child under the age of ten cannot be taken gai'shain. Exact "ownership" of the gai'shain is a variable matter; though each gai'shain swears only to one person, they can be and are often instructed to obey commands from other people as well.

While wearing the white, anything is possible. When Faile was gai'shain, she was told by Rolan that what happens while wearing white is forgotten when the white is taken off again. A wife can be taken to bed by the warrior who took her as gai'shain with no ji lost to either.

Gaidin (horse).name: Gaidin (horse)
Gaidin (horse).overview:
For the Brothers of Battle, see Warder .

Gaidin is a horse owned by Nynaeve al'Meara.

Ganai.name: Ganai
Ganai.overview: Ganai is a region or fief located in Saldaea, it belonged to the former Queen Tenobia.

Gara.name: Gara
Gara.overview:
A gara is a dangerous lizard found in the Aiel Waste.

Thick and around two feet long, a gara has bronze scales and yellow stripes. The venom released in its bite is a clear oily fluid. The bite is strong enough to go through a boot and venomous enough to kill a bull. Though dangerously deadly if stumbled upon, a gara is slow enough to be avoided easily by a person who knows its danger. Its meat tastes rather like chicken.

Garden of Silver Breezes.name: Garden of Silver Breezes
Garden of Silver Breezes.overview: The Garden of Silver Breezes is a wine shop in Tanchico owned by a woman named Selindrin.

Gardener.name: Gardener
Gardener.overview: Gardeners are Ogier that serve in the Seanchan Deathwatch Guard. They wear the same red and dark green armor as the human Guard and carry long-hafted, black-tasseled axes. In contrast to the human Guard, Gardeners are not da'covale to the Empress. A rank of the Gardeners is First Gardener, held by Hartha.

Garen's Wall.name: Garen's Wall
Garen's Wall.overview:
Garen's Wall is a substantial ridgeline located on the northern border of the kingdom of Ghealdan. It runs from the Forest of Shadows into the hills and mountains of northern Altara. One of the titles of Ghealdan is Defender of Garen's Wall.

It was formed by a split in tectonic plates. It is not known if this was a result of the Breaking of the World or not.

The ridge is named after King Garen who ruled Dhowlan sometime during the Free Years. He fought numerous border skirmishes with Farashelle to the north, before the time of Artur Hawkwing. Garen made expert use of the ridge as a defensive line, channelling the invading army into easily-defensible areas.

A series of other conflicts have been fought around Garen's Wall from the Free Years to the New Era. It has been used many times to defend the country, at the present time Ghealdan, which lies behind it. Hence the ruler of Ghealdan has the title "Defender of Garen's Wall" indicating their defense of the realm using this natural barrier.

In the modern age, the ridge is located in mostly uninhabited wilderness, although on maps it is shown as forming part of Ghealdan's border with Andor and Altara.

Gates of Hevan.name: Gates of Hevan
Gates of Hevan.overview: The Gates of Hevan were a place that existed during Age of Legends, betrayed by Sammael while he was still Tel Janin Aellinsar. Nothing more is known about it.

Genshai.name: Genshai
Genshai.overview:
Genshai occurs on the third day of Tammaz.

Brightly colored ribbons are worn by both men and women.

It is celebrated in Tear, Illian, Amadicia, Tarabon, southern parts of Altara and in Murandy.

Ghealdan.name: Ghealdan
Ghealdan.overview: Ghealdan is a relatively small country that lies along the feet of the Mountains of Mist to the north of Amadicia and northwest of Altara.

Gheandin blossom.name: Gheandin blossom
Gheandin blossom.overview: Some powderd gheandin blossom, an herb, on the tongue helps greatly with all kinds of fatal heart pains. Not much else is known about this herb.

Gift of Passage.name: Gift of Passage
Gift of Passage.overview: The Sea Folk have very stringent customs regarding allowing passengers aboard their ships. One must request passage by bartering.

Glancor.name: Glancor
Glancor.overview: Glancor is a satellite town of Far Madding. It lies over the Ajalon Bridge on the route to Caemlyn.

Glimmer.name: Glimmer
Glimmer.overview: Glimmer is a mare from the Royal Palace of Andor.

Glowbulb.name: Glowbulb
Glowbulb.overview:
A glowbulb is a device from the Age of Legends that emits light. It never needs replacement or recharging. Since the Breaking of the World, the process used to manufacture glowbulbs has been lost, as well as almost all knowledge of their existence in the first place.

Some have survived in stasis boxes, and even three thousand years later still emit some light.

Goaban.name: Goaban
Goaban.overview: Goaban was a nation that came into existence after the Hundred Years War. It faded away around 500 NE. It was in the central part of the continent.

Goatstongue.name: Goatstongue
Goatstongue.overview: Goatstongue is an herb. It can be combined with greenwort to induce sleep and relieve stomach cramps. This combination was prepared by Nynaeve al'Meara for Elayne Trakand when the latter was poisoned by forkroot.

Godan.name: Godan
Godan.overview:
Godan is a coastal town in southeast Tear that lies on the Bay of Remara across from Mayene.

After the bubble of evil and Shadowspawn attack on the Stone of Tear, Berelain sur Paendrag Paeron tells Perrin Aybara that she will travel by carriage to Godan and take a ship from there to Mayene.

Elayne reflects that Godan was allowed to thrive so that the Tairens could have a strong presence overlooking Mayene. Tairen lords can control the size of every village and town in Tear through means of a building tax that allows them to strongly discourage the construction of any new buildings. Godan appears to have been exempt from such taxes for the purposes of its strategic importance for controlling Mayene.

Gold Road.name: Gold Road
Gold Road.overview: The Gold Road is a major highway linking the cities of Illian and Far Madding across the Plains of Maredo.

Golden Crane signet ring.name: Golden Crane signet ring
Golden Crane signet ring.overview: The Golden Crane signet ring is the ring worn by Malkieri kings. Nynaeve al'Meara describes the ring as " a signet ring, heavy gold and worn with age, almost large enough for both her thumbs to fit through. On it, a crane flew above a lance and crown, all carefully wrought in detail. "

Goldenthorn.name: Goldenthorn
Goldenthorn.overview:
Goldenthorn is a plant that cannot be found for one hundred miles south of the island of Tar Valon.

Goldenthorn seeds were found on the saddlecloth of Zerah Dacan, leading her to confess to Seaine Herimon and Pevara Tazanovni that while she did ride down the bank of the Erinin to the village of Jualdhe, she did not actually begin her journey to Tar Valon from the north as she had implied.

Goosemint.name: Goosemint
Goosemint.overview: Goosemint is an herb. It is used to ease stomach pains and heartburn. It is described as having filly leaves. Nynaeve al'Meara consumed goosemint in Salidar when worrying about Moghedien.

Gorien Springs.name: Gorien Springs
Gorien Springs.overview:
Gorien Springs is a village south of Arafel, on the road from Shol Arbela to Tar Valon.

It is the birthplace of Yukiri Haruna, an Aes Sedai and Sitter of the Gray Ajah. When she was born, in 837 NE, the village had an inn.

Goshien.name: Goshien
Goshien.overview: The Goshien clan is one of the twelve Aiel clans. They had a standing blood feud with the Shaarad clan until, under Rand's ta'veren influence, the clan chiefs mended fences. They are one of the first clans to have joined with Rand, reaching Alcair Dal before him. They are supportive of Rand and his cause and are sent to Arad Doman to restore order. Their clan hold is Smoke Springs Hold, of which Dorindha is the Roofmistress.

Grafendale.name: Grafendale
Grafendale.overview:
Grafendale is a location mentioned by Androl.

Androl compares the design and layout of the Black Tower 's village to Grafendale. It is almost certainly a village or town in Andor.

Grand Alliance.name: Grand Alliance
Grand Alliance.overview: The Grand Alliance is an extremely grandiose title coined for the unified armies of ten of the fourteen kingdoms of the Westlands, which allied together to fight the Aiel outside the walls of Tar Valon during the Aiel War.

Grand Emergence.name: Grand Emergence
Grand Emergence.overview: The Grand Emergence is the most secret ceremony of the Red Ajah. It is undergone in a warded place, spoken in a guarded way even so. In essence, it was a plan for seizing the White Tower should it prove necessary. Not all Red sisters are aware of the ceremony since it is shrouded in doublespeak and masked words. Supposedly, it has been practiced ever since the White Tower was founded.

Gray Ajah.name: Gray Ajah
Gray Ajah.overview:
The Gray Ajah of the Aes Sedai are dedicated to politics and mediation. They favor harmony and consensus above all else, and are often conflict mediators or ambassadors. The leader of the Gray Ajah is called the Head Clerk.

Also see List of Gray Ajah sisters.

Gray fennel.name: Gray fennel
Gray fennel.overview: Gray fennel is a fast-acting herb used frequently by assassins. It was used by the Wisdom, Malena, in Nynaeve 's testing to kill Bran al'Vere, and also by those who tried to assassinate Queen Elayne. Their knives were tipped with the deadly poison and powdered peach pit. Sadly, not much else is known about it other than the eyes and tongue of the victims are abnormal after death.

Gray Gull.name: Gray Gull
Gray Gull.overview: The Gray Gull is a river ship captain by Huan Mallia.

Great Blight.name: Great Blight
Great Blight.overview:
For the chapter in The Eye of the World called "The Blight", see The Eye of the World/Chapter 48 .

The Great Blight is a corruption of the land in the north of the world, extending from Shayol Ghul.

Great Fire of Sohima.name: Great Fire of Sohima
Great Fire of Sohima.overview:
The Great Fire of Sohima was a historical disaster in recent Seanchan history. An enormous fire, its origin unknown, took over a large part of, or possibly even wiped out the city of Sohima. Countless homes were destroyed, and it is assumed that the death toll was high.

Kalia Karede and one of her three sons died in the Great Fire of Sohima.

Great Fish Market.name: Great Fish Market
Great Fish Market.overview: The Great Fish Market is an Ogier built building in the city of Tar Valon. It looks like a school of multicolored fish.

Great Hall of the Council.name: Great Hall of the Council
Great Hall of the Council.overview: The Great Hall of the Council is the ruling palace of the Council of Nine. It is located in Illian, opposite the King's Palace across the Square of Tammaz.

Great Holding.name: Great Holding
Great Holding.overview:
The Great Holding is a storage area in the basement of the Stone of Tear where among other things are kept all of the Ter'angreal that have been collected over the centuries by the Lords of Tear.

Some of the items of power that were kept in the Great Holding were the Twisted redstone doorframe (that Tear has obtained from the Firsts of Mayene ), and the fat bald man angreal, but the first has been destroyed by Moridin and the second has been brought away by Rand.

Mat visits the Great Holding three days after a bubble of evil has hit the Stone of Tear and after Egwene has told him of the Twisted redstone doorframe, but he doesn't use it this time.

Great Legion.name: Great Legion
Great Legion.overview: A Great Legion is a military unit commanded by a Captain-General. It is made up of two or more legions.

Great North Road.name: Great North Road
Great North Road.overview:
The Great North Road is one of the major highways of the Westlands. It links the city of Ebou Dar in Altara to Lugard, the capital of Murandy. In northwest Altara, the road is also known as the Lugard Road.

Beginning in Ebou Dar, the Great North Road passes through the towns of Weesin, So Tehar, Alkindar, Coramen, Jurador, Runnien Crossing, Maderin and Remen. It crosses the River Manetherendrelle before reaching Lugard. The town of Malden is also believed to lie close to the road in Altara, along with the ruins of the city of Londaren Cor.

The Great North Road runs through the Damona Mountains at the Molvaine Gap, by way of the Malvide Narrows. In the spring of 1000 NE two significant battles were fought close to the road: the Battle of Malden and the Battle of the Malvide Narrows.

Great Purge.name: Great Purge
Great Purge.overview:
The Great Purge was en event in modern Aes Sedai history, taking place in 1000 NE.

Egwene al'Vere, after receiving definite proof of the Black Ajah 's existence in the form of member lists from Verin Mathwin 's secret notes, returned to the Rebel Aes Sedai camp. After assembling the Rebel Hall of the Tower and swearing the three oaths on the Oath Rod and thereby proving herself not to be a Darkfriend, she proclaimed her knowledge of the Black Ajah's members, several of them found among the rebels. Among the Hall's present members, Moria Karentanis, a Sitter of the Blue Ajah, was discovered as a Black, shielded and blocked, the same happening to Egwene's Keeper of the Chronicles, Sheriam Bayanar. The Hall then proceeded to forsake and reswear their oaths on the Oath Rod in turn, in order to prove themselves friends of the Light. Afterwards, they had all the Rebel Aes Sedai come by Ajah to repeat the process, resulting in over fifty Black sisters captured out of the estimated seventy that were in camp at the time.

Afterwards, back in the White Tower and in control of both factions as the true Amyrlin Seat, Egwene repeated the process within the Tower. But before the Purge started, the majority of Black sisters inside the Tower, around sixty, were alerted and able to flee - only a dozen of them were captured and executed.

All the Black Sisters outside the White Tower at the moment of reunification, especially the seventy among the unaligned sisters, were also able to escape the capture and join the Shadow during the Last Battle.

Somehow Mesaana was able to escape the reswearing process and she was not found. Because of this, Egwene gave Seaine, Yukiri and Doesine the task to theorize on methods to evade the power of the Oath Rod. But Egwene, due to Verin's warnings in the notebook, Sheriam's confession, and Egwene's own feelings, was aware of Mesaana's presence in the Tower. The young Amyrlin vowed to hunt her down, being able to defeat her just before the Last Battle.

Great Rift.name: Great Rift
Great Rift.overview:
The Great Rift is an immense rip in the world's surface, a large canyon which marks the eastern edge of the Aiel Waste and the western border of Shara. The Great Rift runs south and east from the Cliffs of Dawn for over 450 leagues (1,800 miles) before petering out in the vicinity of the Sea of Storms. Immense mountains are located east of the Rift, further hindering travel into Shara. Also, the southernmost extent of the Rift is located east of the desert known as the Termool.

The rift ranges in depth from one to three miles (5,280 to 15,840 feet). There are no known settlements along the rift.

Great serpent.name: Great serpent
Great serpent.overview:
The great serpent is an ancient ouroboros ↗ symbol of the eternal and cyclic nature of time. Its usage predates the wheel.

Aes Sedai wear a gold ring with this symbol on the finger and hand of their choice, if they choose to wear it at all, in addition to their shawl to indicate their position.

Accepted wear this ring on their third finger of their left hand.

Great Serpent ring.name: Great Serpent ring
Great Serpent ring.overview:
The Great Serpent ring is an item of organizational regalia worn by Aes Sedai and their upper class of students in training, the Accepted. It is a golden ring fashioned into the shape of a serpent biting its own tail, an ancient symbol of eternity and time itself.

The Great Serpent ring is awarded to any of the novices who pass the qualifying test for Acceptance, and thus the Great Serpent ring is one of the most obvious ways to differentiate between a novice and Accepted (the more ornate dress worn by an Accepted is the other). Strictly speaking, an Accepted may only wear the ring on the third finger of her left hand.

When a candidate for full sisterhood is raised from among the Accepted as an Aes Sedai, she may wear the ring on whatever finger she chooses, or not at all as circumstances may warrant. The wearing of the Great Serpent ring is recognized as one of the most outward identifiers of an Aes Sedai by society at large, along with the 'ageless face.'

An Aes Sedai may use her Great Serpent ring as a signet ring to seal a letter and mark it in wax, as Moiraine Damodred was observed to have done.

Women who are put out of the Tower for failing the test to be raised to full sisterhood are permitted to retain their Great Serpent rings. However, if one such woman is apprehended masquerading as a full sister, her ring is confiscated and melted down.

Great Stump.name: Great Stump
Great Stump.overview:
A Great Stump is a meeting of Ogier elders from every stedding. The Great Stump often will drag on for a long time, as is the way of Ogier. No decisions are reached without thorough, rational discussions. It is called for during times of great change and when important decisions must be made that will affect all of the Ogier.

A Great Stump has recently been called for the first time in a thousand years. Various stedding take turns hosting the meeting; this time it is taking place at Shangtai. The Great Stump gathers to debate the opening of the Book of Translation, and the possible departure of the Ogier from the world. Loial plans to speak at the Great Stump to argue against the opening of the Book of Translation. He wants to convince the Ogier to take up arms alongside humans once more to fight the shadow at Tarmon Gai'don.

Great Tree.name: Great Tree
Great Tree.overview:
Great trees are huge and beautiful trees revered by the Ogier. Within the stedding, they are lovingly tended and almost never die. It is anathema to consider cutting one down. When a Great Tree dies in a storm, the Ogier sing a dirge to mourn its loss. They are not related to Avendesora.

They are described in The Wheel of Time Companion as "mammoth hardwoods that towered hundreds of feet in the air with trunks as much as one hundred paces across". They are also are incredibly old, with the largest having been seedlings during the Age of Legends. Loial mentions them being a hundred spans high. In Stedding Tsofu, we see a Great Tree with a trunk twenty paces thick and "branches spreading like the top of a gigantic mushroom a good hundred paces above the ground". In the centre of the Ogier town in Stedding Tsofu is there remains the stump of a Great Tree a hundred paces wide.

Loial first mentions them being planted in the Ogier groves of human cities "to keep memories of the stedding fresh." They had been cut down in Cairhien so long ago that nobody even remembers them existing. Great Trees still grow in the Ogier grove in Tar Valon and are a hundred spans and more in height. Loial later bemoans the cutting down of the Great Trees in Tear where the Ogier grove had become a pasture for horses.

In Cairhien, Verin Mathwin, Loial, Ingtar Shinowa, Rand, Hurin, Mat and Perrin stay at an inn called The Great Tree, an establishment Verin had stayed at before. Lord Algarin's manor has a large door that is carved with the image of a Great Tree.

A stand of Great Trees are grown upon the field of Merrilor after the Dragon's Peace is established. Elder Haman is impressed to see a human grow Great Trees instead of cutting them down and says the other Ogier must see it for themselves as proof the Great Stump made the right decision to fight alongside humans at Tarmon Gai'don.

Great Winter War.name: Great Winter War
Great Winter War.overview:
The Great Winter War is a conflict fought between the kingdoms of Andor and Cairhien, beginning in late 671 NE and presumably extending into at least the following year.

The causes of the war and how it was resolved are unknown at this time. The war is one of several that is taught by Aes Sedai in Brown Ajah history lessons to novices and Accepted in the White Tower.

Green.name: Green
Green.overview: The Green is a common name for the communal gathering area present in many villages throughout the Westlands. Due to the cultural differences between countries and regions, village greens can serve a multitude of purposes, most notably celebrations of the end of winter, the gathering of a harvest, and weddings.

Green Ajah.name: Green Ajah
Green Ajah.overview:
The Green Ajah of the Aes Sedai holds itself ready for Tarmon Gai'don, for the final battle between good and evil when the Dark One inevitably breaks free from his prison. They were called the "Battle Ajah" during the Trolloc Wars and are excellent generals who can plan effective battle strategies. They bond as many Warders as they wish and have been on friendly terms with the Blue Ajah for a millennium. The head of the Green Ajah is known as the Captain-General.

Also see List of Green Ajah sisters.

Green Salts.name: Green Salts
Green Salts.overview: The Green Salts are a sept of the Shaido Aiel. The sept hold is unknown. The sept chief is Bendhuin.

Greenwort.name: Greenwort
Greenwort.overview: Greenwort is an herb. It can be combined with goatstongue to induce sleep and relieve stomach cramps. This combination was prepared by Nynaeve al'Meara for Elayne Trakand when the latter was poisoned by forkroot.

Grolm.name: Grolm
Grolm.overview: Grolm are a species of animal used by the Seanchan.

Ground ivy.name: Ground ivy
Ground ivy.overview: Ground Ivy is an herb found in the Two Rivers region. Its fresh leaves can be boiled and used medicinally in an ointment, along with five-finger and sunburst root, as a remedy for heavy bruising and to stave off infection.

Guardian of the Blightborder.name: Guardian of the Blightborder
Guardian of the Blightborder.overview: Guardian of the Blightborder is a Saldaean title owned by Davram Bashere, father of Faile, father-in-law of Perrin, and Marshal-General to Tenobia, Queen of Saldaea.

Guardian of the Sea of Storms.name: Guardian of the Sea of Storms
Guardian of the Sea of Storms.overview: Guardian of the Sea of Storms is a title of the Altaran monarch. The title comes from the fact that Altara, and its capital city of Ebou Dar lay on the Sea of Storms. King Beslan Mitsobar gained this title when he gained the Throne of the Winds. His mother, Tylin Quintara Mitsobar, held this title before her death.

Guardian of the Southern Gate.name: Guardian of the Southern Gate
Guardian of the Southern Gate.overview:
For the ter'angreal in Far Madding , see Guardian .

For other uses of the word "gate," see Gate .

Guardian of the Southern Gate is a title of the Amadician monarch. While Amadicia is one of the southern nations, it, like Tarabon, doesn't sit on the Aryth Ocean. Instead, it is separated from the ocean and the Shadow Coast by a large streach of land. It may be that this is the "southern gate" mentioned in the title. The last known holder of the title was King Ailron.

Guardians of the Gate.name: Guardians of the Gate
Guardians of the Gate.overview: The Guardians of the Gate were a permanent formation of the national army of Amadicia, serving mainly as a bodyguard to the monarch of the nation.

Guild of Illuminators.name: Guild of Illuminators
Guild of Illuminators.overview: The Guild of Illuminators is a society of Illuminators founded in Tanchico and are a guild to hold and protect the secret of making illuminations (fireworks). The Guild were known to go great lengths to guard it's secrets, even to the cost of murder. No one not born into the guild is allowed access to their knowledge. They usually provided entertainment for lords and kings, but simpler forms of fireworks were also sold to the general public (accompanied with dire warning of disaster and destruction following attempt to open them).

Gull's Feast.name: Gull's Feast
Gull's Feast.overview: The Gull's Feast is a section of the port city Bandar Eban, the capital of Arad Doman. It is so named because it is close to where fishermen dump their waste and massive flocks of gulls congregate there to pick it over. The stench from this waste dump travels throughout the entire area.

Haddon Mirk.name: Haddon Mirk
Haddon Mirk.overview:
Haddon Mirk is an extensive area of marsh, swampland and forest fed by the River Iralell, a major tributary of the Erinin. It is bordered by the Spine of the World to the east and the Erinin to the west. It stretches as far as the border of Tear in the south and almost to the Maraside Mountains in the north.

Haddon Mirk appears to be mostly uninhabited due to its unpleasent climate and terrain. However, its vast size makes it an attractive hiding place for bandits and rebels. After Rand al'Thor captured Tear, the Tairen rebels opposed to him and led by the High Lord Darlin Sisnera fled into Haddon Mirk. Rand later won Darlin's allegiance and made him King of Tear. The rebels loyal to Darlin returned peaceably to Tear.

The nation of Mar Haddon once existed in this region, but it fell several centuries ago. Tear and Cairhien both attempted to annex its territory, but lacked the manpower to hold the region. Tear's northern border did extend permanently as a result of this, however.

Hadori.name: Hadori
Hadori.overview:
A hadori is a thin, braided leather headband worn by Malkieri men that holds back their hair. Hadoris have not been seen very often since the downfall of Malkier. When a young Malkieri boy is given his hadori by a male relative or a Malkieri male acting in the place of a relative, it means that he has become a man among the Malkieri, more so than gaining his sword which, among the Borderlanders is a symbol of the transition from boyhood to manhood. Malkieri who wear the hadori are buried in it. After the fall of Malkier the hadori remains a symbol of the Malkieri people and their commitment to stand against the darkness.

People who are seen to wear a hadori include Lan Mandragoran, Bukama Marenellin, Weilin Aldragoran, Bulen, Andere, and Nazar Kurenin, as well as many more who join Lan with the intention of riding under the banner of Malkier - the Golden Crane on a white backdrop.

Haevin (river).name: Haevin (river)
Haevin (river).overview:
The River Haevin is a remote and relatively little-known waterway which rises in the Black Hills and flows south and west until it joins the Arinelle north of Whitebridge on the border of Andor.

The Haevin is notable for marking the north-western edge of the plains known as Caralain Grass.

The name may have links to the origins of House Haevin of Andor.

Hai Caemlyn.name: Hai Caemlyn
Hai Caemlyn.overview:
Hai Caemlyn was a city in Coremanda, which was part of the Ten Nations.

During their constructions after the Breaking of the World, Ogier built a waygate to Hai Caemlyn. The city of Caemlyn, capital of Andor, was built on the ruins of Hai Caemlyn and derived it's name from the destroyed city.

Hai Ecorimon.name: Hai Ecorimon
Hai Ecorimon.overview: Hai Ecorimon was an ancient fallen city linked by the Ways. No more is known about it.

Haido.name: Haido
Haido.overview:
The Haido are a sept of the Shaarad Aiel. The sept hold is the Bent Valley Hold.

Bair, the Aiel Dreamwalker, is fom the Haido sept. She tells a story of a young Haido Water Seeker who is forced to take Chenda, a roofmistress of the Mainde Cut hold of the Jenda sept, as gai'shain because of a matter of honor. Before a year and a day is passed, he ends up taking one of Chenda's daughters as a wife, meaning that his mother-in-law was still in service to him. In an effort to remedy this situation, he tried to give his mother-in-law to his wife as a wedding gift, yet both of the women involved claimed he was trying to rob them of honor. He almost had to take his own wife as gai'shain to keep his own honor intact.

Hailene.name: Hailene
Hailene.overview: The Hailene, in the Old Tongue, "Forerunners," or "Those Who Come Before," is the term applied by the Seanchan to the massive expeditionary force sent across the Aryth Ocean to scout out the lands where Artur Hawkwing once ruled. Now under the command of the High Lady Suroth, its numbers swollen by recruits from conquered lands, the Hailene has gone far beyond its original goals, and has in fact been succeeded by the Corenne.

Halamak.name: Halamak
Halamak.overview: Halamak is a location in Seanchan which is home to Bakayar Mishima.

Half-moon axe.name: Half-moon axe
Half-moon axe.overview: The half-moon axe carried by Perrin Aybara was made by Haral Luhhan, the blacksmith of Emond's Field. It has a wide, half-moon shaped blade on one side, balanced by a thick metal spike on the other.

Half Tail.name: Half Tail
Half Tail.overview: Half Tail is sour wolf and pack leader.

Hall of the Counsels.name: Hall of the Counsels
Hall of the Counsels.overview: The Hall of the Counsels is the seat of government of Far Madding. The Counsels of Far Madding work in this building.

Hall of the Tower during the White Tower.name: Hall of the Tower during the White Tower Schism
Hall of the Tower during the White Tower.overview:
The White Tower Schism began in 999 NE when the Amyrlin Seat Siuan Sanche was deposed and stilled by a group of Sitters and others led by Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan. The action led to fighting among sisters and Warders in the White Tower and those sisters opposed to Elaida fleeing to Salidar. The Salidar Rebels set up their own Hall of the Tower, which eventually elected Egwene al'Vere as Amyrlin. Therefore, there were during this period two rival power structures, one in the Tower and one in Salidar, each with its own Amyrlin, Keeper of the Chronicles, Sitters, Mistress of Novices, and Ajah Heads.

While both groups lacked one of the seven Ajahs, they each treated the situation differently. In the Tower, Elaida dissolved the Blue Ajah, so the Blue seats and the blue portions of the symbols of the Tower and the Hall were removed. In the Rebel Hall, three empty red benches were present at every sitting. This difference generally had no effect on voting thresholds because (aside from votes to raise an Amyrlin, which are unique), the matters voted on in the books' events were lesser consensus issues, which do not require each Ajah to be present. The smaller size of the Tower Hall was relevant because it allowed it to raise Egwene to the Amyrlin Seat with only 11 Sitters present, which wouldn't have been possible before.
aliases: Hall of the Tower under Elaida a'Roihan

Hama N'dore.name: Hama N'dore
Hama N'dore.overview: The Hama N'dore is an Aiel warrior society. The name means "Mountain Dancers" in the Old Tongue.

Hamarea.name: Hamarea
Hamarea.overview: Hamarea was a kingdom of the Free Years. It was founded after the end of the Trolloc Wars, and was established on the former territory of Almoren. It was later absorbed by the growing might of Artur Hawkwing's Empire. Hamarea was counted as one of the most militarily powerful nations of its day, despite its small size and remoteness. The lands it once held are now partially controlled by Cairhien, but are mostly wilderness.

Hand.name: Hand
Hand.overview:
Hand is a title used amoung the Seanchan.

Not much is known about them, other than there is a hierarchy within the Hands. Known as Lesser Hands, these people both control the Listeners and look over several operations in the Seanchan empire. They are addressed as "Honorable" by other Seanchan and wear garments that have a blue oval panel embroidered with a golden hand for each of their ranks. One of the third rank is only two steps below the Hand to the Empress. A Lesser Hand of the Third Rank can usually escape death on the plea of duty done and will always risk death to do that duty.

When trying to obtain forkroot for his plan to free his wife, Perrin Aybara dealt with a Lesser Hand of the Third Rank. According to Tylee Khirgan, the manufactury in Almizar would normally be run by a Lesser Hand of the Fourth or Fifth rank. When she discovered that it was run by one of the Third Rank, her hopes of getting the forkroot dropped. Perrin, however, used his ignorance of Seanchan custom to "threaten" the Honorable with the wrath of Suroth Sabelle Meldarath should she not deliver the herb.

Hand of the Light.name: Hand of the Light
Hand of the Light.overview: The Hand of the Light is an organization within the Children of the Light which uses various methods, mainly torture, to gain confessions from suspected Darkfriends. They are also commonly known as Questioners, even by the Whitecloaks, who themselves hate their nickname.

Harad Dakar.name: Harad Dakar
Harad Dakar.overview:
Harad Dakar was the capital city of Hardan. It was located between Kinslayer's Dagger and the northeastern branch of the River Erinin, where it formed the southern border of Shienar.

Circa 700 NE, Hardan collapsed as its population declined to low levels and the city of Harad Dakar was abandoned. The city became an impromptu quarry as farmers and other settlers carted the stones of the buildings away to use for their own structures, so that by 998 NE very little was left to show a city had ever even been there.

Hardan.name: Hardan
Hardan.overview:
Hardan was a nation that came into existence after the Hundred Years War. It was located between Shienar and Cairhien. Its capital was Harad Dakar.

Stedding Nurshang was found within the borders of Hardan.

Circa 700 NE, Hardan collapsed as its population declined to low levels and the city of Harad Dakar was abandoned.

Hare Finds Its Hole.name: Hare Finds Its Hole
Hare Finds Its Hole.overview: Hare Finds Its Hole is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Harlon Bridge.name: Harlon Bridge
Harlon Bridge.overview:
Harlon Bridge is a village in Andor.

When Elayne Trakand and her group are making their way to Caemlyn after Traveling from Altara, they stop in Harlon Bridge. Whilst in the village, Adeleas Namelle discovers that Garenia Rosoinde, one of the Kin, is actually Zarya Alkaese, a novice who ran away just before Adeleas and her sister Vandene Namelle retired. By Tower law, Zarya must be put back in novice white. Kirstian Chalwin, seeing what was done, also admits to running away, albeit almost three hundred years ago, and is also put back in white.

Hawk Dives into the Brush.name: Hawk Dives into the Brush
Hawk Dives into the Brush.overview: Hawk Dives into the Brush is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Hawk Spots the Hare.name: Hawk Spots the Hare
Hawk Spots the Hare.overview: Hawk Spots the Hare is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Haywain (Constellation).name: Haywain (Constellation)
Haywain (Constellation).overview: One of the constellations seen over the night skies of the Westlands.

Head Clerk.name: Head Clerk
Head Clerk.overview: Head Clerk is the title of the Head of the Gray Ajah.

Healall.name: Healall
Healall.overview: Healall is an herb that can be found in the Two Rivers region and in Amadicia. It can be taken orally, its powdered form dissolved in water or used as an ingredient in an ointment, applied to scratches and open wounds.

Heart-friend.name: Heart-friend
Heart-friend.overview:
A heart-friend is the Seanchan equivalent to the Westlands pillow friend.

It is a lesbian relationship that takes place between two damane, and is encouraged in order to help improve the mood of poorly-trained damane, particularly those who have been captured in the Westlands with no expectation of serving as slaves.

“Pillow friends are not just good friends. Oh, they are that, too, but they also get hot and sweaty together and muss up the sheets something fierce. By the way, pillow friends is a term used in the White Tower. The same relationship between men or women elsewhere would be called something else, depending on the country."

Robert Jordan's Blog on September 30, 2005

Heart.name: Heart
Heart.overview:
A heart is a collection of three Black Ajah sisters, who work in isolation. Each sister in a heart will also have contact with one sister in another heart, of whom the other two sisters will be unaware.

Only two hearts have been identified:

- Atuan Larisett , Karale Sanghir , Marris Thornhill
- Galina Casban , Talene Minly , Temaile Kinderode

Heartleaf.name: Heartleaf
Heartleaf.overview:
Heartleaf is an herb that is brewed as a tea and serves as a contraceptive for women.

After Min Farshaw and Aviendha leave Elayne Trakand and Rand al'Thor alone, Min says that Elayne should have drank the heartleaf tea. Aviendha replies that Elayne wants to have Rand's children.

Hearts of Flame.name: Hearts of Flame
Hearts of Flame.overview: Hearts of Flame is a collection of love stories.

Heeth Tower.name: Heeth Tower
Heeth Tower.overview: Heeth Tower is a Kandori border tower that lies on the edge of the Blight border, under the command of Malenarin Rai. It is part of a chain of watchtowers to guard against the Blight. The chain uses a combination of mirrors to warn and communicate with other towers in the chain all the way to the capital of Chachin.

Hell.name: Hell
Hell.overview:
A hell is kind of low-life bar where the customers are rough, ragged and have no scruples. The term is first mentioned in The Great Hunt when Yarin Maeldan says to Bayle Domon " are all aboard but three I couldn't find, Captain. I've spread the word through every tavern, hell, and crib in the quarter." The term is not mentioned again until becomes more central to the plot in the chapter A Hell in Madeirin.

Matrim Cauthon 's desription of a hell is as follows:

Herbs.name: Herbs
Herbs.overview: Herbs and other plants are used extensively for their medicinal and sometimes noxious effects.

Heron on a Stump.name: Heron on a Stump
Heron on a Stump.overview: Heron on a Stump is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Heron Snatches the Silverfish.name: Heron Snatches the Silverfish
Heron Snatches the Silverfish.overview: Heron Snatches the Silverfish is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Heron Wading in the Rushes.name: Heron Wading in the Rushes
Heron Wading in the Rushes.overview: Heron Wading in the Rushes is a sword form.

Herot's Crossing.name: Herot's Crossing
Herot's Crossing.overview:
Herot's Crossing was a location within the Borderland nation of Malkier. It is unclear whether it was a town or merely a place where two roads crossed paths. It is famed as the site of the final Malkieri stand, when King al'Akir Mandragoran and Queen el'Leanna Mandragoran led the last remnants of the Malkieri army against the Shadowspawn invasion. Despite a valiant defense, the Malkieri host was slaughtered and al'Akir and el'Leanna were killed. The Shadowspawn swept on to destroy the Seven Towers and menace the border of Shienar before the other Borderlands sent a unified army against them, which turned them back at the Stair of Jehaan.

Shortly before the battle, al'Akir and el'Leanna sent their infant son al'Lan Mandragoran south to Fal Moran to escape the massacre at Herot's Crossing.

Hierarchy of the Atha'an Miere.name: Hierarchy of the Atha'an Miere
Hierarchy of the Atha'an Miere.overview: The Hierarchy of the Atha'an Miere is a set of ranks and positions that the Atha'an Miere use, both aboard ship and ashore, to lead their people.

High Captain.name: High Captain
High Captain.overview:
High Captain is the rank given to men who are in command of the Tower Guard of Tar Valon.

The holder of this rank is responsible for the overall command of the defense of Tar Valon.

It has been speculated that Gareth Bryne may attain this rank, despite his preference for field command and the need for his skills in Tarmon Gai'don.

High Chant.name: High Chant
High Chant.overview:
High Chant is most commonly used by bards in the service of kings, lords, nobles and various other high class figures. It is very poetic in form (usually rhyming, but free verse forms do exist) and must be recited word for word. High Chant stories are often very detailed and long, and as such are rarely found being told in lower class areas.

Though many epics and heroic stories are found in High Chant (often doubling stories written in Plain Chant ), philosophy, ideas, feelings and emotions are just as common (and are rarely found in Plain Chant ). Stories in this form are regularly set to music, but are usually spoken over the top and not sung. If sung it is usually an arrangement by the performer (often improvised) and not written down permanently.

High Chasaline.name: High Chasaline
High Chasaline.overview:
For the chapter in A Crown of Swords of the same name, see A Crown of Swords/Chapter 1 .

High Chasaline occurs on the twelfth day of Taisham. In Cairhien, the holiday is officially called "The Day of Reflection," and is called so in some other localities.

It is a feastday, often with dancing that night, on which people are supposed to reflect on their good fortune and the blessings of their lives. Complaining goes against the spirit of this day and a complainer may find himself doused with a bucket of water to wash away the bad luck, a tradition in some villages such as those in Two Rivers. Perrin reflects after the Battle of Dumai's Wells that dousing with a bucket of water during High Chasaline is not a welcome thing because the holiday normally occurs in a cold month.

High Inquisitor.name: High Inquisitor
High Inquisitor.overview: The High Inquisitor is the highest ranking member of the Hand of the Light, and the second-highest ranking member among the Children of the Light, second only to the Lord Captain Commander himself. While the Children generally dislike the Hand of the Light, they hold the High Inquisitor in high regard.

High Nobility of Tear.name: High Nobility of Tear
High Nobility of Tear.overview:
For the High Lords and Ladies of Seanchan , see The Blood .

High Lords and Ladies are of even greater rank than others of the noble class. In the Westlands, it is a title only used to refer to those who are members of the ruling body of Tear in the Stone of Tear.

High Plain.name: High Plain
High Plain.overview: The High Plain is a sept of the Goshien Aiel. The Stones River sept used to be a part of the High Plain sept until it grew too large to sustain itself. The sept hold is unknown.

Highest.name: Highest
Highest.overview: Highest is the title of the Head of the Red Ajah. Pevara notes that the Highest has almost absolute authority over any Red sister and over the Sitters as well. She even appears to handpick the Sitters. The Highest's commands are to be obeyed - in fact, she is to be shown the same deference as the Amyrlin Seat herself. As such, she holds a vast amount of power not only within her Ajah, but in the entire order of Aes Sedai itself, the Red Ajah being the largest one.

Hills of Absher.name: Hills of Absher
Hills of Absher.overview: The Hills of Absher are located in western Andor and make up some of the territory between Baerlon and Whitebridge.

Hills of Kintara.name: Hills of Kintara
Hills of Kintara.overview: The Hills of Kintara lie just north of Far Madding; they get their name from the extinct nation that once existed in that area of the Westlands.

Hinderstap.name: Hinderstap
Hinderstap.overview:
Hinderstap is a village located in northern Murandy, near the south border of Andor, not far from the border with Altara. It specializes in producing goat's cheese and mutton for the other villages and towns in the surrounding region. The mayor, Barlden, is a good strong leader for the people.

While Hinderstap used to be a welcoming town to outsiders, in present days visitors are restricted from entering while the sun is set.

Hiss-stave.name: Hiss-stave
Hiss-stave.overview:
A type of weapon used and referenced as Aviendha is going through the glass columns in Rhuidean. They are described as the "long rod-like weapons" by Malidra: "There was a hiss of sound—one of the Lightmaker weapons—and something popped against her back. It felt like she’d been hit with a small rock." The name comes from Norlesh 's PoV.

"Stave" is a synonym for "rod". Their length and ability to fire projectiles would make them similar to a rifle. They do not, however, produce a bang, but rather a hissing sound, so it's possible that they do not use gunpowder. They may be a ter'angreal, but this is speculation.

The item is not referenced in The Wheel of Time Companion.

Hol Cuchone.name: Hol Cuchone
Hol Cuchone.overview: Hol Cuchone was the home of Raidhen in 400 AB. It is unlikely to be a nation as the Compact of the Ten Nations was almost two hundred years old by that time, but it may have been a city or region of one of those nations. Otherwise it also can be a nation or a city-state that was just outside the Ten Nations alliance.

Hold.name: Hold
Hold.overview: A hold is the Aiel term for a settlment of Aiel. Typically, a hold is held by a sept of the Aiel, though some have been known to hold the entire clan.

Holder of the Keys.name: Holder of the Keys
Holder of the Keys.overview: The Holder of the Keys is the chief of servants in the Sun Palace in Cairhien. This official is identified by a ring of heavy silver keys worn at the waist. It's said that no matter who rules Cairhien, the Holder of the Keys rules the Sun Palace. The position was last known to be held by Corgaide Marendevin.

Hopper.name: Hopper
Hopper.overview: Hopper was a wolf friend of Perrin Aybara.

Horn of Valere.name: Horn of Valere
Horn of Valere.overview:
The Horn of Valere (/vɑˈɫiːɹ/) is a powerful artifact. Little is known of how it works, but the effect is clear: when the Horn is sounded, the great heroes of the Pattern are summoned to battle, will serve the Trumpeter but always on the side of the Light. "We have come to the Horn, but we must follow the banner. And the Dragon." – explains Artur Hawkwing at Falme. At the Last Battle, they accept Mat as the substitue of the Dragon. There is no direct mention of it in the Prophecies of the Dragon, but there are two lines which might hold indications of it: "The trumpets of war shall sound at his footsteps" and "When the Fox marries the raven, and the trumpets of battle are blown.". There is a statement at Falme, though which implies that. " It has to be there at the Last Battle, – Mat said."

It is described as looking like any ordinary curled golden horn and is not grand, the only markings were a line of silver script inlaid around the mouth of the bell. On the Old Tongue it says " Tia mi aven Moridin isainde vadin. " – "The Grave is no bar to my call."

Hot Springs Hold.name: Hot Springs Hold
Hot Springs Hold.overview: Hot Springs Hold is an Aiel settlement in the Three-fold Land. It is owned by the Shaarad clan. Colinda is the Wise One of the hold and Gaul is from the hold.

House a'Conlin.name: House a'Conlin
House a'Conlin.overview:
House a'Conlin is a house from Murandy.

Lady Meri do Ahlan a'Conlin is a known member of this House. It is unknown whether she was born or married into the House. She followed her husband into battle during the Aiel War, and their son Sedrin a'Conlin was born around the Battle of the Shining Walls near Dragonmount. Sedrin was thus eligible to collect the boon bestowed on all children born during the battle by the Amyrlin Seat, Tamra Ospenya, which was actually to search for the Dragon Reborn. Lady Meri met the Accepted Moiraine Damodred and Siuan Sanche in an army camp outside Tar Valon to collect the boon, and she boasted that she was a direct descendant of Katrine do Catalan a'Coralle, the first Queen of Murandy.

House a'Conn.name: House a'Conn
House a'Conn.overview:
House a'Conn is a house from Murandy.

Its only known member is Lord Paitr do Fearna a'Conn, one of the heads of the Murandian delegation that meets with Andoran nobility and the Salidar Aes Sedai on the Feast of Abram.

House a'Cowel.name: House a'Cowel
House a'Cowel.overview:
House a'Cowel is a house from Murandy.

Its only known member is Nisain a'Cowel, an Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She chose to join the Salidar Aes Sedai during the White Tower Schism.

House a'Macansa.name: House a'Macansa
House a'Macansa.overview:
House a'Macansa is a house from Murandy.

Its only known member is Lady Cian do Mehon a'Macansa, one of the heads of the Murandian delegation that meets with Andoran nobility and the Salidar Aes Sedai on the Feast of Abram.

House a'Naloy.name: House a'Naloy
House a'Naloy.overview: House a'Naloy is the present royal house of Murandy.

House a'Roihan.name: House a'Roihan
House a'Roihan.overview:
House a'Roihan is a very minor house in Murandy. Its seat is not much larger than a farm.

Its only known member is Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan, the youngest daughter of the house. She rose to become an Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah and advisor to Queen Morgase Trakand. She later deposed the Amyrlin Seat, Siuan Sanche, and rose to become Amyrlin herself, leading to the White Tower Schism. She was later taken as damane during a Seanchan raid on the tower, and removed from office in her absence.

House a'Roos.name: House a'Roos
House a'Roos.overview:
House a'Roos is a house from Murandy.

Its only known member is Lady Segan do Avharin a'Roos, one of the heads of the Murandian delegation that meets with Andoran nobility and the Salidar Aes Sedai on the Feast of Abram.

House Aldiaya.name: House Aldiaya
House Aldiaya.overview:
House Aldiaya is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the House is Nalesean Aldiaya.

House Almadar.name: House Almadar
House Almadar.overview:
House Almadar is a noble house in Arad Doman. King Alsalam Saeed Almadar, Lord of Almadar, is the High Seat of House Almadar.

The House was one of the founding Houses of Arad Doman, as Lady Bastine Almadar co-founded the nation with Lord Jalaam Lazari and Lord Ahran Nawaz after taking Bandar Eban in c. FY 1096.

House Andiama.name: House Andiama
House Andiama.overview: House Andiama is a noble house in Tear. High Lord Torean Andiama is High Seat. His son Estean Andiama is the heir to House Andiama.

House Annallin.name: House Annallin
House Annallin.overview:
House Annallin is one of the known Noble Houses of Cairhien.

The known members of the House are Daricain Annallin, Dalthanes Annallin, and Gulaeve Annallin.

House Annariz.name: House Annariz
House Annariz.overview:
House Annariz is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the House is Fionnda Annariz.

House Anshar.name: House Anshar
House Anshar.overview: House Anshar is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Its High Seat is Karind Anshar.

House Arathdar.name: House Arathdar
House Arathdar.overview:
House Arathdar was one of the known Noble Houses of Malkier until the nation's fall in 955 NE.

The only known member of the House was Lady Leanna Arathdar. She became queen consort of Malkier with her marriage to al'Akir Mandragoran.

House Arawn.name: House Arawn
House Arawn.overview: House Arawn is an ancient House, one of the nineteen strong Houses of Andor. Its High Seat is Naean Arawn.

House Armaghn.name: House Armaghn
House Armaghn.overview:
House Armaghn is one of the known Noble Houses of Andor affiliated to House Marne.
The only known member of the House is Dawlin Armaghn. Possibly connected to the region around the River Armahn.

House Arrel.name: House Arrel
House Arrel.overview:
House Arrel is one of the known Noble Houses of Kandor, formerly a noble House of Malkier until the Fall of Malkier in 955 NE.

The only known members of the House are Iselle Arrel and Edeyn Arrel.

House Asegora.name: House Asegora
House Asegora.overview:
House Asegora is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the House is Melanril Asegora. During the Shaido War, he is one of the Tairen nobles sent to Cairhien, and fights in the Second Battle of Cairhien.

House Avarhin.name: House Avarhin
House Avarhin.overview: House Avarhin was a noble House of Andor. The family was of low standing among the nobility, and had fallen into poverty by the late 10th century of the New Era. By that time, the only members of the house were Lord Willim Avarhin and his daughter Shiaine.

House Aybara.name: House Aybara
House Aybara.overview: House Aybara is a new noble house of the Two Rivers, established in 999 NE with Perrin Aybara being declared Lord of the Two Rivers. It was formally recognized by the Andoran government in 1000 NE per agreement between Lord Perrin and Queen Elayne Trakand. The House is closely tied with House Bashere of Saldaea, as Perrin is married to Queen Zarine "Faile" ni Bashere t'Aybara, though per agreement with Queen Elayne, Perrin and Faile's children must divide the Two Rivers and Saldaea between themselves to prevent the complicated situation of Saldaea annexing traditional Andoran territory.

House Baryn.name: House Baryn
House Baryn.overview: House Baryn is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Its High Seat is Lir Baryn. His sister is Aedelle Baryn.

House Bashere.name: House Bashere
House Bashere.overview: House Bashere is a Saldaean noble house from the region of Bashere, and has recently come to the throne of Saldaea as the royal house following the Last Battle. The sigil of House Bashere is three red kingspenny blossoms on a field of blue.

House Bornhald.name: House Bornhald
House Bornhald.overview:
House Bornhald is a house in Tarabon.

Its known members are Geofram Bornhald and his son Dain Bornhald. Lord Geofram was able to reach the rank of Lord Captain of the Children of the Light, but was killed at Falme by the Seanchan. His son Dain, an officer of the Children of the Light, began an obsessive quest to kill Perrin Aybara, believing him responsible for his father's death, and thus began a futile attempt to take the Two Rivers and confront Aybara, before he learned that his father had been killed by the Seanchan.

House Caeren.name: House Caeren
House Caeren.overview: House Caeren is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Its High Seat is currently Sylvase Caeren. According to Elenia Sarand, it the single most powerful House in Andor.

House Candraed.name: House Candraed
House Candraed.overview: House Candraed is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Its High Seat is Danine Candraed.

House Carand.name: House Carand
House Carand.overview: House Carand is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. The High Seat is Aemlyn Carand, whose husband is Culhan Carand.

House Casalain.name: House Casalain
House Casalain.overview:
House Casalain was the first royal house of Andor. As it has not been mentioned at all during the late New Era, it is almost certainly extinct.

Known members of House Casalain include:

- Ishara Casalain , the first Queen of Andor .
- Endara Casalain , governor of Caemlyn under Artur Hawkwing , mother of Queen Ishara, daughter of King Joal Ramedar of Aldeshar .

House Chuliandred.name: House Chuliandred
House Chuliandred.overview:
House Chuliandred is one of the known Noble Houses of Cairhien.

The only known members of the House are Doressin Chuliandred and Alaine Chuliandred.

House Coelan.name: House Coelan
House Coelan.overview: House Coelan is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Lord Pelivar Coelan is the High Seat of House Coelan.

House Daganred.name: House Daganred
House Daganred.overview:
House Daganred is one of the known Noble Houses of Cairhien.

The only known member of the House is Meresin Daganred.

House Damara.name: House Damara
House Damara.overview: House Damara is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear, and is one of the most influential houses in the nation.

House Damodred.name: House Damodred
House Damodred.overview:
House Damodred is a major noble house of Cairhien, in fact one of the few royal houses able for a while to rule this kingdom. Elayne Trakand is a descendant of this house through her father, Taringail Damodred.

The sigil for this house is the Tree and Crown and its colors are red, green and white.

House Delovinde.name: House Delovinde
House Delovinde.overview: House Delovinde is a noble house in Cairhien. Lord Talmanes Delovinde is a member of this house.

House Dhulaine.name: House Dhulaine
House Dhulaine.overview:
House Dhulaine is one of the known Noble Houses of Cairhien.

The only known member of the House is Arilyn Dhulaine.

House Dianatkhah.name: House Dianatkhah
House Dianatkhah.overview:
House Dianatkhah is one of the known Noble Houses of Saldaea, and was a previous royal house of the nation.

Its only known member was King Nikiol Dianatkhah, who was known as one of the nation's greatest kings, but his fatal flaw was being a drunkard.

As the house has not been mentioned as of 998 NE or later, it may be extinct, as the throne later passed to other houses such as House Kazadi, and later House Bashere.

House Gilyard.name: House Gilyard
House Gilyard.overview: House Gilyard is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Its High Seat is the 13 years old Lord Branlet Gilyard. His recently deceased guardian was Lady Mayv Gilyard.

House Haellin.name: House Haellin
House Haellin.overview:
House Haellin is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the House is Sunamon Haellin.

House Haevin.name: House Haevin
House Haevin.overview: House Haevin is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Its current High Seat is Catalyn Haevin. Haevins are known for their acid tongues, and even take pride in that fact.

House Ituralde.name: House Ituralde
House Ituralde.overview: House Ituralde is a noble house in Arad Doman.

House Jagad.name: House Jagad
House Jagad.overview: House Jagad is the ruling House in Fal Dara and Lord Agelmar Jagad is the High Seat. Other members of House Jagad include his sister, Amalisa Jagad.

House Kazadi.name: House Kazadi
House Kazadi.overview:
House Kazadi is one of the known Noble Houses of Saldaea.

The only known member of the House is its High Seat, Tenobia Kazadi, the late queen of Saldaea. It is unknown if the House has survived beyond its last High Seat, as the throne has passed to House Bashere under Queen Zarine.

House Kigarin.name: House Kigarin
House Kigarin.overview: House Kigarin is the royal house of Ghealdan.

House Lazari.name: House Lazari
House Lazari.overview:
House Lazari is a noble house in Arad Doman.

The House was one of the founding Houses of Arad Doman, as Lord Jalaam Lazari co-founded the nation with Lord Ahran Nawaz and Lady Bastine Almadar after taking Bandar Eban in c. FY 1096. Lord Jalaam's second son, Shelaan Lazari, was crowned the first King of Arad Doman in FY 1116.

The House has not been mentioned in the late New Era, and it is therefore known whether House Lazari still exists in the present day.

House Maclain.name: House Maclain
House Maclain.overview:
House Maclain was one of the known Noble Houses of Malkier until the nation's fall in 955 NE.

The only known member of the House was Lady Breyan Maclain, who married Lain Mandragoran.

House Mandragoran.name: House Mandragoran
House Mandragoran.overview: House Mandragoran is the restored royal house of Malkier.

House Mantear.name: House Mantear
House Mantear.overview: House Mantear is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor.

House Maran.name: House Maran
House Maran.overview:
House Maran is one of the known Noble Houses of Andor affiliated to House Marne.

The only known member of the House is Jailin Maran.

House Maravin.name: House Maravin
House Maravin.overview:
House Maravin is one of the known Noble Houses of Cairhien.

The only known member of the House is Semaradrid Maravin.

House Marcasiev.name: House Marcasiev
House Marcasiev.overview:
House Marcasiev is one of the known Noble Houses of Kandor.

The only known member of the House is Varan Marcasiev.

House Marne.name: House Marne
House Marne.overview: House of Marne is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. The most notable member is Arymilla Marne.

House Materasu.name: House Materasu
House Materasu.overview:
House Materasu is the current ruling House in Kandor.

The High Seat of House Materasu is Queen Ethenielle Kirukon Materasu, who sits on the Throne of the Clouds in the Aesdaishar Palace in Chachin. It is known that she was already in line to the throne in 963 NE when she was married to Brys Noramaga.
