Regarding Prince Consort Brys, he adopted his wife's name after marriage, as she was of the greater House. He could be considered as marrying into the House. It is unclear what Houses their children and descendents belong to, although the one example of their grandchildren we have in books, Kaisel Noramaga, uses his grandfather's name.

Queen Ethenielle has at least one brother and two sisters, who may or may not be part of House Materesu, and seven remaining children, including Antol and Jarene. Jarene married another Kandori lord whose name is not known.

House Matherin.name: House Matherin
House Matherin.overview: House Matherin is a minor noble house in Andor. Lord Aedmun Matherin is the High Seat of House Matherin.

House Mecandes.name: House Mecandes
House Mecandes.overview:
House Mecandes is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear. It also has a branch in Cairhien.

Cabriana Mecandes, a Tairen Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah, hails from House Mecandes. Her much younger sister is Holleen Mecandes, a Cairhienin Darkfriend who is married to Barris Mecandes and has a daughter, Elspeth.

House Mendiana.name: House Mendiana
House Mendiana.overview:
House Mediana is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the House is Meilan Mendiana who was a High Lord of Tear before his assassination.

Its sign is blue six-pointed stars on red.

House Mitsobar.name: House Mitsobar
House Mitsobar.overview: House Mitsobar is a noble house of Altara.

House Moseneillin.name: House Moseneillin
House Moseneillin.overview:
House Moseneillin is one of the known Noble Houses of Cairhien.

The only known member of the House is Daigian Moseneillin an Aes Sedai of the White Ajah.

House Nachiman.name: House Nachiman
House Nachiman.overview:
House Nachiman is one of the known noble Houses of Arafel. It is the present royal house of the nation.

Known members of House Nachiman include:

- King Paitar Nachiman , the present King of Arafel
- Queen Menuki Nachiman , his wife, the Queen of Arafel
- Kiruna Nachiman , sister of King Paitar, an Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah , killed during the Last Battle .
- Lord Hirare Nachiman , of unknown relation to King Paitar, who led the troops of Arafel during the Aiel War .

House Narencelona.name: House Narencelona
House Narencelona.overview:
House Narencelona is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the House is Anaiyella Narencelona, a High Lady of Tear and a Darkfriend.

House Nawaz.name: House Nawaz
House Nawaz.overview:
House Nawaz is a noble house in Arad Doman.

The House was one of the founding Houses of Arad Doman, as Lord Ahran Nawaz co-founded the nation with Lord Jalaam Lazari and Lady Bastine Almadar after taking Bandar Eban in c. FY 1096.

The House has not been mentioned in the late New Era, and it is therefore known whether House Nawaz still exists in the present day.

House Noramaga.name: House Noramaga
House Noramaga.overview:
House Noramaga is one of the known Noble Houses of Kandor.

Brys Noramaga, former Prince Consort to Queen Ethenielle Kirukon Materasu, was born into this House, although it is noted that he took his wife's name as House Materasu was a greater House. He also had two sisters who were born into this House, but were married by 979 NE.

Prince Kaisel Noramaga is their grandson.

House Northan.name: House Northan
House Northan.overview: House Northan is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Its High Seat is the 16 years old Lord Conail Northan.

House Norwelyn.name: House Norwelyn
House Norwelyn.overview: House Norwelyn is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Lord Luan Norwelyn is High Seat of House Norwelyn.

House Novares.name: House Novares
House Novares.overview:
House Novares is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the house is Lord Istaban Novares, who was a nobleman of the province of Tear during the days of Artur Hawkwing 's Empire. After the High King's death in FY 994, Lord Istaban formed an alliance with Lady Yseidre Tirado and seized control of the city and the surrounding countryside. With neither being powerful enough to become king or queen of the nation, they formed a ruling council, which developed into the High Nobility of Tear during the War of the Hundred Years.

As House Novares has not been mentioned in the events around 998 NE, it may be extinct.

House Osiellin.name: House Osiellin
House Osiellin.overview:
House Osiellin is one of the known Noble Houses of Cairhien.

The only known members of the House are Belevaere Osiellin and Amondrid Osiellin.

House Paendrag.name: House Paendrag
House Paendrag.overview: House Paendrag is the ruling house of Seanchan. The house has its origins in the kingdom of Shandalle during the Free Years, where Artur Hawkwing was able to distinguish himself as High King over all the Westlands. The House survived beyond the Aryth Ocean after Luthair Paendrag Mondwin sailed west to conquer the rest of the world; meanwhile, in the Westlands, House Paeron of Mayene claims descent from House Paendrag.

House Paeron.name: House Paeron
House Paeron.overview:
House Paeron is one of the known Noble Houses of Mayene.

The house is one of the oldest ruling houses of the nations, and claims descent from King Artur Hawkwing and therefore House Paendrag. A line of unbroken succession has ruled Mayene for over a millennium after the reign Tyrn sur Paendrag Mashera; at some point, these Paendrag descendants were considered to be of House Paeron. Members of the House often style themselves with "sur Paendrag" in their name to proudly proclaim their descent from Hawkwing.

The only named member of the House currently living is Berelain sur Paendrag Paeron, the current First of Mayene. It is known that Berelain has several siblings who serve as Seconds of Mayene. Following the Last Battle, Berelain married Galad Damodred.

House Pendaloan.name: House Pendaloan
House Pendaloan.overview:
House Pendaloan is a lesser noble house of Tear.

Algarin is the old Lord of the house manor. The majority of the servants are nearly as old as he, but they still keep the place clean and tend the forests well.

After the cleansing of saidin the group led by Rand and Cadsuane took refuge in the Pendaloan Estate in the East of Tear to take some rest. There they were joined by the group led by Logain and Davram Bashere.

Some time after the Estate was invaded by Shadowspawn hordes that were destroyed after a cruel battle. Lews Therin Telamon seized control of Saidin during the battle and used weaves that Rand had not previously known to fight the Shadowspawn, causing Logain to make a comment about Rand holding back knowledge to share only with his favorites.

Also while staying at the manor, Loial gets married to Erith after Haman, Corvil, and Erith finally catch up with him. They had traveled all over the eastern portion of the Westlands in pursuit of him, and wasted no time sealing the marriage at the manor.

House Pendar.name: House Pendar
House Pendar.overview: House Pendar is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. The High Seat of House Pendar is Lord Abelle Pendar.

House Pensenor.name: House Pensenor
House Pensenor.overview: House Pensenor is a minor noble house in Andor. Lord Aubrem Pensenor is part of this house. House Pensenor is allied with House Taravin.

House Rashad.name: House Rashad
House Rashad.overview:
House Rashad is one of the known Noble Houses of Saldaea, and was the first royal house of the nation.

Its only known member is Rylen t'Boriden Rashad, who was the Imperial Governor of the Province of Saldaea during the reign of King Artur Hawkwing. After Hawkwing's death, he and the other governors of the northernmost regions of the Empire met, and decided that the five provinces would become independent nations, with Rylen becoming the first King of Saldaea.

As the house has not been mentioned as of 998 NE or later, it can be presumed extinct.

House Renshar.name: House Renshar
House Renshar.overview: House Renshar is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Lady Arathelle Renshar is the High Seat of House Renshar.

House Riatin.name: House Riatin
House Riatin.overview:
House Riatin is one of the three major noble houses of Cairhien. The sign of House Riatin is Five Stars.

In recent years, Riatin has been one of the two strongest houses in Cairhien, the other being its bitter rival House Damodred; the third most important and rival house of both is House Saighan. Important recent members of House Riatin include Galldrian Riatin, Toram Riatin, and Ailil Riatin.

Taking great advantage from the fall of House Damodred during the Aiel War Galldrian su Riatin Rie was able to become King of Cairhien for almost twenty years: from the end of the war until his assassination by Thom Merrilin in 998 NE.

His cousin Toram Riatin, who was High Seat of the House during the ensuing civil war, refused to accept the authority of Rand al'Thor following his rescue of Cairhien from the Shaido Aiel. After going into open rebellion and coming under the influence of Padan Fain, Toram disappeared under mysterious circumstances; he was killed in Far Madding by Lan Mandragoran.

In his absence, his sister Ailil Riatin pronounced herself High Seat of House Riatin with the support of Sashalle Anderley, the highest-ranking Aes Sedai sworn to the Dragon Reborn in the city. She has supported Elayne Trakand ’s ascension to the Sun Throne. She presumably will retain this title after her upcoming marriage to Darlin Sisnera, the King of Tear.

House Saighan.name: House Saighan
House Saighan.overview:
House Saighan is one of the three major noble houses in Cairhien; along House Damodred and House Riatin this three houses struggle regularly for the throne.

The colors of House Saighan are red, yellow and silver. The sign of House Saighan is a silver diamond on a red and yellow checked field. The High Seat of House Saighan was Colavaere Saighan who was crowned Queen of Cairhien after the death of King Galldrian Riatin, but after nine days of her reign, she was deposed by Rand al'Thor, who reduced her to the status of a commoner and sentenced her to live out the rest of her life on a farm. Colavaere committed suicide by hanging rather than face such a disgrace.

Colavaere was succeeded by her cousin Bertome Saighan as High Seat. He eventually supported Elayne Trakand as Queen of Cairhien on the condition that he was offered a portion of the Andoran estates of Arymilla Marne, Elenia Sarand and Naean Arawn.

Dairaine Saighan is another member of House Saighan. She was taken as gai'shain by the Shaido.

House Saniago.name: House Saniago
House Saniago.overview:
House Saniago is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the House is Weiramon Saniago.

House Sarand.name: House Sarand
House Sarand.overview: House Sarand is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. The current High Seat of the house is Jarid Sarand.

House Selorna.name: House Selorna
House Selorna.overview:
House Selorna is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the House is Edorion Selorna.

House Senhold.name: House Senhold
House Senhold.overview:
House Senhold is a house in Amadicia.

Its only known member is Lord Aeman Senhold, who served as an Amadician general during the Aiel War, and led the Amadician contingent during the Battle of the Shining Walls.

House Shinowa.name: House Shinowa
House Shinowa.overview:
House Shinowa is one of the known Noble Houses of Shienar.

The only known member of the House is Ingtar Shinowa, now deceased. Possible successors are unknown.

House Sisnera.name: House Sisnera
House Sisnera.overview:
House Sisnera is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the House is Darlin Sisnera who is now the crowned King of Tear.

House Taborwin.name: House Taborwin
House Taborwin.overview:
House Taborwin is a high-ranking noble house of Cairhien. Famous members include:

- Lady Breane Taborwin
- Lord Dobraine Taborwin

House Talkend.name: House Talkend
House Talkend.overview:
House Talkend is one of the known Noble Houses of Andor.

The only known member of the House is Eram Talkend.

House Taravin.name: House Taravin
House Taravin.overview: House Taravin is a major House of Andor. Its High Seat is Dyelin Taravin.

House Tirado.name: House Tirado
House Tirado.overview:
House Tirado is one of the known Noble Houses of Tear.

The only known member of the house is Lady Yseidre Tirado, who was a noblewoman of the province of Tear during the days of Artur Hawkwing 's Empire. After the High King's death in FY 994, Lady Yseidre formed an alliance with Lord Istaban Novares and seized control of the city and the surrounding countryside. With neither being powerful enough to become king or queen of the nation, they formed a ruling council, which developed into the High Nobility of Tear during the War of the Hundred Years.

As House Tirado has not been mentioned in the events around 998 NE, it may be extinct.

House Todande.name: House Todande
House Todande.overview:
House Todande is a minor house in Altara.

This house had held the Throne of the Winds for five generations before the fall of Anarina Todande. The fall of Anarina, the fifth ruler of House Todande, was so precipitous that now Todande is "a lapdog for anyone who wants them."

House Togita.name: House Togita
House Togita.overview:
House Togita is one of the known Noble Houses of Shienar.

The only known member of the House is Easar Togita, the current king of Shienar.

House Traemane.name: House Traemane
House Traemane.overview:
House Traemane is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor. Its current High Seat is Lady Ellorien Traemane and her estates are at Sheldyn.

Lady Ellorien's grandmother was named Elayne Traemane.

House Trakand.name: House Trakand
House Trakand.overview: House Trakand is one of the 19 Major Noble houses of Andor, and the current ruling house of both Andor and Cairhien.

House Vendare.name: House Vendare
House Vendare.overview:
House Vendare is a house in Altara.

Its only known member is Nathin Sarmain Vendare, the Lord of Maderin. He submits to the Seanchan during their invasion of Altara, trying to protect his people.

House Vordarian.name: House Vordarian
House Vordarian.overview: House Vordarian is a minor House in Andor. Its only known member is Brandel Vordarian, one of the Lord Captain s of the Children of the Light.

Hoverfly.name: Hoverfly
Hoverfly.overview: A hoverfly was a flying vehicle used in the Age of Legends. One is described through the eyes of Coumin (whilst Rand al'Thor is in the glass columns in Rhuidean ) as "a deadly black metal wasp containing two men." It was also said to have "buzzed overhead in its patrol". The Wheel of Time companion directly describes it as the equivalent of a helicopter.

Hummingbird Kisses the Honeyrose.name: Hummingbird Kisses the Honeyrose
Hummingbird Kisses the Honeyrose.overview: Hummingbird Kisses the Honeyrose is a sword form. The movements of the form are unknown, other than the fact that it is rarely useful against someone on the defensive.

Hundred-heads.name: Hundred-heads
Hundred-heads.overview:
The hundred-heads, also known as hundredarms, is a tentacled creature found on the bottom of ponds. Not to be confused with a hundred-legs.

In The Wheel of Time Companion, there are entries for both names. The first is referenced as being found in Andor, while the second is referenced as being found in the Waterwood of the Two Rivers and is probably a local name.

In the books themselves, Elayne Trakand makes the only reference in an analogy when she tries to unpick an unravelling Gateway:

Hundred-legs.name: Hundred-legs
Hundred-legs.overview:
A hundred-legs is described in The Wheel of Time Companion as "an insect with numerous legs". Not to be confused with a hundred-heads.

Nynaeve thinks of the creature when looking out upon the harbour of Ebou Dar:

This just the Westlands name for, and literal English translation of, a centipede.

Hundred Companions.name: Hundred Companions
Hundred Companions.overview:
The Hundred Companions were a group of one hundred thirteen young male Aes Sedai from the Age of Legends who were very vocal supporters of Lews Therin Telamon 's plan of attacking the Bore directly and sealing the Dark One in his prison. They appeared to have been formed as a reactionary group to Latra Posae Decume's Fateful Concord, an all-female group of Aes Sedai who opposed Lews Therin's plan. During a deadlock of the Hall of Servants regarding which of two plans to win the War of Power should be taken, Lews Therin took the Companions and ten thousand soldiers (considered no more than a security escort) to Shayol Ghul directly and sealed the Dark One's prison, anchoring the barrier with seven seals of cuendillar.

The Dark One's counterstroke, however, rendered the 68 surviving Companions instantly mad. During the following years, they and all other male Aes Sedai broke the world.

Hunter of the Horn.name: Hunter of the Horn
Hunter of the Horn.overview:
A Hunter of the Horn is a person dedicated to finding the Horn of Valere.

The popular saga of The Great Hunt of the Horn told by Gleemen concerns tales of famous Hunters of the Horn.

Ijaz Mountains.name: Ijaz Mountains
Ijaz Mountains.overview: The Ijaz Mountains are mountains in Seanchan that are known for excellent kaf beans.

Ileande.name: Ileande
Ileande.overview: Ileande was a kingdom of the Free Years. It was founded after the end of the Trolloc Wars, and was established on the former territory of Almoren. It was later absorbed by the growing might of Artur Hawkwing's Empire. The lands it once held are currently partially controlled by Cairhien but are now mostly wilderness, though were part of the nation of Hardan until 700 NE.

Illian.name: Illian
Illian.overview:
Illian (IHL-lee-an; /ˈɪːɫi.æn/) is a country that lies in the far south of the Westlands, to the west of Tear whose capital city bears the same name. It is famous for hosting the Great Hunt for the Horn. It is feared by its neighbors Altara and Murandy for swallowing pieces of their countries from time to time.

The city after which the nation is named is one of the largest in the Westlands and is penetrated by lots of little channels. It also boasts of the great Square of Tammaz where the Hunters of the Horn gather to swear their oaths. Two opposing but similar palaces, one for the king and one for the council may be found adjoining the square. The council's palace is just a bit smaller.

Illian (city).name: Illian (city)
Illian (city).overview: The City of Illian is the capital of the nation of the same name.

Illian Road.name: Illian Road
Illian Road.overview:
The Illian Road is the name given to the highway running east from Ebou Dar in Altara across the border into Illian. The road does not run all the way to the capital of Illian, instead joining the Silver Road near the River Manetherendrelle. Due to the harsh terrain along the coast, the road runs inland, north of the Rhannon Hills and the Venir Mountains. The Seanchan fortified the road and positioned outposts in the hills and mountains to the south in preperation for an offensive against Illian, but were defeated in battle by Rand al'Thor and forced to abandon this strategy.

It is likely that this term is also used for any roads close to Illian and leading to or from the city.

Illianer Companions.name: Illianer Companions
Illianer Companions.overview: Illian 's elite shock troops are known as the Illianer Companions, or simply the Companions. This organization is rare in that foreigners can rise to become First Captain, the top rank in the Companions. They serve as the King of Illian's personal guard and also the backbone of the army. Rand al'Thor 's father, Tam al'Thor, was a Second Captain of the Companions.

Iman.name: Iman
Iman.overview:
Iman was the capital city of Safer, which was part of the Ten Nations.

The city of Katar is built upon the site of Iman. The city also held a waygate.

Imfaral.name: Imfaral
Imfaral.overview:
Imfaral is the sixth-largest city in the Empire of Seanchan and is famed as the location of the The Towers of Midnight, a large fortress complex. Imfaral is a port city located on the easternmost peninsula of the northern landmass of the Seanchan continent, on the dividing channel between the two landmasses.

Imfaral was captured during the early days of the Conquest and used as a base of operations by Luthair Paendrag Mondwin 's forces until they secured Seandar later in the war.

Imran.name: Imran
Imran.overview: The Imran is a sept of the Shaarad Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Imre Stand.name: Imre Stand
Imre Stand.overview: Imre Stand is a location in the Aiel Waste. It is a small watering hole in the lands held by the Taardad Aiel. Imre Stand is about a day's travel from Rhuidean and Chaendaer and twelve days travel to Cold Rocks Hold.

Indrahar.name: Indrahar
Indrahar.overview: Indrahar was a kingdom of the Free Years. It was founded after the end of the Trolloc Wars, and was established on the former territories of Jaramide and northern Aridhol. It was later absorbed by the growing might of Artur Hawkwing's Empire. The lands it once held are now partially controlled by Arad Doman, but are mostly wilderness.

Inishlinn.name: Inishlinn
Inishlinn.overview: Inishlinn is a city in Murandy. In keeping with what seems to be Murandian tradition, people from the city refer to themselves as Inishlinni rather than Murandians.

Inn of the Golden Cup.name: Inn of the Golden Cup
Inn of the Golden Cup.overview:
For the inn in Tear, see The Golden Cup .

The Inn of the Golden Cup is an inn in Tanchico. It is owned by a man named Borman.

Inn of the Valley.name: Inn of the Valley
Inn of the Valley.overview: The Inn of the Valley is the local inn in Tobin's Hollow.

Inner City.name: Inner City
Inner City.overview: The Inner City of Caemlyn is the oldest part of the city, and is almost entirely Ogier built. This is evidenced in its conformity to the natural environment. Rather than forcing the land to conform to the builders desires, it uses the natural landscape as a platform for artistic design. This results in winding roads which flow around the city's hills. In addition to this, the roads are designed in as a series of circles which spiral toward the Royal Palace at the center.

Ionin Spring.name: Ionin Spring
Ionin Spring.overview:
Ionin Spring is a village in Altara.

When Egwene al'Vere enters Tel'aran'rhiod physically to travel to Salidar, she passes through Ionin Spring. She identifies the village's name by the Ionin Spring Inn.

Iralell.name: Iralell
Iralell.overview:
For the song by the same name, see River Iralell (song) .

The River Iralell is a large river in the eastern part of the Westlands. It rises in the Spine of the World and flows south and west into the Erinin. The Iralell waters the surrounding low-lying lands extensively, creating the substantial marshland known as Haddon Mirk.

Irenvelle.name: Irenvelle
Irenvelle.overview: Irenvelle was a nation that came into existence after the War of the Hundred Years. It faded away long ago.

Irinjavar.name: Irinjavar
Irinjavar.overview:
Irinjavar is a location in Saldaea. Davram Bashere fought a battle there with the false Dragon Mazrim Taim until the visions of Rand al'Thor fighting Ishamael appeared in the Sky.

When Mazrim Taim presented himself to Rand al'Thor after Rand gave amnesty to men who can channel, Bashere did not recognize him and Taim joked about that he has shaved since. Taim mentioned that he had Bashere beat at Irinjavar until the visions appeared.

Iron Mountain.name: Iron Mountain
Iron Mountain.overview:
The Iron Mountain are a sept of the Taardad Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Janduin, Rand's father, was a member of this sept.

Islands of the Dead.name: Islands of the Dead
Islands of the Dead.overview:
The Islands of the Dead is the Sea Folk name of the Seanchan continent.

The Sea Folk refuse to cross the Aryth Ocean and only refer to what lies on the other side as the Islands of the Dead, "from which no ship returns." One known reference exists to "lands under the Shadow, beyond the setting sun, beyond the Aryth Ocean, where the Armies of Night reign."

Isles of the Atha'an Miere.name: Isles of the Atha'an Miere
Isles of the Atha'an Miere.overview:
The Isles of the Atha'an Miere are the homes of the Amayar and the homelands of the Atha'an Miere. They are located mostly in the Sea of Storms, but there are also a few just west of the mainland, though not very far out into the Aryth Ocean.

The Atha'an Miere do not spend much time on the Isles, as is the case on the mainland as well, preferring their ships over dry land. The Amayar never leave the islands, however, but remain to live peaceful, rural lives, and following the Water Way.

Ivo.name: Ivo
Ivo.overview:
The River Ivo is a remote and little-known river which flows westwards out of the Black Hills and meets the Arinelle east of the Mountains of Mist. The river is surrounded by heavy forests on both sides which extend for hundreds of miles between Saldaea and Andor.

The area's extreme remoteness and lack of human settlement has made it popular with the Ogier, who inhabit no less than four stedding in this region: Shamendar, Taishin, Leitiang and Tsochan. All four of these stedding are located in the forests north of the river.

Jaern Rift.name: Jaern Rift
Jaern Rift.overview: The Jaern Rift is a sept of the Codarra Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Jagged Spire.name: Jagged Spire
Jagged Spire.overview: The Jagged Spire is a sept of the Taardad Aiel. The sept hold is unknown. Aviendha once heard that Wise Ones of the Jagged Spire and Four Holes septs could Heal using the One Power. She thought it was a boast.

Jahad Hold.name: Jahad Hold
Jahad Hold.overview: Jahan Hold is a hold of the Broken Cliff sept of the Daryne Aiel. It is the hold of Clan chief Mandelain and his wives Jair (roofmistress) and Corehuin. It's Wise One is Merale. It is only mentioned in The Wheel of Time Companion.

Jakanda.name: Jakanda
Jakanda.overview:
Jakanda is a town in Arafel.

Not much is known about this town other than there is a metal worker there. Samitsu Tamagowa has bells in her hair that were made in Jakanda.

Jalanda.name: Jalanda
Jalanda.overview: Jalanda was a great city during the Age of Legends. Any hint of its former existence was lost during or after the Breaking of the World.

Jangai Pass.name: Jangai Pass
Jangai Pass.overview:
For the chapter in The Fires of Heaven called "Jangai Pass", see The Fires of Heaven/Chapter 20 .

The Jangai Pass is the largest and most significant pass through the Spine of the World, leading from the kingdom of Cairhien into the Aiel Waste. It is the start of the Silk Path that stretches across the Waste to fabled Shara.

The Jangai Pass is located just south of the headwaters of the River Gaelin and is defended by two towns, Taien at the eastern end of the pass and Selean at the western.

The Aiel have invaded Cairhien twice using the Jangai Pass. Once during the Aiel War, when they sought out King Laman Damodred to punish him for his destruction of Avendoraldera, and again twenty years later when the Shaido invaded the kingdom before being stopped by Rand al'Thor in a major battle at the the city of Cairhien. Taien and Selean were both sacked on both occasions, and it appears unlikely that the towns will be rebuilt any time soon.

January.name: January
January.overview: January is the first month in the Gregorian calendar. It occurs in Wheel of Time world during Taisham 11 to Jumara 13.

Jara'copan.name: Jara'copan
Jara'copan.overview:
Jara'copan was an Ogier -built city of Manetheren.

Jara'copan was located in a valley in the foothills of the Mountains of Mist, six days south of the city of Manetheren itself, reachable by a road that wound along the feet of the mountains. The city itself spread across an area of about three square miles. Due to population pressures and the limitation of space in the city, it extended some way underground with elaborate subterrenean vaults and storage locations.

After the fall of Manetheren in the Trolloc Wars, Jara'copan was abandoned and over the past two thousand years has fallen into ruin. The highway linking it to Manetheren is now a barely-discernable track leading off from the Quarry Road and most of the buildings have collapsed. Among the surface structures only the Waygate remains intact. The subterrenean levels remain relatively intact, however.

Jaramide.name: Jaramide
Jaramide.overview: Jaramide was one of the Ten Nations that existed between the Breaking of the World and the Trolloc Wars. Its capital was Deranbar, which later bacame Maradon. It was the northwesternmost kingdom of its time, and was one of the first Borderlands.

Jarra (sept).name: Jarra (sept)
Jarra (sept).overview:
The Jarra is a sept of the Chareen Aiel. The sept hold is Shende Hold.

After Rand asks Aviendha what type of trouble could occur at Imre Stand, she suggests it could be a raid for sheep or goats by the White Mountain or Jarra septs of the Chareen clan. They are the two septs closest to Imre.

Jarra (village).name: Jarra (village)
Jarra (village).overview: Jarra is a village in Ghealdan just north of the border with Amadicia.

Jeade'en.name: Jeade'en
Jeade'en.overview: Jeade'en is the name of one of Rand al'Thor 's horses. His name means "True Finder" in the Old Tongue.

Jehannah.name: Jehannah
Jehannah.overview: Jehannah is the capital of Ghealdan and the location of the royal residence, the Jheda Palace.

Jehannah Road.name: Jehannah Road
Jehannah Road.overview: The Jehannah Road is a road in Ghealdan that connects Jehannah and Andor. Perrin Aybara was planning on traveling through it before a group of travelers informed his men that were traveling ahead that the road was too muddy to be able to travel through with carts.

Jenda.name: Jenda
Jenda.overview:
The Jenda is a sept of the Tomanelle Aiel. The sept hold is Mainde Cut Hold.

Chenda was roofmistress of Mainde Cut Hold when Bair was a girl.

Jenn Aiel.name: Jenn Aiel
Jenn Aiel.overview: The Jenn Aiel are an extinct faction of the Aiel. Unique among Aiel, they did not abandon the Way of the Leaf.

Jennshain.name: Jennshain
Jennshain.overview:
Jennshain was a city in Almoren, which was part of the Ten Nations in the centuries after the Breaking. Other than the name, and the fact that it is Ogier-built, little else is known about it.

Its name translated into the Common Tongue is possibly "True Peace" - from the Old Tongue words jenn (meaning "true, truly, or even 'only true'") and shain (meaning "peace").

Jeramel.name: Jeramel
Jeramel.overview: Jeramel is a town in Amadicia a hundred miles west of Abila. The Seanchan and the armies of Amadicia, under King Ailron, had a major military engagement fought here know as the Battle of Jeramel.

Jeranem.name: Jeranem
Jeranem.overview: Jeranem is a place in Seanchan with quite cold winters. No more is known about it.

Jhamara.name: Jhamara
Jhamara.overview:
Jhamara is a historical battle location.

A battle of the Children of the Light against Murandy and Altara. Because of a tickling in the back of his head, Niall set a third of his army to watch mountains said to be impassable; an Illianer army that was supposed to be a hundred miles away came out of those impassable passes.

Jheda Palace.name: Jheda Palace
Jheda Palace.overview: Jheda Palace is the seat of the monarch of Ghealdan, presumably it is in Jehannah, the capital city of the country.

Jhirad.name: Jhirad
Jhirad.overview: The Jhirad is a sept of the Goshien Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Ji'e'toh.name: Ji'e'toh
Ji'e'toh.overview:
Ji'e'toh is the complex system of honor that the Aiel follow. Ji'e'toh determines all interactions in Aiel life; fighting, housing, even intimate relationships and marriage. The term is from the Old Tongue and means, literally, honor and obligation.

Ji is honor, and toh is obligation. The greatest ji comes from touching an armed enemy in battle without harming them. This incurs a great deal of toh upon the enemy, and the person who is touched usually becomes gai'shain, which in the Old Tongue means "pledged to peace in battle." The person who becomes gai'shain does so, not only to fulfill his "toh" but to reduce the "ji" of the person he becomes gai'shain to.

A gai'shain serves his or her captor for a year and a day, touching no weapon, doing no battle, and wearing only white. Wise Ones, blacksmiths, women with a child under the age of ten, and those under the age of 16 may not be made gai'shain.

The least amount of ji comes from killing an enemy, as the Aiel believe that killing is far easier than disarming or capturing an opponent.

Under ji'e'toh shaming acts incur obligation ( toh) towards someone or oneself. Only the one committing the act can know the degree of shame (or obligation) incurred. Once met, there is no shame in having had toh.

Toh can be met by being gai'shain, enduring physical punishment, or performing shameful or trivial labor depending on how it was incurred. The more toh incurred, the more harsh or shameful the punishment must be to meet it.

Examples of shaming acts:

- Reminding or asking gai'shain of their life before putting on white. Being gai'shain is a kind of parenthesis in an Aiel's life, so reminding gai'shain of their earlier life is reminding them of the shame that brought them to their station. As gai'shain are considered noncombatants mistreating them in any way, even by prompting them to remember their previous life, is shameful and thus incurs great toh .
- Asking publicly if you have toh . Asking means that you don't know or understand your shame, which is doubly shameful.
- Reminding someone of toh they have already met. After meeting toh , there is no shame or obligation from what incurred it. Reminding someone of their previous shame (for instance, by talking of their time as gai'shain ) incurs toh toward them.

Ji'e'toh is not a monolithic set of rules to be followed blindly. Sometimes what needs to be done would be against ji'e'toh. Committing such an act does not go against ji'e'toh so long as toh incurred is met afterward.

Encompassing duty and custom, law and life, all Aiel live by this honor system. Following ji'e'toh is what defines an Aiel, as demonstrated by Egwene al'Vere during her apprenticeship to the Wise Ones in Cairhien. The Wise One Sorilea told her she had the "heart of an Aiel" because she understood ji'e'toh and met the obligations she had toward the Aiel.

Among the wetlanders, Sashalle Anderly, also apprenticed to Aiel Wise Ones, might also understand ji'e'toh.

Wetlanders typically struggle to understand ji'e'toh, and therefore struggle to understand Aiel.

Jianmin.name: Jianmin
Jianmin.overview: Jianmin is a location in Seanchan. Furyk Karede was there for the Jianmin Incident.

Jianmin Incident.name: Jianmin Incident
Jianmin Incident.overview: The Jianmin Incident was an event that happened on the Seanchan continent involving the location Jianmin. Furyk Karede served in the army during this event.

Jindo.name: Jindo
Jindo.overview: The Jindo is a sept of the Taardad Aiel. The sept hold is unknown. The sept chief is Heirn.

Jo-car.name: Jo-car
Jo-car.overview:
A Jo-car is a ground transportation vehicle used in the Age of Legends. They are small-capacity vehicles that come in two versions. One has four-wheels and runs on the ground, while the other utilizes anti-gravity technology.

Jo-cars were lost when the Breaking of the World began.

Jonine.name: Jonine
Jonine.overview: The Jonine is a sept of the Shaido Aiel. The sept hold is unknown. The Jonine are the fifth sept to join with Sevanna in Amadicia during the Shaido War.

JordanCon.name: JordanCon
JordanCon.overview:
JordanCon is an annual convention in Atlanta. It originally started and still largely focuses on the The Wheel of Time series of books, but has grown somewhat to encompass other works by Robert Jordan, other southern literature, and other Tor Books authors.

In 2013 JordanCon V will also be the site of the 51st annual DeepSouthCon.

Jornhill.name: Jornhill
Jornhill.overview:
Jornhill is a town in Andor. It is located on the northern border, near Kore Springs.

When the hearing in Kore Springs is held for Siuan Sanche, Leane Sharif and Min Farshaw, Maigan Nem wants the three of them "ridden out of town on a rail" all of the way to Jornhill.

Journal of the Unknown Scholar.name: Journal of the Unknown Scholar
Journal of the Unknown Scholar.overview: The Journal of the Unknown Scholar is a work of unknown authorship written in 1000 NE. It references the calamitous events that took place in the Westlands (and presumably elsewhere) in the buildup to the Last Battle.

Jualde.name: Jualde
Jualde.overview:
Jualde is a satellite village of Tar Valon, on the western bank of the river Erinin, were one of the six bridges of the city connects the island to the continent.

Because Tar Valon is often the target of attacks and sieges, the village has been a victim of many burnings over the years.

Jualdhe.name: Jualdhe
Jualdhe.overview:
Jualdhe is a village on the banks of the Alindrelle Erinin, to the southwest of the island of Tar Valon. It is nestled at the foot of a great Ogier -built bridge, which arches like stone lacework a mile across the river to the Shining Walls. From the foot of the bridge and through the village stretches a major road, which leads directly to Maradon far to the northwest.

Zerah Dacan rides south along the River Erinin and passes through Jualdhe on her return from Salidar, in an effort to disguise her origination by truthfully stating that she arrived from the north.

There was also a Jualdhe Bridge out of Tar Valon.

July.name: July
July.overview: July is the seventh month in the Gregorian calendar. It occurs in Wheel of Time world during Amadaine 23 to Tammaz 25.

Jumai.name: Jumai
Jumai.overview:
The Jumai are a sept of the Shaido Aiel.

Sevanna is of the Jumai sept and the Jumai all accompanied her to Ghealdan. They were the last sept to go through one of Caddar 's gateways. Sevanna also brought all the channeling Wise Ones with her.

There were almost twice as many gai'shain with Sevanna's Shaido in Malden as there were Jumai, her own people.

Aiel of the Jumai sept had a disagreement with the Mera'din - the Jumai said that the Mera'din would not get their share of the land's plunder (the " fifth ") because they are not part of their sept, yet Kinhuin argued that it was because the Mera'din were twice the number of Jumai and it would mean that the Jumai would get less if they have to share. He brings this matter to the Wise Ones.

Melindhra was also of the Jumai sept.

Jumara.name: Jumara
Jumara.overview: Jumara is the second month in the Farede calendar. In most years, it is equivalent to the real world period from January 19 to February 15. Chansein occurs on the 3rd of Jumara and the Feast of Abram occurs on the 9th.

June.name: June
June.overview: June is the sixth month in the Gregorian calendar. It occurs in Wheel of Time world during Saven 22 to Amadaine 22. Sunday occurs on the 21st of June.

Jurador.name: Jurador
Jurador.overview: Jurador is a large town in Altara.

Jurene.name: Jurene
Jurene.overview: Jurene is a village in Cairhien that sits on the River Erinin.

Justice.name: Justice
Justice.overview:
Justice is the legendary sword of Artur Paendrag Tanreall. The blade is slightly curved and not heron-marked. The hilt is cloth-tied. Rand claims to Min that the sword is a power-forged weapon, although when he gives it to Tam he expresses uncertainty about the sword's status.

It was believed lost until 1000 NE. An excavation uncovered the sword under a submerged statue, but its true nature remained unknown. It was taken to Rand al'Thor, who recognized it immediately. Oddly, he recognized it from his own memories and not from Lews Therin's. This indicates it was present at Falme, when the Heroes of the Horn - and specifically Hawkwing - were called to fight the Seanchan. When returning to the vicinity of Falme to parley with Tuon Athaem Kore Paendrag, Rand thinks to himself that Justice reminds him of his previous visit.

He gave it to his father, Tam al'Thor, as a farewell gift before the Last Battle.

Kabal Deep.name: Kabal Deep
Kabal Deep.overview:
Kabal Deep is a large bay or gulf that stretches between the southernmost peninsulas of Altara and Illian. The gulf is famed for its extreme depth, with sailors reporting not being able to touch bottom with their longest sounding lines just a few miles offshore. The mouth of the gulf is reported to be over one hundred leagues wide, stretching between Arran Head and the city of Illian itself.

The deep is particularly harshly affected by the cemaros, the storms that ravage the south coast of the Westlands during the winter.

Kabila.name: Kabila
Kabila.overview: A location, presumably in Shienar, where King Easar Togita of Shienar earned the nickname "Lion of Kabila" for winning a victory against Trollocs when the odds were against him. It is, presumably, close to the Blightborder.

Kaensada.name: Kaensada
Kaensada.overview: The Kaensada are hill tribes in Seanchan taken over by the Seanchan 300 years ago.

Kaensada Hills.name: Kaensada Hills
Kaensada Hills.overview:
The Kaensada Hills are a location on the Seanchan continent.

The Kaensada Hills were brought into the Seanchan empire circa 700 NE. Even after three hundred years, the local tribesmen are only half civilized.

Kaf.name: Kaf
Kaf.overview: Kaf is a dark and bitter drink brewed from beans and is popular (and exclusive) among the Seanchan. Kaf is served in small cups that drinkers balance on their finger tips and is used both as a daily indulgence and as a welcoming gesture with a friend or ally. Westlanders who drink kaf tend to think of it as undrinkable and that no amount of honey could possibly salvage the taste. Seanchan, on the other hand, find tea to be an extremely weak and unflavorful beverage by comparison. Kaf is a beverage to be savored, the "aroma of kaf is almost as enjoyable as the flavor."

Kaisin Pass.name: Kaisin Pass
Kaisin Pass.overview: At Kaisin Pass was fought a battle during the Trolloc Wars, it was won by the forces of the Light under the command of the Amyrlin Rashima Kerenmosa.

Kandelmar.name: Kandelmar
Kandelmar.overview:
Kandelmar is a town in Arad Doman.

Rodel Ituralde won a victory at Kandelmar against the Dragonsworn.

Kandor.name: Kandor
Kandor.overview: Kandor is one of the four Borderland nations which lie on the threshold of the Great Blight, sitting between Saldaea to the west and Arafel to the east. The sign of Kandor is a rearing red horse on a field of pale green.

Kandori Merchants' Guild.name: Kandori Merchants' Guild
Kandori Merchants' Guild.overview:
The Kandori Merchants' Guild protects and furthers the financial interests of Kandor, and its members are known and respected across the continent. Kandor is the only country with a large, nation-wide merchants' guild of which most traders and merchants are members. The merchants in other countries are generally too protective of their independence and competitiveness to join forces in such a manner. That the Kandori do so may be indicative of their pragmatic Borderland attitude, putting the needs of the country and the Borderlands ahead of personal concerns.

The guild headquarters is located in Chachin, capital of Kandor. There are way-stops, banking houses and trade stations run by the guild across the country, and there are many inns that cater to them (although usually not exclusively), such as the Evening Star.

Kardon.name: Kardon
Kardon.overview: A kardon is a leafless, spiny plant found in the Aiel Waste.

Katar.name: Katar
Katar.overview:
Katar is a city on the northeastern edge of Paedish Swar, the Darkwood to the east of Almoth Plain. It is claimed by by Arad Doman, although its remoteness from Bandar Eban ensures a level of autonomy and the Companion lists it as a city-state in its own right that exists outside of Domani territory. It lies just west of the Mountains of Mist and northwest of Lake Somal. Some official maps show it clearly outside of Arad Doman, others as being on, or close to, the border.

It is ruled by a group of Lords and is a trading center for numerous mines and smaller settlements in the Mountains of Mist, making it quite rich. The Glossary mentions that the lords "occasionally need reminding that they are part of Arad Doman", but this conflicts with both the Companion and the color map in the books. The political status seems complicated.

Kavarthen Wars.name: Kavarthen Wars
Kavarthen Wars.overview: The Kavarthen Wars were a series of conflicts that began sometime during the reign of the Brown Amyrlin Seat Balladare Arandaille, and possibly ended during her reign or continued into the reign of her successor, Medanor Eramandos. Apart from this information, nothing is known about the war.

Kayacun.name: Kayacun
Kayacun.overview: Kayacun is a town in Saldaea.

Keeper of the Chronicles.name: Keeper of the Chronicles
Keeper of the Chronicles.overview: The Keeper of the Chronicles, or more informally the Keeper, is a position among the sisters of the Aes Sedai. The Keeper is second to the Amyrlin Seat, although the only real power gained with the title is that which the Amyrlin chooses to give her.

Kesiera.name: Kesiera
Kesiera.overview:
A kesiera is a jeweled pendant on a chain worn as a hair ornament on the forehead. The pendant is commonly made of precious stone. It is usually worn by high ranking Cairhienin ladies.

The most well known kesiera is the one worn by Moiraine Damodred and is used as a focus for her eavesdropping, a skill she discovered as a girl.

Kharendor.name: Kharendor
Kharendor.overview: Kharendor was a nation of the Free Years. It arose from the ruins of Aelgar and was later conquered by both Guaire Amalasan and, some years later, Artur Hawkwing. Its territory currently contains the modern kingdom of Amadicia and the easternmost extent of the Shadow Coast.

Khodomar.name: Khodomar
Khodomar.overview: Khodomar was a kingdom of the Free Years. It was founded after the end of the Trolloc Wars, and was established on the former territories of southern Almoren and northern Essenia. It was later absorbed by the growing might of Artur Hawkwing's Empire. The lands it once held are now wilderness.

Khoweal.name: Khoweal
Khoweal.overview:
Khoweal is an area on the Seanchan continent.

Kennar Miraj has troops that come from Khoweal. People from Khoweal have black skin.

Ki'sain.name: Ki'sain
Ki'sain.overview:
The ki'sain is a small dot painted on the forehead of Malkieri women to indicate their marital status. A woman who wears the ki'sain is indicating that she has pledged her sons to fight the Shadow.

Nynaeve adopted the custom when she married Lan.

Kin's Farm.name: Kin's Farm
Kin's Farm.overview:
The Kin have a farm several miles northeast of Ebou Dar that serves as a retreat for women and also serves as a cover for Kin coming and going from Ebou Dar. The hard farm work is also used as a penance under the severe discipline system of the Kin. It is on the eastern side of the river Eldar.

After the gholam attacked in the Rahad store all the Kinswomen in Ebou Dar fled to the Farm, so most of them escaped from being captured as Damane by the Seanchan that conquered the city.

Near the Farm, on a rocky hill, the Bowl of the Winds was used to fix the weather.

The Farm area was completely destroyed when Elayne tried to unweave a Gateway to avoid to be followed by the Seanchan.

Kin's Storeroom.name: Kin's Storeroom
Kin's Storeroom.overview: The Kin's Storeroom was located in the Rahad district of Ebou Dar.

Kin.name: Kin
Kin.overview: The Kin is a group of female channelers who help women put out of the White Tower and in some rare cases also runaways. When encountered by Nynaeve and Elayne, there were 1,783 members. The ruling body is called the Knitting Circle, headed by the Eldest.

King's Palace.name: King's Palace
King's Palace.overview: The King's Palac e is the seat and ruling palace of the monarch of Illian. It is located in the city of Illian, opposite the Great Hall of the Council, across the Square of Tammaz.

Kingfisher Circles the Pond.name: Kingfisher Circles the Pond
Kingfisher Circles the Pond.overview: Kingfisher Circles the Pond is a sword form. It was used in a fight between Galadedrid Damodred and Eamon Valda. Galad was barely able to use this form when Valda attacked with The Dove Takes Flight.

Kingfisher Strikes in the Nettles.name: Kingfisher Strikes in the Nettles
Kingfisher Strikes in the Nettles.overview: Kingfisher Strikes in the Nettles is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Kinslayer's Dagger.name: Kinslayer's Dagger
Kinslayer's Dagger.overview: Kinslayer's Dagger is a stretch of mountains that jut out from the range called the Spine of the World. It is a major land mark in the region and is known for its impressively tall mountains. Its name is notably derived from Lews Therin Telamon.

Kintara.name: Kintara
Kintara.overview: Kintara was a small nation that came into existence after the Hundred Years War.

Kiranaille.name: Kiranaille
Kiranaille.overview: A wine served at The White Ring in Maderin, Altara.

Kirendad.name: Kirendad
Kirendad.overview:
Kirendad is the second largest city in Seanchan.

The city lies just south of the equator at the point where two rivers meet.

Kissing the Adder.name: Kissing the Adder
Kissing the Adder.overview: Kissing the Adder is a sword form. The movement of the form is unknown. Lan Mandragoran used this form to thrust his sword through an assassin's heart. The name suggest that this form is used in a close fight.

Knife of Dreams.name: Knife of Dreams
Knife of Dreams.overview: Knife of Dreams (abbreviated KoD ) is the eleventh book in the The Wheel of Time series. It was published by Tor Books in the U.S. and Orbit in the UK, and released on October 11, 2005. It is 859 pages long.

Knitting Circle.name: Knitting Circle
Knitting Circle.overview: The Knitting Circle is the group of thirteen women who lead The Kin, a group mostly formed by White Tower initiates who failed to achieve the rank of Aes Sedai.

Known Contradictions and Points of Ambig.name: Known Contradictions and Points of Ambiguity
Known Contradictions and Points of Ambig.overview: The aim of this page is to collect known contradictions and logical conflicts from the Books. The structure and the content is continuously reshaped during the process. All help is welcomed. Please follow the section structure and always reference your statements.

Kore Springs.name: Kore Springs
Kore Springs.overview: Kore Springs is a town in the northern part of Andor, and is the site of Gareth Bryne 's family home.

Kori.name: Kori
Kori.overview: A huge, wild, spotted cat from the Sen T'jore in Seanchan.

Kunwar.name: Kunwar
Kunwar.overview: Kunwar is a region or fief located in Saldaea, it belonged to the former Queen Tenobia.

Lady.name: Lady
Lady.overview: Lady is an honorific title for a female of some influence. It can be used to refer to Nobility, Aes Sedai, and other dignitaries.

Laila Lewin's infant.name: Laila Lewin's infant
Laila Lewin's infant.overview: Laila Lewin's infant is a Two Rivers resident. It was born to Natley Lewin and Laila Lewin in 998 NE or, more likely, 999 NE.

Lake Somal.name: Lake Somal
Lake Somal.overview:
Lake Somal is the largest lake in the Westlands. It lies between Paerish Swar and the Mountains of Mist, southeast of Arad Doman and east of Almoth Plain. Despite its size it is somewhat remote and relatively unknown, although a trading road links it to the city of Katar a hundred miles or so to the northwest. Some maps show the lake as being the source of one of the many tributaries of the River Andahar.

The Dragonsworn used the area as a base of operations during their war against Arad Doman. They were defeated in a battle on the lakeshore by General Rodel Ituralde, but orders from King Alsalam Saeed Almadar meant that the victory could not be completed.

Lamma Sor.name: Lamma Sor
Lamma Sor.overview:
Lamma Sor occurs the day after the first quarter moon of the month of Saban. The solemn holiday is also called the "Day of Remembrance." On this day, nothing is eaten but bread, water, salt, and oil. It is a day of prayers for all those who have and all those who will fall defending against the Blight.

It is celebrated in the Borderlands.

Language.name: Language
Language.overview: Only a few languages are known, despite the size of the world. This may be due to the universal language used by all during the Age of Legends, and the continued printing and trade of books among the nations of the World.

Larapelle.name: Larapelle
Larapelle.overview: Larapelle was the site of a battle won by the Soldier Amyrlin Rashima Kerenmosa during the Trolloc Wars.

Larcheen.name: Larcheen
Larcheen.overview: A place in the Age of Legends that inspired the saying, “as black as midnight in Larcheen.”

Last Battle.name: Last Battle
Last Battle.overview: The Last Battle, or Tarmon Gai'don (pronounced: TAHR-mohn GAY-dohn) in the Old Tongue, also known as The Time of Return by Darkfriends, is the apocalyptic confrontation between the Dragon Reborn - Rand al'Thor - and the Dark One that was prophesied to end the Third Age of the Wheel of Time. It was fought in 1000 NE in multiple fronts, mainly in the Borderlands, Shayol Ghul, Andor, and Cairhien. All nations of the world took part, as did many non-national military organizations, such as the Children of the Light, and even non-militaristic groups such as the Tuatha'an, Ogier, and the wolves. Despite suffering heavy losses, the forces of the Light were able to achieve the destruction of the Shadow's forces and the complete restoration of the Dark One's prison.

Leaf on the Breeze.name: Leaf on the Breeze
Leaf on the Breeze.overview: Leaf on the Breeze is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it. Turak Aladon used this form against Rand al'Thor during their fight in Falme. Rand countered with Lightning of Three Prongs. Either Galadedrid Damodred or Eamon Valda used this form to counter Eel Among the Lily Pads during their fight.

Leafhunter.name: Leafhunter
Leafhunter.overview: Leafhunter is a she- wolf, pack leader and mate to Feather.

Legends.name: Legends
Legends.overview: For the chapter in The Gathering Storm called "Legends", see The Gathering Storm/Chapter 34 .

Legion.name: Legion
Legion.overview: A legion is a military unit under the command of a Lieutenant-General consisting of five to six banners.

Legion of the Wall.name: Legion of the Wall
Legion of the Wall.overview:
The Legion of the Wall is the elite military formation and standing army of the kingdom of Ghealdan. It is named for Garen's Wall, the immense ridgeline on the northeastern edge of the country that formed its major defensive fortification for the entirety of its existence and even prior, when the kingdom of Dhowlan used the wall as a defensive bulwark in its wars with Farashelle to the north.

The Legion was the only major, professional military body in a small country whose main martial strength lay in levies. The Legion provided the core to a levy army raised in times of crisis, acted as both the bodyguard to the King or Queen, and also policed the capital city of Jehannah.

The Legion suffered severe losses in the battles against the false Dragon Logain Ablar and the alleged self-proclaimed Prophet of the Dragon, Masema Dagar. It was dispersed on Masema's orders. Ghealdan's Crown High Council refused to let Queen Alliandre Maritha Kigarin reconstitute the Legion after Masema moved into Amadicia, feeling that the absence of the Legion gave greater influence and power to them. Despite this point, Alliandre had begun to reconstitute the Legion, appointing Gerard Arganda as First Captain, prior to her abduction by the Shaido Aiel.

After Alliandre was captured by the Shaido, her Liege Lord Perrin Aybara embarked on a mission to rescue her and his wife, Faile Bashere. This campaign culminated at the Battle of Malden, by which time the Ghealdanin contingent of his forces had grown confident enough to openly name themselves the Legion of the Wall once more. The Crown High Council's reaction to this news remains to be seen.

Leopard's Caress.name: Leopard's Caress
Leopard's Caress.overview:
For other similarly named sword forms, see Leopard in High Grass and Leopard in the Tree .

Leopard's Caress is a sword form. The movement of the form is not known. Galadedrid Damodred changed Plucking the Low-Hanging Apple into Leopard's Caress while fighting with Eamon Valda. During their practice session, Marlesh tried using this form against Gawyn Trakand, but Gawyn countered with Folding the Air.

Leopard in High Grass.name: Leopard in High Grass
Leopard in High Grass.overview:
For other similarly named sword forms, see Leopard in the Tree and Leopard's Caress .

Leopard in High Grass is a sword form. It is a walking stance assumed when there are enemies on all sides. While in Canluum, and agitated over the news of Edeyn Arrel 's political ploys, Lan Mandragoran unconsciously fell into this walking stance and scared off a horse groom.

Leopard in the Tree.name: Leopard in the Tree
Leopard in the Tree.overview:
For other similarly named sword forms, see Leopard in High Grass and Leopard's Caress .

Leopard in the Tree is a sword form. It is a stance with the swordsman grasping the hilt of his weapon, waiting on the brink of drawing. Jahar Narishma assumed this form when Cadsuane Melaidhrin first came to Rand al'Thor in Cairhien.

Lesser Blight.name: Lesser Blight
Lesser Blight.overview: The Lesser Blight is a separate, isolated portion of the Great Blight that is located on the Seanchan continent. It directly corresponds latitudinally with the Blight in the Westlands. While it does show the effects of the Dark One 's influence, it holds very few Shadowspawn, as all the Trollocs and Myrddraal were hunted down and killed in the years following the Breaking of the World, and as the Lesser Blight is cut off from the rest of the Blight, none are able to return. Some Shadowspawn such as Draghkar still live in the Seanchan Blight. Because Trollocs and Myrrdraal are extinct in Seanchan, the people of Seanchan are skeptical about the existence and dangerousness of Shadowspawn in the Westlands.

Lian (Hunter of the Horn).name: Lian (Hunter of the Horn)
Lian (Hunter of the Horn).overview: Lian was a legendary Hunter of the Horn and Hero of the Horn.

Liandrin's group of Black Sisters.name: Liandrin's group of Black Sisters
Liandrin's group of Black Sisters.overview: During Egwene 's absence from the White Tower and her captivity among the Seanchan at Falme, Liandrin Guirale and a group of twelve other Black Ajah sisters raided the ter'angreal storerooms in the Tower and killed sisters, Warders, and tower staff to make their escape. This group of Black Ajah were sent on a mission by the Forsaken Ishamael to serve Be'lal in Tear. This was the first time in thousands of years that the Black Ajah was exposed. Prior to this event, the existence of an Ajah solely devoted to the Shadow was hinted upon, but never came to light.

Lieutenant-General.name: Lieutenant-General
Lieutenant-General.overview: The Lieutenant-General was a rank in the armies used during the period a few centuries before the Trolloc Wars until the War of a Hundred Years that commanded a Legion.

Lift.name: Lift
Lift.overview:
A lift was a machine used in the Age of Legends to effortlessly transport people between different floors of a building.

The engineering knowledge to create lifts were lost when the Breaking of the World began. Mesaana tells Alviarin Freidhen about the use of lifts, causing her to grow weary of having to only use the long staircases in the White Tower when she has to hide her knowledge of Traveling.

Lightning of Three Prongs.name: Lightning of Three Prongs
Lightning of Three Prongs.overview: Lightning of Three Prongs is a sword form. The movement of the form is unknown.

Lion (horse).name: Lion (horse)
Lion (horse).overview: Lion is a horse owned by Lord Orban.

Lion on the Hill (sword form).name: Lion on the Hill (sword form)
Lion on the Hill (sword form).overview:
For the chapter in Lord of Chaos by the same name, see Lord of Chaos/Chapter 1 .

Lion on the Hill is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it. Rand al'Thor flows through this form while sparring against five men in Caemlyn.

Lion Throne.name: Lion Throne
Lion Throne.overview:
The Lion Throne is the ruling seat of power of Andor. It is located in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn, and has golden lion paws on the feet, with the White Lion of Andor picked out in moonstones on the back. The White Lion is also displayed on the front above the queen's head, again in moonstones but within a field of rubies.

The throne is sized for a woman, and no man can sit in it comfortably. As a result of the throne's scaling, Rand al'Thor brought in his own throne to use and placed the Lion Throne on a pedestal behind his own throne. This was meant as a reminder that Elayne Trakand has yet to take the throne, but many misinterpreted it and saw the throne as a prize offered by Rand, this offended many Andorans.

The Lion Throne is alternatively used symbolically for the queenship of Andor with the Rose Crown.

Lioness.name: Lioness
Lioness.overview: Lioness was a horse ridden by Elayne Trakand in Ebou Dar.

Lionheart.name: Lionheart
Lionheart.overview: Lionheart is an herb used medicinally by Seanchan. It helps alleviate pain.

List of Blue Ajah sisters.name: List of Blue Ajah sisters
List of Blue Ajah sisters.overview:
The table below lists all known named members of the Blue Ajah together with information about each, mostly from The Wheel of Time Companion. It does not include the ancient Blue Ajah scholar Lannis, nor the historical Amyrlins Comarra Zepava, Suilin Escanda, Edarna Noregovna, Eldaya Tolen, Feragaine Saralman, Ishara Nawan or Noane Masadim as we know little more than their dates of tenure. The Amyrlins Deane Aryman, Tamra Ospenya and Marith Jaen have been included as we have extra information.

Key to Columns

- Nat : Nationality.
- Str : Strength on the 72-level scale in the One Power. 72 is the weakest level. All Aes Sedai have a minimum strength of 45.
- Nov : Years spent as a novice.
- Acc : Years spent as Accepted.
- Rank : Strength on alternative scale with 1 being the strongest Aes Sedai in the White Tower at the beginning of the series. All Aes Sedai have a minimum rank of 33.
- Age : Age by the end of 1000 NE or at time of death.
- AS : Years wearing the shawl.
- Enr : Age when entered into the novice book.
- Stat : Dead (D) or Alive (A), Captured (C). Unless proven otherwise, sisters are assumed to be alive by default.
- DF : Darkfriend Yes (Y) or No (N).
- Bonds : Warders or people they are bonded to or by.
- Notes : Any other important information.

All Blue Ajah sisters are assumed to be part of the Rebel Aes Sedai faction, with the notable exception of those women who may have died between the events of New Spring and the White Tower Schism.

List of Brown Ajah sisters.name: List of Brown Ajah sisters
List of Brown Ajah sisters.overview:
“Each of you pick two,” Lyrelle said to her companions. “A few of us will

take only one. Faolain and Theodrin, you are among those. Be quick about it, all
of you. I want away from this place as soon as possible.”

The table below lists all known named members of the Brown Ajah together with information about each, mostly from The Wheel of Time Companion. It does not include the ancient Brown Ajah scholar Yasicca Cellaech, nor the historical Amyrlins Balladare Arandaille, Doniella Alievin, Igaine Luin, Zeranda Tyrim or Kirin Melway as we know little more than their dates of tenure.

Key to Columns

- Nat : Nationality.
- Str : Strength on the 72-level scale in the One Power. 72 is the weakest level.
- Nov : Years spent as a novice.
- Acc : Years spent as Accepted.
- Rank : Strength on alternative scale with 1 being the strongest Aes Sedai in the White Tower at the beginning of the series.
- Age : Age by the end of 1000 NE or at time of death.
- AS : Years wearing the shawl.
- Enr : Age when entered into the novice book.
- Stat : Dead (D) or Alive (A), Captured (C). Unless proven otherwise, sisters are assumed to be alive by default.
- Fact. : Member of the Loyalist (L), or Rebel (R), or Unknown (U) or Neutral (N) faction of during the White Tower Schism . If blank, none of these apply.
- DF : Darkfriend Yes (Y) or No (N).
- Bonds : Warders or people they are bonded to or by.
- Notes : Any other important information.

List of Gray Ajah sisters.name: List of Gray Ajah sisters
List of Gray Ajah sisters.overview:
The table below lists all known named members of the Gray Ajah together with information about each, mostly from The Wheel of Time Companion. It does not include the historical Amyrlins Dalaine Ndaye, Medanor Eramandos, Elise Strang, Serenia Latar, Cerilla Marodred, Gerra Kishar, Cemaile Sorenthaine and Parenia Demalle nor the historical figure Sevlana Meseau as we have little information other than their names and tenures. The legendary Gray sisters Mabriam en Shereed and the recent Amyrlin Sierin Vayu are included, however.

Key to Columns

- Nat : Nationality.
- Str : Strength on the 72-level scale in the One Power.  > means strictly stronger than and < means strictly weaker than.
- Nov : Years spent as a novice.
- Acc : Years spent as Accepted.
- Rank : Strength on alternative scale with 1 being the strongest Aes Sedai in the White Tower at the beginning of the series. + after the number signifies the levels above this strength.
- Age : Age by the end of 1000 NE or at time of death.
- AS : Years wearing the shawl.
- Enr : Age when entered into the novice book.
- Stat : Dead (D) or Alive (A), Captured (C). Unless proven otherwise, sisters are assumed to be alive by default.
- Fact. : Member of the Loyalist (L), or Rebel (R), or Unknown (U) or Neutral (N) faction of during the White Tower Schism . If blank, none of these apply.
- DF : Darkfriend Yes (Y) or No (N).
- Bonds : Warders or people they are bonded to or by.
- Notes : Any other important information.

List of Green Ajah sisters.name: List of Green Ajah sisters
List of Green Ajah sisters.overview:
The table below lists all known named members of the Green Ajah together with information about each, mostly from The Wheel of Time Companion. It does not include the historical Amyrlins Aleis Romlin, Kiyosa Natomo, Myriam Copan, Nirelle Coidevwin, Selame Necoine, Shein Chunla or Varuna Morrigan nor the historical figures Eleyan al'Landerin or Chowin Tsao as we have little information other than their names and tenures. The legendary Green sisters Caraighan Maconar and Rashima Kerenmosa are included, however.

Key to Columns

- Nat : Nationality.
- Str : Strength on the 72-level scale in the One Power.  > means strictly stronger than and < means strictly weaker than.
- Nov : Years spent as a novice.
- Acc : Years spent as Accepted.
- Rank : Strength on alternative scale with 1 being the strongest Aes Sedai in the White Tower at the beginning of the series. + after the number signifies the levels above this strength.
- Age : Age by the end of 1000 NE or at time of death.
- AS : Years wearing the shawl.
- Enr : Age when entered into the novice book.
- Stat : Dead (D) or Alive (A), Captured (C). Unless proven otherwise, sisters are assumed to be alive by default.
- Fact. : Member of the Loyalist (L), or Rebel (R), or Unknown (U) or Neutral (N) faction of during the White Tower Schism . If blank, none of these apply.
- DF : Darkfriend Yes (Y) or No (N).
- Bonds : Warders or people they are bonded to or by.
- Notes : Any other important information.

List of Houses.name: List of Houses
List of Houses.overview: A House is a noble family. Many nations in the Westlands have noble houses. Below are the noble houses by nation.

List of Old Tongue words.name: List of Old Tongue words
List of Old Tongue words.overview: This page gives sortable lists of all known words in the Old Tongue. It is split into two sections, one of "atomic" words and one of "compound" words which are derived by combining words from the first list. Both lists are from the entry on the Old Tongue from The Wheel of Time Companion.

List of Red Ajah sisters.name: List of Red Ajah sisters
List of Red Ajah sisters.overview:
The table below lists all known named members of the Red Ajah together with information about each, mostly from The Wheel of Time Companion.

Key to Columns

- Nat : Nationality.
- Str : Strength on the 72-level scale in the One Power. 72 is the weakest level. All Aes Sedai have a minimum strength of 45.
- Nov : Years spent as a novice.
- Acc : Years spent as Accepted.
- Rank : Strength on alternative scale with 1 being the strongest Aes Sedai in the White Tower at the beginning of the series. All Aes Sedai have a minimum rank of 33.
- Age : Age by the end of 1000 NE or at time of death.
- AS : Years wearing the shawl.
- Enr : Age when entered into the novice book.
- Stat : Dead (D) or Alive (A), Captured (C). Unless proven otherwise, sisters are assumed to be alive by default.
- DF : Darkfriend Yes (Y) or No (N).
- Bonds : Warders or people they are bonded to or by. For Red Ajah, we assume they are not bonded unless we know otherwise.
- Notes : Any other important information.

All the Red sisters were Loyalists during the White Tower Schism. They, at least, kept any criticisms of Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan in private and there were no know Red sisters in the Rebel or unaligned groups. The Amyrlins Bonwhin Meraighdin and Tetsuan do not appear in this table.

List of songs.name: List of songs
List of songs.overview:
There are many songs mentioned in the series, sometimes with the same tune but a different name. They are played in taverns, inns and at campfires by gleemen, bards, musicians, dancing girls or soldiers seeking to entertain or be entertained. Lyrics for several are provided in the chapters and are included here where they exist. For The Song that is sought after by the Tuatha'an, see the relevant section of that page.

Always Choose the Right Horse: See The Marriage of Cinny Wade.

Berin's Retreat: See The Wind from the North.

Blue Sky Dawning':
May not be a real song. It was used as a code word by Siuan Sanche at an inn in Lugard.

The Dancing Lass: See A Lugard Girl.

Cock o' the North:
Was played by Rand al'Thor in Four Kings at the Dancing Cartman to earn lodging for the night.

Come Ye Maids:
Sung at the firepits of the Band of the Red Hand as Matrim Cauthon prepared to leave for the Tower of Ghenjei.

Coming Home From Tarwin's Gap:
Played by Rand al'Thor for the Grinwell family. Also sung by the Two Rivers men when Perrin Aybara leads them to Emond's Field.

My home is waiting there for me,

and the girl I left behind.

Of all the treasure that waits for me,

that’s what I want to find.

Her eyes so merry, and her smile so sweet,

her hugs so warm, and her ankle neat,

her kisses hot, now there’s a treat.

If there’s a treasure greater, it lies not in my mind.

Oh, I have seen stark Tarwin’s Gap,

and the Trollocs’ raving horde.

I have stood ‘fore the Halfman’s charge,

and walked on death’s cold borde.

But a winsome lass, she waits for me,

for a dance, and a kiss ‘neath the apple tree . . . [ 5 ]

The Color of Trust: The name of a song that Matrim Cauthon remembers while dancing in Salidar. He has the memory of the man that wrote the song, or at least those lyrics. Given the company of so many Aes Sedai, he thinks it unlikely that those lyrics are known or intended by the musicians. Several incarnations of this song have been composed and performed by fans. See External Links.

Give me your trust, said the Aes Sedai.

On my shoulders I support the sky.

Trust me to know and to do what is best,

And I will take care of the rest.

But trust is the color of a dark seed growing.

Trust is the color of a heart’s blood flowing.

Trust is the color of a soul’s last breath.

Trust is the color of death.

Give me your trust, said the queen on her throne,

for I must bear the burden all alone.

Trust me to lead and to judge and to rule,

and no man will think you a fool.

But trust is the sound of the grave-dog’s bark.

Trust is the sound of betrayal in the dark.

Trust is the sound of a soul’s last breath.

Trust is the sound of death.

Give me your trust, said the king on high...

Give me your trust, said the lady and lord...

Give me your trust, said the love of your life...

Trust is the taste of death.

Colors of the Sun: See Jolly Jaim.

Dance with Jak o' the Shadows:
A song usually sung by Matrim Cauthon and the Band of the Red Hand. According to Mat, it has not been heard since Aldeshar fell to Artur Hawkwing 1,000 years before. For full lyrics and other parallels, see the main page.

Darling Sara:
See Ferry O'er the River.

The Drunken Peddlar: See Tinker in the Kitchen.

Fallen Willows at Noon:
Sung at the firepits of the Band of the Red Hand as Mat prepared to leave for the Tower of Ghenjei.

Ferry O'er the River:
Played by Rand al'Thor in Arien to earn lodging for the night. Also known as Darling Sara.

The First Rose of Summer:
Played by Thomdril Merrilin at the Three Plum Court inn in Tanchico.

Fluff the Feathers:
A song that Matrim Cauthon recognizes while dancing in Salidar. He thinks of it as "a good country dance."

The Fool Who Thought He Was King: A song popular in Cairhien during the civil war. Jasin Natael played it, to the annoyance of Rand al'Thor.

Forward the Lion:
Sung by a crowd in the streets of Caemlyn.

Forward the Lion, forward the Lion,

the White Lion takes the field.

Roar defiance at the Shadow.

Forward the Lion, forward, Andor triumphant.

A Frog On the Ice:
Hummed by Talmanes Delovinde as Matrim Cauthon tries to impress Betse Silvin, a serving girl at The Golden Stag.

Goodman Priket's Pipe: See River Iralell.

Hard Rain Falling: See The Wind from the North.

Heron on the Wing:
A song from Emond's Field.

I Have Loved a Thousand Sailor Men:
A song taught by Temaile to Amathera.

My breasts are round, and my hips are too

I can flatten a whole ship's crew.

My thighs are strong are strong as anchor chain.

My kiss can burst — [ 14 ]

' I'm Down at the Bottom of the Well: A song that Matrim Cauthon hums at several points in the story; during his escape from Tar Valon, when caught at spearpoint by Aiel at the Stone of Tear, and as he plans his escape from Ebou Dar. Mat also remembers the tune as belonging to The Last Stand at Mandenhar, a song from the Court of Takedo, in Farashelle over a thousand years ago.

I'm down at the bottom of the well,

It's night, and the rain is coming down

The sides are falling in

and there's no rope to climb,

I'm down at the bottom of the well.

I Will Steal Your Breath With Kisses:
A song that Tylin hums to Mat. The song is known in Ebou Dar.

If You Go To Be a Soldier:
A recruiting song and sung by The Band of the Red Hand.

You’ll feed on beans and on rotten hay,

and a horse’s hoof come your naming day.

You’ll sweat and bleed till you grow old,

and your only gold will be dreams of gold,

if you go to be a soldier.

If you go to be a soldier.

Your girl will marry another man.

A muddy grave will be all your land.

Food for the worms and none to mourn.

You’ll curse the day you were ever born,

if you go to be a soldier.

if you go to be a soldier.

Jaem's Folly:
A song in Emond's Field.

Jolly Jaim: Played by Rand al'Thor in Four Kings at the Dancing Cartman to earn lodging for the night. It is also known as Rhea's Fling and Colors of the Sun.

Lament for the Long Night: A song that Rand plays on his flute at the The Counsel’s Head inn in Far Madding. Rand does not know the song – it comes from Lews Therin ’s memory.

Life is a Dream: Lyrics that open an Aiel dirge for the dead. The song is a haunting melody sung in parts. The Aiel sing it for the dead after Dumai's Wells.

Life is a dream — that knows no shade.

Life is a dream — of pain and woe.

A dream from which — we pray to wake.

A dream from which — we wake and go.

Who would sleep — when the new dawn waits?

Who would sleep — when the sweet winds blow?

A dream must end — when the new day comes.

This dream from which — we wake and go.

A Lugard Girl: A song heard by Perrin Aybara at the Easing the Badger inn in Illian.

Perrin knows the tune as The Dancing Lass.

A Lugard girl, she came to town,

to see what she could see.

With a wink of her eye, and a smile on her lip,

she snagged a boy or three, or three.

With an ankle slim, and skin so pale,

she caught the owner of a ship, a ship.

With a soft little sigh, and a gay little laugh,

she made her way so free.

So free.

..I'll wear no shift at all.

At all.

The Marriage of Cinny Wade: A slow, haunting song that Mat heard Thom play at the Two Apples inn in Caemlyn. Mat had learned the song as Always Choose the Right Horse, and it was played faster.

Midean's Ford: A song played by Jasin Natael in the Aiel Waste. It is a tragic tale about the defeat of King Buiryn and the forces of Manetheren at Midean's Ford at the hands of King Aedomon and the forces of Safer. Aedomon was so impressed by ther bravery and loyalty to their king that he allowed the survivors to return home and turne his own forces back to Safer. Asmodean knew the song and the story behind it, despite being bound in Shayol Ghul since before the founding of Manetheren. Robert Jordan said that the Forsaken were somewhat aware of the outside world as time passed, but exactly how they gained knowledge is unknown.

Soft, the winds, like springtime’s fingers.

Soft, the rains, like heaven’s tears.

Soft, the years roll by in gladness,

never hinting storms to come,

never hinting whirlwinds’ ravage,

rain of steel and battle thunder,

war to tear the heart asunder.

...Back across the blood-red water,

marching back with heads held high.

No surrender, arm or sword,

no surrender, heart or soul.

Honor be theirs, ever after,

honor all the Age shall know.

Mistress Aynora's Rooster: Rand al'Thor played this for the Grinwell family. It is also heard by Perrin Aybara at the Easing the Badger inn in Illian.

My Love Is a Wild Rose: A song known in Emond's Field. Perrin Aybara heard it playing when he awoke after shooting Slayer in the Wolf Dream.

My Loves are So Many: A song heard in The White Ring, an inn in Maderin.

As I walked out one fine spring day,

I met young Jac who was pitching hay,

his hair so fair, and his eyes were too.

Well. I gave him a kiss; oh, what could I do?

We snuggled and we tickled while the sun rose high.

and I won't say how often he made me sigh.

Now Jac gels an hour when the sky is clear,

and Willi gets an hour when my father's not near.

It's the hayloft with Moril for he shows no fear,

and Keilin comes at midday: he's oh so bold!

Brelan gets an evening when the night is cold.

Master Andril gets a morning, but he's very old.

Oh. what, oh what is a poor girl to do?

My loves are so many and the hours so few.

"Ogier Song": The Ogier sing this song. The name of the song, if it has any, is unknown.

Clear the field, smooth it low.

Let no weed or stubble stand.

Here we labor, here we toil,

here the towering trees will grow.

The Old Black Bear: Played by Rand al'Thor for the Grinwell family.

The Old Gray Goose: A funny song played by Thomdril Merrilin at the Three Plum Court inn in Tanchico.
