Old Jak's Up a Tree: Played by Rand al'Thor at The Nine Rings inn.

The Old Two Rivers Leaf: Played by Rand al'Thor at The Nine Rings inn.

Only One Boot: A funny song played by Thomdril Merrilin at the Three Plum Court inn in Tanchico.

Only One Bucket of Water: Played by Thomdril Merrilin in Baerlon.

' Pretty Maids Dancing: See Three Girls in a Meadow.

Rhea's Fling: See Jolly Jaim.

River Iralell: A song known in Cairhien. Rand al'Thor knew it as Goodman Priket's Pipe and played it at The Nine Rings inn.

We rode down to River Iralell just to see the Taren come.

We stood along the riverbank with the rising of the sun.

Their horses blacked the summer plain, their banners blacked the sky.

But we stood our ground on the banks of River Iralell.

Oh, we stood our ground. Yes, we stood our ground.

Stood our ground along the river in the morning.

The Road to Dun Aren: Played by Rand al'Thor in Arien to earn lodging for the night.

Rooster in the Gumtree: A song that Min Farshaw thought sounded like the tune Rand al'Thor played on the flute in the Sun Palace in Cairhien.

Rose of the Morning: A tune that Rand al'Thor played on his flute, at a campsite on his way to Tear.

Shaido taunt: A song was composed by an insightful and creative Shaido while being interrogated by Perrin.

I once met a man who was far from home.

His eyes were yellow and his wits were stone.

He asked me to hold smoke in my hand,

and said he could show me a watery land.

He put his head in the ground and his feet in the air,

and said he could dance like a woman fair.

He said he could stand till he turned to stone.

When I blinked my eyes, he was gone.

She Dazzles My Eyes and Clouds My Mind: A song that Matrim Cauthon hums in Ebou Dar. In Ebou Dar it is known as Upside Down and 'Round and 'Round.

She Wore a Mask That Hid Her Face: A song hummed by Matrim Cauthon after Thomdril Merrilin killed a Darkfriend. ' The Song: See The Song.

The Song of a Hundred Days: A song which includes the story of Villiam Bloodletter, who attacked and defeated the Banath people.

The Song of Three Fishes: May not be a real song. It was used as a code word by Siuan Sanche at an inn in Lugard.

Sweet Whispers of Tomorrow: "A mournful sound, played for the fallen dead." Thom played it as he, Mat and Moiraine were about to be overrun by the Aelfinn.

Oh, how long were the days of a man.

When he strode upon the broken land.

He sailed as far as a man could steer.

And he never wished to lose his fear.

For the fear of man is a thing untold.

It keeps him safe, and it proves him bold!

Don't let fear make you cease to strive,

for that fear it proves you remain alive!

I will walk this broken road,

and I will carry a heavy load!

So come at me with your awful lies,

I'm a man of truth and I'll meet your eyes!

Three Girls in a Meadow: A song known in Emond's Field. It is also known to the Tuatha'an as Pretty Maids Dancing.

The Tinker Has My Pots: A song known in Emond's Field. The Tuatha'an know it as Toss the Feathers.

Tinker in the Kitchen: Matrim Cauthon sang this while in the Aiel Waste. The lyrics fit to the tune of "Skip to My Lou", but this may be coincidence. This song was also played, under the title The Drunken Peddlar, by Rand al'Thor in Four Kings at the Dancing Cartman to earn lodging for the night and again while at the Counsel's Head in Far Madding. Rand thinks the song jolly enough to wake the dead.

Tinker in the kitchen; with a job of work to do.

Mistress up above, slipping on a robe of blue.

She dances down the staircase, her fancy all so free,

crying, Tinker, oh, dear Tinker, won’t you mend a pot for me? [ 35 ]

Toss the Feathers: See The Tinker Has My Pots.

Two Kings Came Hunting: Played by Rand al'Thor in Four Kings at the Dancing Cartman to earn lodging for the night. It is also known as Two Horses Running.

Upside Down and 'Round and 'Round: See She Dazzles My Eyes and Clouds My Mind.

Wash the Spears: An Aiel battle chant.

Wash the spears — while the sun climbs high.

Wash the spears — while the sun falls low.

Wash the spears — Who fears to die?

Wash the spears — No one I know!

Wash the spears — while life holds true.

Wash the spears — until life ends.

Wash the spears...

...Wash the spears — Life is a dream.

Wash the spears — All dreams must end.

Wash the spears — till shade is gone.

Wash the spears — till water turns dry.

Wash the spears — How long from home?

Wash the spears — Until I die!

Wash the spears — till the sun grows cold.

Wash the spears — till water runs free.

Wash the spears...

Wash the spears — while I breathe.

Wash the spears — my steel is bright.

Wash the spears... [ 36 ]

We're Over the Border Again: A song hummed by Matrim Cauthon as he leaves Tar Valon.

What He Said To Me: Sung by a woman at The Tremalking Splice, a tavern in Tar Valon. Matrim Cauthon remembered it as Will You Dance With Me.

The Wheel Turns: Poem composed by Doreille Torghin.

The Wheel has turned, for better or worse.

And it will keep on turning,

As lights die and forests dim,

Storms call and skies break.

Turn it will.

The Wheel is not hope,

And the Wheel does not care,

The Wheel simply is.

But so long as it turns,

Folk may hope, folk may care.

For with light that fades, another will eventually grow,

And each storm that rages must eventually die.

As long as the Wheel turns. As long as it turns...

Wild Geese on the Wing: Song played by Thomdril Merrilin in Baerlon.

The Wind From the North: A song known in Emond's Field. According to the Tuatha'an, it is also known as Hard Rain Falling and Berin's Retreat. Hard Rain Falling may be a reference to the Bob Dylan song 'A Hard Rain's Gonna Fall from the album The Freewheelin’ Bob Dylan, which also contains the songs Blowin' in the Wind and Girl from the North, which features the wind prominently, possible sources for the name The Wind from the North.

The Wind in the Barley is a song from Emond's Field. This could be a reference to the old Irish folk song The Wind that Shakes the Barley

The Wind that Shakes the Willow: A song played by Thomdril Merrilin in Baerlon and again played by Thom in the Tower of Ghenjei.

My love is gone, carried away,

by the wind that shakes the willow,

and all the land is beaten hard,

by the wind that shakes the willow.

But I will hold her close to me

in heart and dearest memory,

and with her strength to steel my soul,

her love to warm my heart-strings,

I will stand where we once sang,

though cold wind shakes the willow.
aliases: I Have Loved a Thousand Sailor Men
I Will Steal Your Breath With Kisses
If You Go To Be a Soldier
I’m Down at the Bottom of the Well
My Love Is a Wild Rose
She Dazzles My Eyes and Clouds My Mind
She Wore a Mask That Hid Her Face
The Fool Who Thought He Was King
The Song of a Hundred Days
The Wind that Shakes the Willow

List of White Ajah sisters.name: List of White Ajah sisters
List of White Ajah sisters.overview:
The table below lists all known named members of the White Ajah together with information about each, mostly from The Wheel of Time Companion. It does not contain information about the Amyrlins Rabayn Marushta, Beryl Marle and Aliane Senican about which we only know their terms of office.

Key to Columns

- Nat : Nationality.
- Str : Strength on the 72-level scale in the One Power used in the Companion. 72 is the weakest level. All Aes Sedai have a minimum strength of 45.
- Nov : Years spent as a novice.
- Acc : Years spent as Accepted.
- Rank : Strength on alternative scale with 1 being the strongest Aes Sedai in the White Tower at the beginning of the series. + indicates levels stronger than level 1. All Aes Sedai have a minimum rank of 33.
- Age : Age by the end of 1000 NE or at time of death.
- AS : Years wearing the shawl.
- Enr : Age when enrolled as a Novice. For unknown entries, almost every sister is enrolled between the ages of 14 and 18.
- Stat : Status. Dead (D) or Alive (A), Captured (C). Unless explicitly stated otherwise, all sisters are assumed to be alive.
- Fact : Which faction they were in during the White Tower Schism . White Tower loyalist (L), Rebel Aes Sedai (R), Neutral (N), Unknown (U). If blank, none of these apply.
- DF : If they are a Darkfriend/Black Ajah (Y) or not (N).
- Bonds : Warders or people they are bonded to or by.
- Notes : Any other important information.

List of Yellow Ajah sisters.name: List of Yellow Ajah sisters
List of Yellow Ajah sisters.overview:
The table below lists all known named members of the Yellow Ajah together with information about each, mostly from The Wheel of Time Companion. It does not include the historical Amyrlins Catala Lucanvalle, Alvera Ramosanya or Marasale Jureen as we have little information other than their names and tenures.

Key to Columns

- Nat : Nationality.
- Str : Strength on the 72-level scale in the One Power.  > means strictly stronger than and < means strictly weaker than.
- Nov : Years spent as a novice.
- Acc : Years spent as Accepted.
- Rank : Strength on alternative scale with 1 being the strongest Aes Sedai in the White Tower at the beginning of the series. + after the number signifies the levels above this strength.
- Age : Age by the end of 1000 NE or at time of death.
- AS : Years wearing the shawl.
- Enr : Age when entered into the novice book.
- Stat : Dead (D) or Alive (A), Captured (C). Unless proven otherwise, sisters are assumed to be alive by default.
- Fact. : Member of the Loyalist (L), or Rebel (R), or Unknown (U) or Neutral (N) faction of during the White Tower Schism . If blank, none of these apply.
- DF : Darkfriend Yes (Y) or No (N).
- Bonds : Warders or people they are bonded to or by.
- Notes : Any other important information.

Listeners.name: Listeners
Listeners.overview:
Listeners are members of a Seanchan spy organization controlled by Lesser Hands and formally serve on behalf of the Empress. Almost anyone in the household of a Seanchan noble, merchant or banker could be a Listener, including da'covale occasionally, though seldom so'jhin. Once someone becomes a Listener, they serve for life.

Listeners take no active role in matters, and have no formal authority whatsoever. They merely watch, listen and report their observations. Their reports are submitted to the Lesser Hands who are also in charge of the Seekers for Truth. They will decide what information should be passed on to Seekers for further action.

The identity of Listeners is known only to the bureaucracy who controls them, to the Empress, and in some cases, to a control or case officer. The bureaucracy that controls them exists to record the information supplied by the Listeners and pass it to either the Seekers, the Empress, or both. The bureaucracy that controls the Listeners is itself secret and unknown to other bureaucrats and functionaries, and its members are known only to each other, though the upper echelons are known by the Empress.

When called to give evidence, the Listeners do so with their faces hidden and identity disguised, and speak through a tube that disrorts their voices.

Lizard in the Thornbush.name: Lizard in the Thornbush
Lizard in the Thornbush.overview: Lizard in the Thornbush is a sword form. This form has been used by a swordsman against single and multiple opponents. The movement of the form ends on one knee.

Londaren Cor.name: Londaren Cor
Londaren Cor.overview:
Londaren Cor was the capital city of Eharon, one of the Ten Nations. It was located several days' travel north and east of the port city of Barashta (later Ebou Dar ), near but not on the River Eldar. The city was located in or around three hills known as the Dancers.

Londaren Cor was said to have been one of the most beautiful cities of its day. It was built after the Ogier completed Tar Valon, and according to legend the arts they practiced in building that city they perfected at Londaren Cor.

The Palace of the Moon, possibly the seat of the Eharonian rulers, was located in the city and a ritual known as the Blessing of the Swords took place during the Procession of Flutes there, but the details of these events has been lost.

The city was destroyed in the Trolloc Wars, but around 500 years later the ruins were the site of a major battle when the kingdoms of Nerevan and Esandara unified to invade Shiota. The reason for this conflict and the details of its conclusion have been lost.

Long Exile.name: Long Exile
Long Exile.overview:
The Long Exile is the name given to the period when the Ogier lost track of the stedding and began to succumb to the sickness of the Longing. This period spans much of the Breaking of the World and some of the succeeding generations before the Ogier found the stedding again.

Despite the 3,500 years that have passed since the Exile, the Ogier still suffer from the Longing if they spend more than a few years outside the stedding without returning. The Ogier of Seanchan did not suffer from the Exile, as they never lost track of the stedding, which were more numerous on their landmass.

Longing.name: Longing
Longing.overview: The Longing is a phenomenon experienced by the Ogier. During the Breaking of the World, many Ogier stedding were lost or destroyed; the Ogier wandered for a long time searching for them. This period of time apparently sensitized the Ogier to separation from the stedding; a present-day Ogier who leaves the stedding for a long time becomes increasingly ill, among other effects. The Longing, as well as Ogier distaste for the hasty, warlike habits of humanity, is a key reason for the Ogier tendency to stay safely within the stedding.

Lopar.name: Lopar
Lopar.overview:
Lopar are an exotic species from Seanchan. They resemble large hairless bears with thick, reddish-brown skin instead of fur, and no muzzles. If a lopar rears onto its hind legs, it can stand as much as ten feet tall.

Lopar can sprint as fast or faster than horses, but they have low endurance and tire out at long distances. They are fierce fighters with sharp teeth and retractable claws, but only if commanded or agitated. Usually, they are placid and can be kept as pets by the the Blood.

Mating between lopar involves a dominance display, resembling a battle. Mating can result in mortality quite often, and as such is commonly monitored by morat'lopar.

High Lady Suroth owns a lopar named Almandaragal.

Lopinginny.name: Lopinginny
Lopinginny.overview:
A lopinginny is a type of bird found in the Aiel Waste.

Given the comparison made by Gaul between Lord Luc as he initially appeared in the Two Rivers and the bird, lopinginnies likely act aggressively, but flee when there is real danger. The Companion defines it as "a bird found in the Waste with a bold call, though it was not a bold bird".

These other animals are those that do not fit into the other categories of animals.

Lord.name: Lord
Lord.overview:
Lord is a title given to men of power and lands in the Westlands. Normally, a lord is a noble member of a house, and the greater power that the house itself has, the greater the power the lord may wield.

In some cases, men who are not of noble blood are still addressed as "lord." This is usually because the person addressing the man feels such great respect and awe toward him that formalities seem necessary.

The female equivalent to a lord is a lady.

Lord Barthanes Manor.name: Lord Barthanes Manor
Lord Barthanes Manor.overview:
This Manor House was a property of Lord Barthanes Damodred; it was built just outside the walls of Cairhien; inside of it took refuge Padan Fain after he stole the Horn of Valere from Rand 's Inn inside the city. There Rand, Perrin, Mat, Verin and others followed the track of Fain to a Waygate.

After the death of Lord Barthanes the building was transformed by Rand to the seat of the School of Cairhien, an academy open to innovations.

Lord Captain.name: Lord Captain
Lord Captain.overview:
Lord Captain ( plural Lords Captain) is a rank within the Children of the Light. It is the second-highest rank after the Lord Captain Commander. Lords Captain are known to command Legions of 2,000 men. Lords Captain mentioned in the series are Eamon Valda, Geofram Bornhald, Abdel Omerna, Trom, Alaabar Harnesh, Brandel Vordarian, Berab Golever and Canvele.

It is the rank held by the leader of the Winged Guards of Mayene, first by Bertain Gallenne, then later by Havien Nurelle.

It is the rank held by the leader of the Panarch 's Legion in Tanchico.

Lord Captain Commander.name: Lord Captain Commander
Lord Captain Commander.overview: The Lord Captain Commander is the supreme head of the Children of the Light. Traditionally, the Lord Captain Commander resides in the Fortress of the Light in Amador, where he directs the Children of the Light. His goal is to unite the lands in the name of the Light, purge all shadowspawn and users of the One Power (often seen as synonymous) from the lands and ultimately to lead the armies of the Light in the Last Battle and the Dark One. Lord Captain Commanders, with two exceptions (see below), are chosen by the Lord Captains from their own ranks. No Lord Captain Commander has ever been executed but several have been assassinated.

Lord of Chaos.name: Lord of Chaos
Lord of Chaos.overview: Lord of Chaos (abbreviated LoC ) is the sixth book in The Wheel of Time series. It was published by Tor Books and was released on October 15, 1994. It is 1007 pages long.

Lord of Chaos (concept).name: Lord of Chaos (concept)
Lord of Chaos (concept).overview: Not much is known about the Lord of Chaos, despite being the title of the sixth book in Robert Jordan's "The Wheel of Time" series. Some think that it may be another name for the Dark One. Although it seems more likely that the "Lord of Chaos" is an appellation referring to Rand al'Thor and his ta'veren influence as a title for this book, a command given to the Forsaken Demandred by the Dark One, "let the Lord of Chaos rule" suggests that it may only be a phrase directing the Forsaken, notably, to spread disorder and distrust. The Lord of Chaos is identified in the eighth book by one of the Forsaken: “the Great Lord’s command to increase chaos.” The Forsaken refer to the Dark One as the Great Lord. One of the Forsaken, Semirhage, said, “Let the lord of chaos rule,” after the Forsaken destroy the Seanchan entire Royal family which had been the only cohesive powerful government up to the eleventh book in the series. Since Rand al'Thor had no part in that action, it is unlikely that anyone besides the Dark One can be identified as the Lord of Chaos. However, Brandon Sanderson, who completed Robert Jordan’s last three books often imposed his own interpretation on many concepts. His books stressed the chaos caused by Rand’s presence in Caemlyn and other cities, noting that the pattern demanded balance yet Cadsuane Sedai noticed no redeeming good to balance the evil. There are subtle ambiguities that could be argued that Sanderson changed from what Jordan originally planned that aficionados might make a very long article to detail i.e. the great healing power of Nynaeve unable to restore Rand’s hand, yet heal stilling, undo Compulsion, and bring a stabbed noble from the brink of death.

Lord of the Lakes.name: Lord of the Lakes
Lord of the Lakes.overview: Lord of the Lakes is a title of the Malkieri monarch. The title alludes to the fact that Malkier is "a kingdom necklaced by a thousand lakes." Currently, al'Lan Mandragoran holds this title.

Lord of the Seven Towers.name: Lord of the Seven Towers
Lord of the Seven Towers.overview:
Lord of the Seven Towers is a title Lan Mandragoran claimed for himself just prior to ordering his army of twelve thousand to charge one hundred fifty thousand Shadowspawn at Tarwin's Gap.

As Malkier was called the Kingdom of the Seven Towers, due to the Seven Towers on its city's walls, Lan was undoubtedly referring to them when he made his proclamation.

Lord of the Two Rivers.name: Lord of the Two Rivers
Lord of the Two Rivers.overview: The Lord of the Two Rivers was an unofficial title given to Perrin Aybara during the defense of the Two Rivers. The Dragon Reborn received the official title by the Queen of Andor.

Lotus Closes Its Blossom.name: Lotus Closes Its Blossom
Lotus Closes Its Blossom.overview: Lotus Closes Its Blossom is a sword form. The form is conventionally used against a single opponent. It is often followed by the swordsman wiping or shaking the blood off of the blade before sheathing the sword as a finishing flourish. This is reflected by the word "closes" in the name of the form.

Loversknot (horse).name: Loversknot (horse)
Loversknot (horse).overview: Loversknot is a horse owned by Nynaeve al'Meara.

Loversknot (plant).name: Loversknot (plant)
Loversknot (plant).overview: Loversknot is a flower of deep red color, sometimes described as strong crimson. It is usually given as a gift for loved ones or used as an ornament on clothing.

Low Caemlyn.name: Low Caemlyn
Low Caemlyn.overview: Low Caemlyn is the outermost district of Caemlyn, capital of the kingdom of Andor. It is situated outside of the outer city walls surrounding the New City and consists mainly of farmer communities having grown together into part of the city over the centuries.

Low Chasaline.name: Low Chasaline
Low Chasaline.overview:
Low Chasaline occurs on the eighteenth day of Maigdhal.

Other than High Chasaline is a day of feasting and Low Chasaline a day of fasting, their seems no obvious connection between the two or significance to this date.

Low Wind Rising.name: Low Wind Rising
Low Wind Rising.overview: Low Wind Rising is a sword form. It has both a standing and a seated version. Rand al'Thor used the seated version of this form when testing Laman Damodred 's sword that was given to him by Aviendha to slice a silk cushion in half.

Luan (river).name: Luan (river)
Luan (river).overview: The River Luan is a river which rises in the northern Black Hills before flowing southeastwards along their feet and meeting the Erinin south of Dragonmount and Tar Valon.

Lugagde.name: Lugagde
Lugagde.overview:
Lugagde is a satellite village of Tar Valon, on the eastern bank of the river Erinin, were one of the six bridges of the city connects the island to the continent.

Because Tar Valon is often the target of attacks and sieges, the village has been a victim of many burnings over the years.

Lugard.name: Lugard
Lugard.overview:
Lugard is the capital city of Murandy. Most residents will say that they are "Lugarders" first and "Murandians" second, if asked, even though the city houses the seat of King Roedran of Murandy.

Lugard is located on the River Reisendrelle where it joins the River Storn in the heart of Murandy. The Jehannah Road runs west to Jehannah. The Silver Road runs south to Illian. The Lugard Road runs northeast through Four Kings and on to Caemlyn; the roadway running southwest through Altara is also known as the Lugard Road. The eastern gate of Lugard is the Shilene Gate.

Lugard is a dirty city, dusty and noisy, its gray outer walls in a state of disrepair and its inner stone walls in worse shape. Many of its broad roads are unpaved, despite the flourishing trade that brings scores of wagons trafficking through—from Illian, Ebou Dar, Ghealdan, and Andor. Houses, shops, and inns all are of gray stone and roofed in blue, red, purple or green tiles but those bright colors are covered with a dull haze of dirt.

Lugard has a well earned reputation not only for commerce but for thievery and licentiousness as well. Outsiders are well advised to heed the Lugarder saying: "Trust no one but your self, and yourself not too much." Taverns and commonrooms in inns are judged by some to be bawdier than most.

Lugard Road.name: Lugard Road
Lugard Road.overview: The Lugard Road is a major highway linking the city of Lugard in Murandy to Caemlyn, the capital of Andor, although it is likely that other roads close to Lugard would also have the same name. It is a major trade artery and well-traveled by merchants.

M'Hael.name: M'Hael
M'Hael.overview:
The highest military rank of the Asha'man, the M'Hael holds the supreme rank of Leader, second only to the Dragon Reborn in the Asha'man organization. M'Hael means "leader" in the Old Tongue.

The only M'Hael was Mazrim Taim, who created the position and title himself, acting on his own outside of Rand 's command. M'Hael is also the name given to Mazrim Taim as one of the Forsaken.

With the open revelation of Mazrim Taim as a Darkfriend and Forsaken, as well as his defeat during the Last Battle, the future of the title and Black Tower leadership is unclear, especially with the believed death of the Dragon Reborn. Logain commanded the Asha'man loyal to the Light during the Last Battle and, like Taim, is a former False Dragon who began channeling long before the Black Tower was founded. Therefore, it is probable that Logain will lead the Asha'man following the conclusion of the Last Battle. However, whether he will use the title of M'Hael - or even whether he will lead the Black Tower as a sole leader - is uncertain.

M'Jinn.name: M'Jinn
M'Jinn.overview: M'Jinn was once the second biggest city in the world during the Age of Legends.

Mabriam's Day.name: Mabriam's Day
Mabriam's Day.overview:
Mabriam's Day occurs on the eighteenth day of Tammaz.

On this holiday, any sort of labor is avoided. The food is always cooked the day before, but some rise and dress in the dark on the theory that they have thus done that "work" before the day began. One feature of Mabriam's Day is that young women traditionally play tricks on young men. These tricks are supposed to indicate the young woman's interest in the target man, but the young women work in groups and try to keep their actions secret. If the man manages to guess who is responsible, the man gets a reward, the reward ranging from a kiss from the woman who thought up the trick to a kiss from each in the group.

It can be assumed that this holiday has something to do with Mabriam en Shereed, a legend of the Gray Ajah, founder of the Compact of the Ten Nations and Queen of Aramaelle in the time period shortly after the Breaking of the World, although how is not known.

Celebrated in villages and small towns in every nation.

Machin Shin.name: Machin Shin
Machin Shin.overview: Machin Shin is an entity that resides in the Ways, also known as the Black Wind. It is a parasitic entity that grew as a result of the Taint on saidin. In the Old Tongue, it means "Journey of Destruction".

Maddin's Day.name: Maddin's Day
Maddin's Day.overview:
Maddin's Day occurs on the 22nd day of Taisham.

Maddin's Day celebrates the founder of Altara.

It is celebrated in Ebou Dar.

Maderin.name: Maderin
Maderin.overview: Maderin is a prosperous, stone-walled town in Altara, larger than Jurador. It is surrounded by farms and olive groves. The streets are wide and stone paved. The three and four story brick houses have tile roofs. The local commerce is based on olive oil, lacquerware and lace.

Maerone.name: Maerone
Maerone.overview: Maerone is a small Cairhienin town or large village on the east bank of the River Erinin on the border with Andor. Maerone is not an important port on the river, being dwarfed by the more important Aringill on the Andoran side.

Mafal Dadaranell.name: Mafal Dadaranell
Mafal Dadaranell.overview:
Mafal Dadaranell was an Ogier -built city constructed after the Breaking of the World as the capital of Aramaelle, one of the Ten Nations that arose after the end of the Breaking. Like most Ogier-constructed settlements, the city was beautiful, made up of graceful buildings based on organic shapes. However, due to the city's proximity to the Blight and to Tarwin's Gap, it was also strongly fortified.

Despite its strength, Mafal Dadaranell could not hold back the swarming hordes of Trollocs that came south during the Trolloc Wars. The city was overwhelmed and destroyed. Every building was levelled and by the time the war ended three centuries and more later, no trace of the city was left. The far more simple fortress of Fal Dara was built in its stead. The only trace of Mafal Dadaranell left today is a single Ogier Waygate located just south of the modern fortress town of Fal Dara.

Translated into Common Tongue, the name means "Pass at the Father of Mountain Ranges" - from the Old Tongue mafal (meaning "mouth or pass"), dada (meaning "father") and ranell (meaning "mountain range").

Mageen.name: Mageen
Mageen.overview: Mageen is one of the horses owned by Aviendha.

Magical Artifacts: Sa'angreal, Ter'angre.name: Magical Artifacts: Sa'angreal, Ter'angreal, and Angreal
Magical Artifacts: Sa'angreal, Ter'angre.overview: The following is a comparison of Ter'angreal, Sa'angreal and Angreal. For more in-detail information on Ter'angreal, Sa'angreal and Angreal individually, view the afore linked articles.

Maiden's Kiss.name: Maiden's Kiss
Maiden's Kiss.overview: Maidens' Kiss is a game played by the Aiel Far Dareis Mai.

Maidens of the Sword.name: Maidens of the Sword
Maidens of the Sword.overview:
The Maidens of the Sword are a wetlander offshoot of Far Dareis Mai that came about after the battle where Rand al'Thor and his army of Aiel drove off the Shaido and occupied Cairhien. It is speculated by some of the clan chiefs and Wise Ones that after a second time being ravaged by the Aiel (the first time being during the Aiel War ), that some of the Cairhienin may have fallen under the impression that the Aiel way, and ji'e'toh, are superior.

For this reason, many Cairhien women, having gained certain amounts of adoration for the Maidens of the Spear, took up the sword and declared themselves "Maidens of the Sword". Later on they even go so far as to develop their own version of Maiden handtalk. The Aiel frowned heavily on their actions, partly because of these women being treekillers, and partly because of how severely they misunderstand and twist ji'e'toh. These women spend large amounts of their time dueling one another and taking each other gai'shain. The Aiel find them to be extremely offensive.

They are reorganized by Lady Faile Bashere, and they become Cha Faile, and are also joined by men.

Maigdhal.name: Maigdhal
Maigdhal.overview: Maigdhal is the ninth month in the Farede calendar. In most years, it is equivalent to the real world period from August 4 to August 31. Tandar occurs on the 9th, and Low Chasaline on the 18th.

Mainde Cut Hold.name: Mainde Cut Hold
Mainde Cut Hold.overview: Mainde Cut Hold is the hold of the Jenda sept of the Tomanelle Aiel.

Mainelle.name: Mainelle
Mainelle.overview:
Mainelle was a city in the nation of Aelgar, which was part of the Ten Nations. The city of Tanchico was built at the site of Mainelle, whose fate is not known.

Mainelle has no known translation in the Old Tongue.

Malden.name: Malden
Malden.overview: Malden is a city in northern Altara.

Malkier.name: Malkier
Malkier.overview: Malkier (pronounced: mahl-KEER) is part of the Borderlands, lying north of Shienar. The sign of Malkier is a golden crane. Malkieri men are recognized by a braided leather cord they wear around their temples; the hadori. The nation was swallowed by the Blight in 955 NE, causing Shienar to become the northernmost of the Borderlands. After the Last Battle, the Blight vanished, and the nation was restored.

MalkieriCon.name: MalkieriCon
MalkieriCon.overview: MalkieriCon is an annual Wheel of Time convention and the only European convention dedicated to the Wheel of Time. It was founded in 2022 and the first two years were held in Manchester, United Kingdom. From 2024 it will be held in Prague, Czech Republic (Czechia).

Mallard's Hill.name: Mallard's Hill
Mallard's Hill.overview: Mallard's Hill is a minor hill that lies between Renald Fanwar 's farm and Oak Water. Renald named it after Mallard's Road, which crosses it.

Malvide Narrows.name: Malvide Narrows
Malvide Narrows.overview: The Malvide Narrows, in Altara, is the narrowest point of the Molvaine Gap, a pass through the Damona Mountains. The Great North Road, also known regionally as the Lugard Road, runs through the Malvide Narrows.

Mameris.name: Mameris
Mameris.overview: Mameris is a place Birgitte remembers from one of her former life. It existed some time during the Third Age, and was the center of a pacifistic movement, coupled with bluntly saying what one believed at any given time.

Manala.name: Manala
Manala.overview:
Manala is a large village located on the road linking the town of Canluum to the capital city of Chachin, in Kandor. It consists of approximately twenty streets crisscrossing a pair of hills, and possesses at least three inns, including the Plowman's Blade. It is a regular waystop for travelers moving between the two settlements, and is the center of an agricultural region of surrounding farms and homesteads. Like many Borderland settlements of its type and size, the village is fortified and many of the buildings do not have ground-floor windows, only arrow slits to be used in the event of Shadowspawn attack.

Manala was briefly visited by Moiraine Damodred, al'Lan Mandragoran, Ryne Venamar, and Bukama Marenellin on their way from Canluum to Chachin in 979 NE.

Mandarb.name: Mandarb
Mandarb.overview: Mandarb is the name of the black stallion ridden by al'Lan Mandragoran.

Manetheren.name: Manetheren
Manetheren.overview: Manetheren (Translated from the Old Tongue as Mountain Home ) was one of the Ten Nations which arose from the ashes of the Breaking of the World. It was destroyed circa 1200 AB amidst the upheavals of the Trolloc Wars.

Manetheren (city).name: Manetheren (city)
Manetheren (city).overview: The City of Manetheren was the capital of the nation of the same name.

Mar Haddon.name: Mar Haddon
Mar Haddon.overview: Mar Haddon was a nation that came into existence after the Hundred Years War. It was located in what is now Haddon Mirk.

Mar Ruois.name: Mar Ruois
Mar Ruois.overview:
Mar Ruois was one of the great cities of the Age of Legends, a metropolis created out of technology and the One Power.

At some point during the War of Power, the city was take by the Shadow. It was later retaken by the forces of the Light. Rand remembers the scene through the eyes of Lews Therin Telamon. Great, towering bonfires had been erected at every street crossing during it's occupation and those who refused to swear to the Shadow were thrown alive to the flames. Rand is reminded of it after seeing what the Aiel had done in Taien.

Any trace of the city's existence disappeared during the Breaking of the World.

Mara and the Three Foolish Kings.name: Mara and the Three Foolish Kings
Mara and the Three Foolish Kings.overview:
Mara and the Three Foolish Kings is an epic told by Gleemen throughout the Westlands.

Mara steals the crowns of Kings Madel, Orander and Kadar and then leaves them floundering in the mud next to a river assumed to be nearby Heape. When the residents of Heape hear how foolish the kings were, they decide that they will have no King.

It is a personal favourite of Thomdril Merrilin, who is known to have recounted it in the following places:

- Emond's Field
- Journey to Baerlon
- At the manor house of Barthanes Damodred
- The Woman of Tanchico , in Tar Valon [ 1 ]
- Three Plum Court , in Tanchico

Maracru.name: Maracru
Maracru.overview: Maracru is a town in Tarabon.

Maradon.name: Maradon
Maradon.overview:
Maradon is the Saldaean capital. It is situated along the Arinelle River. It sits on the former site of Deranbar, the capital of Jaramide, one of the Ten Nations. It is said that there are towers in Maradon from the tops of which one can see the Blight. The main city gates faces north.

The Cordamora Palace is the residence of the rulers of Saldaea (Queen Tenobia and after the Last Battle it will be Queen Zarine ); it lies just inside the main gates. Maradon is the home of a robust court life with many balls and promenades. Maradon is also the site of a Waygate, installed by the Ogier. No bridges cross the Arinelle from Maradon to Whitebridge.

Maram Kashor.name: Maram Kashor
Maram Kashor.overview: Maram Kashor is an island at the southeastern tip of Seanchan continent.

Maraside Mountains.name: Maraside Mountains
Maraside Mountains.overview:
The Maraside Mountains are an extension of the Spine of the World that runs west from the main range towards the River Erinin, with the range apparently petering out in the vicinity of the Cairhienin town of Maerone. The range forms the southern border of the kingdom of Cairhien. During the Free Years it was also the border between the kingdoms of Tova and Khodomar.

The mountains do not appear to be especially tall or difficult to traverse, but, combined with the swamps and marshes of Haddon Mirk further south, form a significant barrier to easy travel between Cairhien and Tear.

The most notable route through the mountains is the Jolvaine Pass. The pass is infamous in history as the most decisive battle of the War of the Second Dragon was fought some miles to the south. Artur Hawkwing defeated the false Dragon Guaire Amalasan in this engagement and began his own rise to fame and power.

The area now appears to be desolate and mostly uninhabited.

Marath.name: Marath
Marath.overview: Marath is an unknown location of a battle during the Aiel War. Tam al'Thor refers to this during his fever dreams while Rand takes him to Emond's Field by litter.

March.name: March
March.overview: March is the third month in the Gregorian calendar. It occurs in Wheel of Time world during Saban 14 to Aine 16.

Mardecin.name: Mardecin
Mardecin.overview: Mardecin is a small town in Amadicia.

Mardroot.name: Mardroot
Mardroot.overview: Mardroot is an herb, the oil of which is used in healing wounds. Aside from the name, nothing is known about it. Nynaeve al'Meara uses mardroot oil to help in healing Uno Nomesta 's wounds sustained during the escape from Tanchico.

Maredo.name: Maredo
Maredo.overview:
Maredo was a nation that came into existence after the Hundred Years War. It was located in the present day Plains of Maredo between Illian and Tear.

In FY 999, the nation of Maredo was founded by Lady Danella Mathendrin and other nobles from the city of Far Madding, laying claim to all of the Plains of Maredo and a part of Murandy, but by 500 NE, the nation had vanished, leaving only Far Madding as a city-state.

Maredo was ruled by queens, and was thus a matriarchal nation. Its capital was Far Madding, and the city's female Counsel served as an advisor to the queen. After the nation's collapse, Far Madding remained as a city-state, and the First Counsel began to view herself as the political successor of the queens of Maredo.

Marella.name: Marella
Marella.overview:
Marella is a village in Altara.

When Egwene al'Vere enters Tel'aran'rhiod physically to travel to Salidar, she passes through the village of Marella. She identifies the village by the name of the Marella Inn.

Marendalar.name: Marendalar
Marendalar.overview: Marendalar is an island located off the coast of the Seanchan home continent. Its precise location is unknown, although at one time it was heavily populated, suggesting it must be substantial in size.

Marisin.name: Marisin
Marisin.overview: Marisin is an herb that can be found in the Two Rivers region. It can be prepared as a medicinal remedy by boiling it with foxtail as a sleep aid that does not make the user groggy.

Marisin Valley.name: Marisin Valley
Marisin Valley.overview:
Marisin Valley was a site in Coremanda where a battle was fought. One of the person whose memory was put into Mat Cauthon 's mind was leading a cavalry charge in the valley.

"The way the hillsides were arranged, a light cavalry charge could come galloping through the corridor between them. Only someone very bold would try such tactic, but he had done just that during the Battle of Marisin Valley back in old Coremanda. Well, not Mat himself, but someone in those old memories."

Market Sheran.name: Market Sheran
Market Sheran.overview:
Market Sheran is a small village in Andor, situated along the Caemlyn Road between Four Kings and Carysford.

Rand al'Thor and Mat Cauthon stopped in Market Sheran's inn on their way to the capital and were given hot food by the innkeeper, Rulan Allwine, but were then accosted by a Darkfriend named Paitr Conel. Rand and Mat managed to evade him and continue on their way to Caemlyn.

Marks and Remarks.name: Marks and Remarks
Marks and Remarks.overview: Marks and Remarks is one of Min 's books. It is a history.

Marriage customs.name: Marriage customs
Marriage customs.overview: Marriage customs vary widely between countries and cultures, although there are definite regional trends.

Marriage knife.name: Marriage knife
Marriage knife.overview: The marriage knife is hung at the woman's bosom, and the hilt is decorated with a stone for each child she has. The color of the stone indicates whether the child is male (white) or female (red), and the color of the stone's setting indicates whether or not the child is still alive, and if not, the manner of his or her death, whether in a duel (red) or otherwise (black). If a child is of age for a duel and he or she refuses one, his or her stone is pried out by many women. Women's dresses in Ebou Dar are cut to clearly display a marriage knife, or the lack of one, which indicates that a woman is single.

Marshwhite.name: Marshwhite
Marshwhite.overview: Marshwhite is an herb that can be found in Tear. Its leaves can be brewed as a tea and administered to ease a queasy stomach. The tea works as well as chainleaf tea, though also has a bitter taste.

Maseen.name: Maseen
Maseen.overview:
Maseen is a town in Arad Doman.

Rodel Ituralde won a victory at Maseen against the Dragonsworn.

Masenashar.name: Masenashar
Masenashar.overview: Masenashar was a kingdom of the Free Years. It was founded after the end of the Trolloc Wars, and was established on the former territory of Aridhol. It was later absorbed by the growing might of Artur Hawkwing's Empire. The lands it once held are now mostly uninhabited wilderness.

Mashadar.name: Mashadar
Mashadar.overview:
Mashadar is a malicious, though unintelligent, entity that lurks within the depths of Shadar Logoth. Mashadar was formed during the Trolloc Wars from the hatred and suspicion exhibited by the citizens of Shadar Logoth (then called Aridhol ). Over time, it grew until it consumed the city and its people. At present, it takes the form of a silvery mist that wanders the streets at night and hides in the ground during the day. The scope of Mashadar is unclear; though it is not omnipresent, it is "vast as Shadar Logoth," and can manifest itself in many locations at once. The slightest touch of Mashadar is fatal, causing a slow and agonizing death. Though it will attack any entity, Mashadar's prey of choice is Shadowspawn, which have avoided Shadar Logoth as much as possible since an entire Trolloc army vanished within its walls. Mashadar is a formidable enemy to a channeller, as it is very nearly impossible to destroy, and will bring its full force to bear on anyone who attacks it with the One Power. It is susceptible to balefire, and will flee when confronted with it.

It is unclear what degree of sentience Mashadar possesses. While on the one hand it is able to select its prey (attacking Shadowspawn with great precision), it is also described as "utterly mindless" and at one time is unable to detect a human mere feet from one of its tendrils.

Though a terrifying force within Shadar Logoth, Mashadar is bound to the city and cannot leave its walls. As such, it is believed to be destroyed along with the city during the cleansing of saidin.

Master of the Blades.name: Master of the Blades
Master of the Blades.overview: Master of the Blades is the title given to the male leader of the Atha'an Miere as a counterpart to the Mistress of the Ships, though he does not hold as much rule as she. It is common for the Master of the Blades to be married to the Mistress of the Ships, though it is not required of the position. The Master of the Blades is responsible for the trade and security of the the Atha'an Miere.

Master of the Horse.name: Master of the Horse
Master of the Horse.overview:
Master of the Horse is a man employed by noblewomen and queens in nations where it is not expected for a woman to lead her own forces into battle. The Master of the Horse is often a trusted confederate of his lady or queen, with some even being suspected of having intimate relations with their mistresses. His job is to command the armies of his employer in battle, although it is assumed that ultimate authority will reside with her.

Masters of the Horse are regularly employed by female leaders in nations such as Ghealdan, Murandy, and Tear. In some nations they do not have the same purpose, as it may be more acceptable for women to command her own forces, or it may be rarer for women to rule in the first place.

Lady Anaiyella Narencelona had a Master of the Horse, but he was killed during a skirmish with the Seanchan.

Mat's Dice Sense.name: Mat's Dice Sense
Mat's Dice Sense.overview: Mat's dice sense is the ability of Mat Cauthon to seemingly 'sense' the onset of important decisions or events soon to occur. This sense manifests as the sensation of dice "rolling," "tumbling," "bouncing," or otherwise rattling around in Mat's head. It has frequently helped him to identify important aspects of his life and act accordingly, perhaps most notably during his successful courtship of Tuon.

Mat's Gear.name: Mat's Gear
Mat's Gear.overview: Mat Cauthon possesses a number of unique or very identifiable items.

Mat Cauthon/Parallels.name: Mat Cauthon/Parallels
Mat Cauthon/Parallels.overview: Robert Jordan uses several sources from mythology and history as inspiration for the character of Mat.

Maule.name: Maule
Maule.overview: The Maule is the port district of the city of Tear. It is a very rough area of the city. The streets of the Maule are dirt, and when it rains, they turn to mud. Because of this, denizens of this district either go barefoot, or use wooden platforms strapped to their shoes. Siuan Sanche grew up in the Maule and Ailhuin Guenna owns a house and herb shop there.

Mavinsleaf.name: Mavinsleaf
Mavinsleaf.overview: Mavinsleaf is an herb that can be found in the Two Rivers region. A village Wisdom such as Nynaeve can mix powdered mavinleaf with boiled catfern to form a viscous sickly green liquid with an atrociously acrid tang. The concoction is harmless, but the highly unpleasant taste makes drinking it a punishment administered for someone who lies.

May.name: May
May.overview: May is the fifth month in the Gregorian calendar. It occurs in Wheel of Time world during Adar 19 to Saven 21.

Mayene.name: Mayene
Mayene.overview: Mayene (pronounced: may-EHN; /meˈjɛːn/) is a small but wealthy city-state on the Sea of Storms, in the far southeast of the Westlands. Mayene is an independent city with its own government and military forces. Mayene's sigil is that of the a golden hawk, also the symbol of Artur Hawkwing. The rulers of Mayene claim descendance from Hawkwing through his grandson, a claim that is generally not taken seriously outside of Mayene.

Measurement.name: Measurement
Measurement.overview: Measurements are remarkably unified across the nations and peoples of the world. For quick reference, they can be summarized below: The abbreviation WL is used throughout for clarification between the Westlands (WL) units and those of the same name used in our own world.

Mechoacan.name: Mechoacan
Mechoacan.overview: Mechoacan is place in Seanchan, no more is known about it.

Meditations on the Kindling Flame.name: Meditations on the Kindling Flame
Meditations on the Kindling Flame.overview: Meditations on the Kindling Flame is a book about the history of Amyrlins. Silviana was reading it in her study when Egwene al'Vere came in.

Medo.name: Medo
Medo.overview: Medo is a village in Shienar which acts as a trading port for the city of Fal Moran, as it lies on the River Mora. It has two stone docks that extend into the village and is slightly larger then Emond's Field.

Mehar.name: Mehar
Mehar.overview: Mehar is a town in Saldaea.

Men of Fire and Women of Air.name: Men of Fire and Women of Air
Men of Fire and Women of Air.overview: Men of Fire and Women of Air is a book written by the Ogier Elora daughter of Amar daughter of Coura which contains information on channelers, specifically how Aes Sedai deal with men who can channel.

Mera'din.name: Mera'din
Mera'din.overview: The Mera'din is a recent formation of a "society" among the Aiel. The name means "Brotherless" in the Old Tongue.

Merinloe.name: Merinloe
Merinloe.overview: Merinloe is a city in Seanchan. No more is known about it.

Miadi.name: Miadi
Miadi.overview: The Miadi is a sept of the Taardad Aiel. The sept hold is unknown. On their way to Alcair Dal, Rand al'Thor and the Jindo are joined by other Taardad septs including the Nine Valleys, Chumai, Four Stones and Bloody Water.

Miagoma.name: Miagoma
Miagoma.overview: The Miagoma clan is one of the twelve Aiel clans. Their clan hold is unknown.

Miereallen.name: Miereallen
Miereallen.overview:
Miereallen was a city in Safer, which was part of the Ten Nations. It later became modern-day Falme.

Its name translated into the Common Tongue is "Sea Hill" - from the Old Tongue words miere (meaning "sea", compare Atha'an Miere ) and allen (meaning "hill", compare Al'cair'rahien'allen ).

Mighty.name: Mighty
Mighty.overview: Mighty is the horse ridden by Gerard Arganda. It dies in the Last Battle when a large flail-wielding trolloc cracks its skull with a punch.

Military rank.name: Military rank
Military rank.overview: Military ranks are positions of authority among the various armies of the world. Below are a list of ranks and those who hold them.

Minde.name: Minde
Minde.overview: Minde is a city in Murandy. Mindeans often boast about their bad tempers. Culen, Padry and Paers are from Minde.

Mindtrap.name: Mindtrap
Mindtrap.overview: A mindtrap, known in the Old Tongue as a cour'souvra, is a device used to trap a channeler's soul. The name closely resembles the French words coeur s'ouvre which translates as "heart opens," possibly a reference to the mezzo-soprano aria "Mon cœur s'ouvre à ta voix" ("My heart opens itself to your voice").

Mirror World.name: Mirror World
Mirror World.overview:
A Mirror World is an alternate reality/timeline that has been woven by the Wheel.

These alternate worlds represent "Ifs". What might have been if a decision was made differently, a battle swung the other way, a winner became a loser. Theoretically the Mirror world is created at that junction of decision/outcome. This allows for infinite variation and so infinite Mirror Worlds. The more likely the alternate decision/outcome the more 'real' the Mirror world associated with it seems/is. Those Mirror Worlds closest to the true World (separated by only the difference in a minor decision) are populated by 'relfections' of the people in the True World.

Mirror worlds can be reached by a person who can channel through the use of Portal Stones. Time acts differently in Mirror Worlds: a day spent in one can find a traveler re-entering the True World a year later, conversely five years spent in a Mirror World may result in a traveler returning to the True World merely weeks after he left. Study of Mirror Worlds led to the creation of The Ways.

Tel'aran'rhiod is a mirror world which connects and reflects every one of the myriad worlds within the Pattern.

Mirrors of the Wheel.name: Mirrors of the Wheel
Mirrors of the Wheel.overview:
Mirrors of the Wheel is a book written before the Breaking of the World. It describes the alternate worlds behind Portal Stones. Selene says to Rand that some of those worlds were like mirrors, especially those without people. Some reflected only great events that occurred in their own world, whereas some had a shadow of the reflection even before the event occurred.

It is possible that Loial has seen a few pages of a copy of this book. He states that there was a drawing of a stone which looked very much like a Portal Stone and underneath it said: "From Stone to Stone run the lines of 'if', between the worlds that might be." Some part provided information about that powerful Aes Sedai of AoL could use them. He did not understand all information but tried to explain it to Rand.

"Most of it sounded like this. 'If a woman go left, or right, does Time's flow divide? Does the Wheel then weave two Patterns? A thousand, for each of her turnings? As many as the stars? Is one real, the others merely shadows and reflections?'."

Mist (horse).name: Mist (horse)
Mist (horse).overview: Mist is the name of one of Egwene al'Vere 's horses.

Mistress of the Four Winds.name: Mistress of the Four Winds
Mistress of the Four Winds.overview: Mistress of the Four Winds is a title of the Altaran monarch. The title most likely changes, based on the gender of the monarch. It can be surmised that the title came about due to the cemaros that plague the Sea of Storms and Altara's capital, Ebou Dar. The title was first introduced by Tylin Quintara Mitsobar, Queen of Altara. Upon Beslan Mitsobar 's ascension to the Throne of the Winds, the title most likely changed to "Master of the Four Winds."

Mistress of the Kitchens.name: Mistress of the Kitchens
Mistress of the Kitchens.overview:
The Mistress of the Kitchens is the woman in charge of the White Tower kitchens, which day and night supplies the residents of the White Tower with food and beverages. The only woman known to have possessed this title is Laras, a seemingly stubbornly stern woman, who, however, has proven to be politically skilled, very trustworthy and highly intelligent.

The title became official, having been changed from chief cook, under the reign of Siuan Sanche, who thought fondly of her.

It is not known if the large wooden spoon, which Laras uses as a scepter and poking rod, is an inheritable possession of the Mistress of the Kitchens. It can, however, be safely assumed that the title itself is held for life, as Laras has held her possession almost all her adult life. Again, assumingly, the title is held for life as long as no severe offense against Tower law is committed by its keeper.

Mistress of the Ships.name: Mistress of the Ships
Mistress of the Ships.overview: Mistress of Ships is a title given to the ruler of the Atha'an Miere. She is a woman of great power among the Sea Folk, much like a queen. It is common for a Mistress of Ships to be married to the Master of the Blades, though it's not necessary or even expected. Under her in command are numerous Wave mistresses, and under them are the Sailmistresses.

Moiraine's letter to Thom.name: Moiraine's letter to Thom
Moiraine's letter to Thom.overview: The letter Moiraine Damodred wrote to Thomdril Merrilin before her disappearance through the twisted redstone doorway, which he later shows to Mat Cauthon.

Moisen.name: Moisen
Moisen.overview: Moisen was the site of a major battle in the Whitecloak War. Pedron Niall muses that the battle was one of the worst of his career.

Mol Hara.name: Mol Hara
Mol Hara.overview: Mol Hara square is located in the center of Ebou Dar, the nominal capital of Altara. The front of Tarasin Palace faces the square, it is the seat of the monarch of Altara.

Molvaine Gap.name: Molvaine Gap
Molvaine Gap.overview: The Molvaine Gap is a well known five-mile wide passage through the Damona Mountains that contains part of the Great North Road, known as the Lugard road in this region. Just short of the Gap is the Malvide Narrows, a popular place for bandit attacks.

Monarch of Cairhien.name: Monarch of Cairhien
Monarch of Cairhien.overview:
The monarch of Cairhien is the ruler of all of Cairhien, who governs from the Sun Throne. Unlike some titles in the Westlands, this position can be held by both men and women.

Royal succession in Cairhien is more complicated than simply passing to the late monarch's eldest child or their closest blood relative. A rather stable monarch will often be succeeded by a relative, but if no potential successors are supported by the nobility, the throne may pass to another noble house. The lack of clear strictures around succession has led to Daes Dae'mar frequently being played in the nation, with lords and ladies manoeuvring to gain the throne. There have been five Wars of Cairhienin Succession since the War of the Hundred Years, although the Cairhienin prefer not to discuss them with foreigners.

Candidates are barred from the throne by law if they are married to a foreign monarch, as Taringail Damodred could not claim the throne during his marriage to Queen Morgase Trakand of Andor. However, this was nullified with the personal union of Andor and Cairhien after Queen Elayne Trakand of Andor was also acknowledged as Queen of Cairhien at the end of the Fifth War of Cairhienin Succession.

Monuments Past.name: Monuments Past
Monuments Past.overview: Monuments Past is one of Min 's books. It is a history.

Moon on the Water.name: Moon on the Water
Moon on the Water.overview: Moon on the Water is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it. It was used in the duel between Rand al'Thor and High Lord Turak Aladon. The opposing side assumed The Wood Grouse Dances. Rand later tried to use this form against Ba'alzamon during the battle in the sky over Falme.

Moonflower.name: Moonflower
Moonflower.overview: Moonflower is the name of the horse riden by Leane Sharif.

Moonglow.name: Moonglow
Moonglow.overview: Moonglow is a horse, formerly belonging to the Band of the Red Hand. Moonglow is now owned by Joline Maza.

Moonlight.name: Moonlight
Moonlight.overview: Moonlight is the name of a horse in Tear, riden by Nynaeve al'Meara.

Moonshadow.name: Moonshadow
Moonshadow.overview: Moonshadow is the horse that Elayne Trakand rides during the Last Battle. It dies when one of the Darkfriends with Daved Hanlon runs his swords through its neck.

Mora (river).name: Mora (river)
Mora (river).overview:
The River Mora is the river which forms the border between Shienar and Arafel. Its headwaters are located not too far westwards of the fortress of Fal Dara, and the river flows south and west for some distance before flowing into the Erinin. It passes by the Field of Merrilor, where the Last Battle is fought.

The Mora is navigable from not too far from its headwaters, allowing relatively straightforward passage from the environs of Fal Dara to Tar Valon or parts beyond.

Morai.name: Morai
Morai.overview: The Morai is a sept of the Shaido Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Moreina.name: Moreina
Moreina.overview: Moreina was a kingdom of the Free Years. It arose out of the ruins of Essenia following the Trolloc Wars and later joined the expanding Empire of Artur Hawkwing. During the War of the Hundred Years its territory was split between the nations of Mar Haddon, Tear, and Mayene.

Morelle.name: Morelle
Morelle.overview: Morelle is a town near the southernmost boundary claimed by Cairhien, halfway from Cairhien to the River Iralell.

Morenal Ocean.name: Morenal Ocean
Morenal Ocean.overview:
The Morenal Ocean is the large body of water that lies to the east of Shara and to the west of Seanchan. It is smaller than the Aryth Ocean, and it is unknown why the Seanchan take the considerably longer journey over the Aryth in their current attempt to conquer the main landmass. It is also unknown if the Sea Folk have conducted explorations of this ocean.

The Morenal Ocean is depicted on the world maps in The World of Robert Jordan's The Wheel of Time.

Morning Clouds.name: Morning Clouds
Morning Clouds.overview: Morning Clouds is a young wolf of Wildfire 's pack.

Morning Mist.name: Morning Mist
Morning Mist.overview: Morning Mist is a she- wolf.

Mortification of the Flesh.name: Mortification of the Flesh
Mortification of the Flesh.overview: Mortification of the Flesh is an Aes Sedai penance where the penitant is physically harmed such as by birching, whipping, or other corporal punishment.

Mortification of the Spirit.name: Mortification of the Spirit
Mortification of the Spirit.overview: Mortification of the Spirit is a penance where the victim is embarrased, frightened, etc., while not in a real danger to herself.

Mos Shirare.name: Mos Shirare
Mos Shirare.overview:
Mos Shirare is a city-fortress in Shienar.

Mos Shirare sends forces with the rest of Shienar to Tarwin's Gap to battle the Trolloc army. After that battle, when Siuan Sanche and her party arrive in Fal Dara, Lord Agelmar Jagad informs her that a bard from Mos Shirare is coming to Fal Dara for her entertainment.

Mosaada.name: Mosaada
Mosaada.overview: The Mosaada is a sept of the Goshien Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Mosadorin.name: Mosadorin
Mosadorin.overview: Mosadorin was a place during the time of the Compact of the Ten Nations, where Caraighan Maconar is credited with putting down a rebellion.

Mosara.name: Mosara
Mosara.overview: Mosara was a nation that came into existence after the Hundred Years War. It faded away long ago.

Moshaine.name: Moshaine
Moshaine.overview: The Moshaine are a sept of the Shaido Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Mosra.name: Mosra
Mosra.overview:
Mosra is a small village in Altara. It is located on the border of Altara and Amadicia, near the River Eldar.

When Nynaeve al'Meara, Elayne Trakand, Juilin Sandar and Thomdril Merrilin are in Sienda, Thom hears of a rumor that King Ailron means to take the eastern bank of the River Eldar, from Salidar to So Eban to Mosra. If this plan succeeds, Pedron Niall, through Ailron, will be able to conrol the river traffic and curtail the commerce of Ebou Dar.

Motai.name: Motai
Motai.overview: Motai is a kind of grub found in the Aiel Waste, quite sweet and crunchy.

Mount Sardlen.name: Mount Sardlen
Mount Sardlen.overview: Mount Sardlen is a flat-topped hill within the foothills northeast of the Damona Mountain range in Murandy. It is the nearest hill to the village of Hinderstap. Travelers on horse can expect to reach Hinderstap from Mount Sardlen within an hour or two. It can be confused with Blinder's Peak or Favlend Mountain.

Mountain king.name: Mountain king
Mountain king.overview: The mountain king is a snake found in the mountainous regions of the Aiel Waste.

Mountains of Dhoom.name: Mountains of Dhoom
Mountains of Dhoom.overview:
The Mountains of Dhoom are a chain of peaks created during the Breaking of the World. During the Breaking, the volcano of Shayol Ghul, then an island, became the epicenter for the destruction wreaked by the Hundred Companions after the Dark One tainted saidin. New landmasses arose, and the Mountains of Dhoom formed during this time. The Mountains of Dhoom appear to encircle the northern polar regions of the world, and stretch right across the Westlands, the Aiel Waste, Shara and Seanchan. It is believed they even continue underneath the waves.

The mountains appear to be black, jagged and lifeless, likely a result of the Blight that surrounds and corrupts them. They tumble into the sea in a confused morass of islands and cliffs. The waters north of the mountains in the Aryth Ocean are called the Dead Sea and are not hospitable. It is unknown if the same is true off the coasts of Shara and Seanchan.

In the Westlands there are numerous narrow passes through the Mountains of Dhoom, used by Shadowspawn to menace the Borderlands throughout much of history. With the expansion of the Blight, few of these passes are directly guarded. The largest and most significant such pass is Tarwin's Gap, north of the fortress of Fal Dara in Shienar. Given that the Trolloc Wars also ravaged the Aiel Waste and Shara, it can be assumed there are passes through the mountains there as well.

The Mountains of Dhoom in Seanchan were named by soldiers and sailors in Luthair Paendrag Mondwin 's invasion force, who noted their identical appearance at the same latitude to the mountains in their homeland. It is assumed that the Seanchan patrol and guard any passes through the Mountains of Dhoom into their territory. However, the extent of such precautions given the extinction of Trollocs and Myrddraal in Seanchan is unknown.

The worldwide extent of the Mountains of Dhoom is made clear on the world and continent maps in The World of Robert Jordan's The Wheel of Time.

Mountains of Mist.name: Mountains of Mist
Mountains of Mist.overview: The Mountains of Mist are a vast stretch of mountains that exist in the western region of the Westlands. The range is so named due to its ever-cloud-capped peaks.

Mud Fish.name: Mud Fish
Mud Fish.overview: The Mud Fish is a fish native to the region or Tear and is known in the Maule as a cheap and very bad tasting, but cheap fish that the poor of the country buy.

Murandy.name: Murandy
Murandy.overview:
Murandy (pronounced: MEW-ran-dee) is a small nation in the central part of the Westlands. It has a history of border disputes with its larger neighbor to the north, Andor.

The people of Murandy, much like the people of Altara, do not really consider themselves the residents of a nation. They are more likely to claim allegiance to one or another of the local lords.

Musara.name: Musara
Musara.overview: The Musara are a sept of the Reyn Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Muyami.name: Muyami
Muyami.overview: The Muyami are a group of people in Seanchan that are famous for not holding oaths particularly strongly.

Muyami Uprising.name: Muyami Uprising
Muyami Uprising.overview: The Muyami Uprising is an event that happened on the Seanchan continent. Furyk Karede distinguished himself duing this event.

N'Shar.name: N'Shar
N'Shar.overview: Someone from the lands encompassing the Shadow Coast who had taken a blood oath of revenge; he or she was a walking timebomb, ready to kill in a twitch, ready to die, until the oath was fulfilled.

Nae'blis.name: Nae'blis
Nae'blis.overview: The title of Nae'blis is promised to the one who will rule the world one step below the Dark One, ruling over all the rest of the Chosen as well as the lands. All the Chosen contend for this position of great importance, and the Dark One himself has mentioned it to some as a possibility. Recently, however, the man who calls himself Moridin seems to have claimed it, with the blessing of the Great Lord of the Dark. Many of his companions still wait for an opportunity to bring him down and raise themselves in his place, but none are willing to oppose him openly.

Nailine Samfara.name: Nailine Samfara
Nailine Samfara.overview: Nailine Samfara was an Ogier-built city in Coremanda, which was a part of the Ten Nations. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Nakai.name: Nakai
Nakai.overview: The Nakai are one of the twelve Aiel clans. Their clan hold is Shiagi Hold. They were one of the four clans to cross the Dragonwall during the Aiel War.

Nakomi/Theories.name: Nakomi/Theories
Nakomi/Theories.overview:
Nakomi's nature has been explained with Origins of the Wheel of Time, but there was previously much speculation about her identity.

Due to Nakomi's mysteriousness, understanding her exact nature was impossible, however, there are many theories. The following archives the most popular theories.

Narg.name: Narg
Narg.overview: Narg is an eight foot tall Trolloc that has a wolf's muzzle and goat hooves.

Nashebar.name: Nashebar
Nashebar.overview: Nashebar was a city in Jaramide, which was part of the Ten Nations. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Nassad.name: Nassad
Nassad.overview:
Nassad is a town in southeast Tarabon, just across the border from Amadicia.

In the prologue of Knife of Dreams, the Lords Captain of the Whitecloaks attend a meeting in Nassad with the Seanchan.

Natrin's Barrow.name: Natrin's Barrow
Natrin's Barrow.overview: Natrin's Barrow was a fort located in the forests in eastern Arad Doman. It was located on a ridge above water and consisted of a tall, rectangular building built in the form of several towers stacked upon each other, with the towers getting progressively thinner. It is described as having been elegant and fortified yet palatial.

Neder.name: Neder
Neder.overview: The Neder is a sept of the Shiande Aiel. The hold of the sept is unknown.

Needle Street.name: Needle Street
Needle Street.overview: A street in the city of Caemlyn. Elayne notes that while it used to be full of shops dedicated to needlework, now the shops are all different types.

Negin Bridge.name: Negin Bridge
Negin Bridge.overview: Negin Bridge is a town close to Dragonmount where a Bubble of evil killed Graeger.

Nemarellin Mountains.name: Nemarellin Mountains
Nemarellin Mountains.overview:
The Nemarellin Mountains are a range which runs along the west coast of Illian, and are sometimes called the "west wall of the country."

In the early part of 1000 NE, Rand al'Thor assembled his army to repulse the Seanchan from the Venir Mountains in Altara in the Nemarellin range.

Nerevan.name: Nerevan
Nerevan.overview: Nerevan was a kingdom of the Free Years. It was founded after the end of the Trolloc Wars, and was established on parts of the former territories of Coremanda and Eharon. It was later absorbed by the growing might of Artur Hawkwing's Empire. The lands it once held are now controlled by Murandy and Andor.

Nerin.name: Nerin
Nerin.overview: Nerin is a s'redit calf handled by the Seanchan woman Cerandin.

Nesan.name: Nesan
Nesan.overview: Nesan is the twelfth month in the Farede calendar. In most years, it is equivalent to the real world period from October 27 to November 23. Danshu occurs on the 28th.

Nethvin Market.name: Nethvin Market
Nethvin Market.overview: The Nethvin Market is a marketplace in Far Madding. The Counsel's Head Inn is located just off the market.

New Braem.name: New Braem
New Braem.overview: New Braem is one of the larger towns in Andor. It is located in Braem Wood and serves as an administrative and trading center for the surrounding villages, such as Kore Springs and Jornhill. It is speculated that New Braem lies on or close to the main highway linking Caemlyn to Tar Valon. The town is built near the ruins of Braem, an Ogier -built city of Coremanda, one of the Ten Nations destroyed in the Trolloc Wars.

New Spring.name: New Spring
New Spring.overview:
New Spring (abbreviated NS by fans) is a prequel novel in The Wheel of Time series. The events in the novel take place roughly twenty years before the beginning of The Eye of the World. It was published by Tor Books and released in January 2004.

New Spring was originally published in short form in the fantasy anthology Legends: Short Novels by the Masters of Modern Fantasy. The anthology was edited by Robert Silverberg and was released by Tor Books on September 15, 1999.

Because it is not considered part of the main Wheel of Time storyline, New Spring was not selected for inclusion in the 2014 Hugo Voter Packet with the rest of the Wheel of Time series.

New Spring comic.name: New Spring comic
New Spring comic.overview: The New Spring comic book series is an adaptation of New Spring, the novel. Seven volumes have been released. Below are galleries of images from each of the individual volumes.

Niamh Passes.name: Niamh Passes
Niamh Passes.overview:
The Niamh Passes are a series of narrow footpaths leading through the Spine of the World mountain range, connecting the Borderland kingdom of Shienar to the northernmost part of the Aiel Waste.

The Aiel sometimes raid Shienar through the Niamh Passes. To defend against this, the Shienarans maintain a fortress called Ankor Dail at the western end of the passes. Although the Shienarans respect the Aiel as worthy adversaries, they also consider them a nuisance and distraction from the true war with the Shadow to the north.

Nightlily.name: Nightlily
Nightlily.overview: Nightlily is a horse owned by Nemaris and used by Siuan Sanche.

Nine Rods of Dominion.name: Nine Rods of Dominion
Nine Rods of Dominion.overview: The Nine Rods of Dominion were regional governors in the Age of Legends. They were previously thought by modern Aes Sedai to be a sa'angreal or a ter'angreal of some sort, and only recently was it learned that they were people.

Nine Stones Hold.name: Nine Stones Hold
Nine Stones Hold.overview: Nine Stones Hold is an Aiel settlement in the Three-fold Land. It is held by the Shiande. Janwin, Baellin, and Corida are from this hold.

Nine Valleys.name: Nine Valleys
Nine Valleys.overview: The Nine Valleys is a sept of the Taardad Aiel. The sept hold is unknown. On their way to Alcair Dal, Rand al'Thor and the Jindo are joined by other Taardad septs including the Nine Valleys, Chumai, Four Stones, Bloody Water and Miadi septs. Aviendha was born in the sept.

Ninth Depository.name: Ninth Depository
Ninth Depository.overview:
The Ninth Depository is a chamber in the White Tower Library. Though the smallest of the twelve depositories that make up the Library, it is still a large chamber, oval in shape, with a flattened domed roof. Texts stored in this wing of the Library consist mostly of tomes discussing various forms of arithmetic, stored upon rows and rows of wooden shelves that stand on seven-colored floor tiles, each row separated by four paces. Tall, wheeled ladders allow access to the tops of tall bookshelves and to the walkways that can be found therein. The chamber is illuminated by tall, mirrored brass lamps so heavy that they take up to four men to move. The Ninth Depository is accessed through wide, arched doorways. It is not often used, standing mostly empty of patrons, and silent.

Alviarin uses the Ninth Depository as an entryway when she Travels, because it is so little used.

Nip.name: Nip
Nip.overview: Nip is a wolfhound owned by Assid Bakuun.

Nisa.name: Nisa
Nisa.overview: Nisa is the stout mare that belongs to Barmellin, who lives near Tremonsien. Frightened by the glow of the Choedan Kal, Barmellin turns Nisa back to his farm and drives her as hard as she will go.

Nobility.name: Nobility
Nobility.overview:
Nobility is a traditional hereditary status. In the feudal system, the nobility are generally those who hold a fief, often land and/or office, under vassalage, i.e. in exchange for allegiance and various, mainly military, services to the Monarch and at lower levels to another nobleman.

All nations of the Westlands follow the classic model of feudal nobility. By contrast, the Aiel live by the system of ji'e'toh, whereas the Seanchan adhere to a much harsher system of blood right and ownership.

Nol Caimaine.name: Nol Caimaine
Nol Caimaine.overview: Nol Caimaine was a place during the War of Power where Sammael escaped justice along Rorn M'doi

Nor Chasen.name: Nor Chasen
Nor Chasen.overview:
Nor Chasen is a small village in southern Altara, located east of Ebou Dar.

Nor Chasen is a port village. The precise location is uncertain, however it is not on Kabal Deep, where the coast does not possess any good haroborages according to the Seanchan. When two men try to kidnap Matrim Cauthon, they claimed that they were passing through Ebou Dar on their way to Nor Chasen.

Noren M'Shar.name: Noren M'Shar
Noren M'Shar.overview:
Noren M'Shar is the third largest city in Seanchan.

It is located on the southern shore of the Seanchan continent. According to Tuon, omens will always mean the same, if it is in Imfaral or Noren M'Shar.

North Road.name: North Road
North Road.overview: The North Road is a road located in the Two Rivers that stretches between Taren Ferry and Emond's Field.

November.name: November
November.overview: November is the ninth month in the Gregorian calendar. It occurs in Wheel of Time world during Nesan 6 to Danu 7.

Novice book.name: Novice book
Novice book.overview:
The novice book is used in the White Tower to officially enroll those who wish to attempt to become Aes Sedai. Once enrolled in the novice book, a novice may not forsake Tower training until she is put out by the Tower or until she attains the rank of Aes Sedai. Though an instrument of administration, nevertheless it is held in great esteem by Aes Sedai.

An age restriction was once in place for those who wished to be written into the novice book, as it was believed that any girl over the age of eighteen was too old to adapt to the discipline. Consequently many times young women lied about their age to be enrolled in the Book, facing severe punishments when discovered. On the other hand in some exceptional cases the same Aes Sedai decided to not respect this rule, for instance when they discovered women with a very great potential, as in the case of Nynaeve who was enrolled and then tested immediately as Accepted at the age of 26, becoming the strongest initiate enrolled in the Novice Book since the time of Caraighan Maconar, almost three thousand years earlier.

When Egwene al'Vere became Amyrlin Seat of the rebel Aes Sedai, she removed this restriction and opened the novice book to women of all ages. Many Aes Sedai with an old mentality, as Romanda, were not convinced about this opening of the Book, until some relatively old women were discovered with a potential even greater than Nynaeve, as Sharina Melloy.

As Amyrlin of the reunified White Tower, Egwene has continued allowing older women to enroll, and currently the number of novices sits at close to one thousand. This is a number which many believe will continue to increase, providing the novice book remains open to all. The oldest novice in the White Tower is 67 years old. The ability to Travel also increases the possibility of finding more women to enroll.

Numbers of Chaos.name: Numbers of Chaos
Numbers of Chaos.overview: A body of knowledge from Ages past required to build the Portal Stones; part of this process consisted of laying the Lines that join the Worlds That Might Be.

Oak Dancer.name: Oak Dancer
Oak Dancer.overview: Oak Dancer was a she- wolf. She was named for the way she scampered between saplings as a whelp.

Oak Shakes Its Branches.name: Oak Shakes Its Branches
Oak Shakes Its Branches.overview: Oak Shakes Its Branches is a sword form, often used by masters when training students. It deals non-lethal blows and is also very effective against large groups of opponents who are using different types of weapons. Gawyn Trakand used this form as he was challenged by Gareth Bryne 's soldiers when they would not let him enter the rebel Aes Sedai camp.

Oak Water.name: Oak Water
Oak Water.overview: Oak Water is a village in the Borderlands. It is five miles east of Renald Fanwar 's farm.

Observations on a Visit to Tear.name: Observations on a Visit to Tear
Observations on a Visit to Tear.overview: Observations on a Visit to Tear is a book left behind when a group of Black Ajah fled the White Tower. It was used as a taunt and bait to lure Nynaeve al'Meara, Elayne Trakand, and Egwene al'Vere to follow the Black sisters to Tear.

Oburun.name: Oburun
Oburun.overview: Oburun was a kingdom of the Free Years. It was founded after the end of the Trolloc Wars, and was established on parts of the former territories of Aridhol and Aramaelle. It was later absorbed by the growing might of Artur Hawkwing's Empire. The lands it once held are now mostly uninhabited wilderness.

October.name: October
October.overview: October is the ninth month in the Gregorian calendar. It occurs in Wheel of Time world during Shaldine 3 to Nesan 5.

Ogier.name: Ogier
Ogier.overview:
Ogier (pronounced: OH-gehr; /ˈoʊːgʲɛɹ/) are a race of non-human creatures who have an intense love of knowledge and peace. Also known as Alantin, or Tree brothers, by the Aiel, they are great architects and stonemasons, responsible for many of the most impressive structures and cities of the world.
