The Shaarad Aiel had a four-hundred-year-old blood feud with the Goshien clan. However, this rift was healed by the two clan chiefs under Rand 's ta'veren influence.

Shadar Logoth.name: Shadar Logoth
Shadar Logoth.overview: Shadar Logoth, ( Old Tongue: Place Where the Shadow Waits, or simply The Shadow's Waiting, pronounced: SHAH-dahr LOH-goth), was once Aridhol, a great city which destroyed itself during the Trolloc Wars by becoming as dark and evil as the Shadow against which it fought. Now Mashadar, a shapeless evil which manifests as a pale white fog, haunts the city. Shadowspawn will only enter at great compulsion, as Mashadar is drawn to things of the Shadow like the attraction between opposite poles of a magnet. The city is lethal to all who enter; any who take even a pebble will be tainted by that evil, and will eventually spread it like an illness. It is said Shadar Logoth is dangerous under daylight, but deadly at night.

Shadow's Lance.name: Shadow's Lance
Shadow's Lance.overview: The Shadow's Lance is a significant southward extension of the Blight which forms part of the border between Kandor and Arafel and is noted on maps of the region. The reason for this protrusion of the Blight is unknown.

Shadow Coast.name: Shadow Coast
Shadow Coast.overview:
The Shadow Coast is the name given to the southwestern-most coastline of the Westlands, where the Aryth Ocean meets the Sea of Storms. The Shadow Coast was once part of the kingdoms of Aelgar (during the time of the Ten Nations ) and later Balasun and Kharendor during the Free Years, but is today unclaimed by any nation, although it is bordered by both Tarabon and Amadicia, neither of which seem inclined to try to resettle it.

The Shadow Coast is known for its dangerous reefs and broken coastline, with numerous offshore islands. Sailing close to the coast is hazardous. A semi-submerged peninsula, Windbiter's Finger, extends for several hundred miles out to sea from the Shadow Coast, forcing ships to give it a wide berth. Good harborages on the coast are almost impossible to find, with the next viable harbors being Tanchico to the west or Ebou Dar to the east. The River Sharia rises in the eastern part of the Shadow Coast.

Tall, dark hills and mountains dominate the interior, and wild and dangerous animals are said to live in the countryside. Mostly, it is a region to be avoided.

Shae'en M'taal.name: Shae'en M'taal
Shae'en M'taal.overview: The Shae'en M'taal is an Aiel warrior society. The name means "Stone Dogs" in the Old Tongue.

Shaemal.name: Shaemal
Shaemal.overview:
Shaemal was the capital city of Coremanda, which was part of the Ten Nations.

During their rebuilding after the Breaking of the World, Ogier built a waygate at Shaemal. Sometime during the Trolloc Wars, Shaemal was destroyed. Despite the destruction, some memories of Shaemal survive to the present age. Matrim Cauthon remembers, due to his memories from the Eelfinn, dancing with a Sea Folk Wavemistress in Shaemal's court before the Trolloc Wars, wearing Barsine lace and sapphire buttons from Aramelle. Birgitte Silverbow also remembers being caught spying on an Aes Sedai in the city.

Shahayni.name: Shahayni
Shahayni.overview: Shahayni is a region or fief located in Saldaea, it belonged to the former Queen Tenobia.

Shaido.name: Shaido
Shaido.overview: The Shaido are one of the twelve Aiel clans. There are eighty-three Shaido septs. Amongst the other clans, the Shaido are reputed as sneaky thieves who push the bounds of honor. Although they do not have blood feud, Taardad and Shaido are not friendly toward one another.

Shaido War.name: Shaido War
Shaido War.overview:
The Shaido War was a military campaign begun in 999 NE when the Shaido clan of the Aiel rejected the proclamation of Rand al'Thor as the Car'a'carn or chief of chiefs of the Aiel people at Alcair Dal. Couladin, claiming the leadership of the clan although he had never been to Rhuidean, led the entire Shaido clan, some 160,000 people, into Cairhien on a campaign of conquest and destruction.

Al'Thor, commanding seven clans at that time, led his forces into Cairhien in pursuit, culminating in the Second Battle of Cairhien, where Couladin was killed by Mat Cauthon and the Shaido were put to rout, eventually regrouping in Kinslayer's Dagger under the leadership of the clan's Wise Ones and Couladin's lover Sevanna. Sevanna brokered deals with both the White Tower faction of the Aes Sedai and a mysterious man and woman (later revealed to be the Forsaken Sammael and Graendal ) to ensure the capture of al'Thor. Sevanna double-crossed the Tower Aes Sedai at the Battle of Dumai's Wells, where 40,000 Shaido and 400 Wise Ones surrounded the Aes Sedai, their escort and the captured Rand al'Thor. During the battle both sides were taken by surprise when Lord Perrin Aybara led a mixed force of Aiel, Cairhienin, Tairens, Mayeners, Two Rivers bowmen, and Salidar Aes Sedai in attacking them. As the battle reached a crescendo, al'Thor was freed and the Asha'man arrived in force. Thousands of Shaido were slaughtered in the ensuing massacre and put to flight.

The Shaido again regrouped in the mountains, and Sevanna distributed "traveling boxes" given to her by Sammael that would carry the Shaido to new and fresh lands to conquer. Instead, the Shaido were scattered in groups across the south and west of the continent, their unexpected arrival sowing chaos in those lands. Sevanna and all 400 of the Shaido Wise Ones traveled as one group, however, and upon their arrival in Altara they set about regrouping as many forces as possible. Within a few months they had secured a new base of operations at the city of Malden and had managed to gather in most, if not all, of the Shaido forces that had been scattered.

The Shaido's presence in Malden had been noted by the invading Seanchan, and, in alliance with forces under Perrin Aybara, Banner-General Tylee Khirgan destroyed the Shaido forces for good at the Battle of Malden. Most of the channeling Wise Ones were taken as damane by the Seanchan after the battle.

In the aftermath of the disaster, the Wise One Therava assumed command of what was left of the clan, made Galina her slave, and ordered the Shaido to return home over the Spine of the World and never leave the Waste again, thus ending the Shaido War.

Shainrahien.name: Shainrahien
Shainrahien.overview:
Shainrahien was a city in Safer, which was part of the Ten Nations. Other than the name, little is known about it.

Its name translated into the Common Tongue is possibly "Dawn of Peace" - from the Old Tongue words shain (meaning "peace") and rahien (meaning "dawn").

Shake Dew from the Branch.name: Shake Dew from the Branch
Shake Dew from the Branch.overview: Shake Dew from the Branch is a sword form. It is used to deliver six sharp blows that can be divided amongst several opponents. Gawyn Trakand used this form against Marlesh and Sleete during their training.

Shal.name: Shal
Shal.overview: The River Shal rises in the Hills of Kintara and flows south and west into Illian, where it meets the Manetherendrelle. It is located northwest of the Doirlon Hills and, along with them, forms the western edge of the Plains of Maredo.

Shaldine.name: Shaldine
Shaldine.overview: Shaldme is the eleventh month in the Farede calendar. In most years, it is equivalent to the real world period from September 29 to October 26. Amaetheon occurs on the 6th and Shaoman on the 12th.

Shanaine.name: Shanaine
Shanaine.overview: Shanaine was a city in Manetheren, which was part of the Ten Nations. The city later became modern-day Jehannah.

Shandalle.name: Shandalle
Shandalle.overview: Shandalle was a kingdom that existed during the Free Years. It was established in the first century after the end of the Trolloc Wars, rising out of the former territory of Almoren, and was later subsumed into the empire of Artur Hawkwing. Hawkwing was born in Shandalle and ruled it as king for several years before beginning his rise to power across the rest of the Westlands. Its territory is currently located in the westernmost regions of the kingdom of Cairhien. It's banner was the three golden hawks in flight.

Shaoman.name: Shaoman
Shaoman.overview: Shaoman occurs on the twelfth day of Shaldine. Shaoman is oriented for children, who are cosseted, praised, and given gifts. In some places groups of children go from house to house singing songs and being rewarded with sweets.

Shar Honelle.name: Shar Honelle
Shar Honelle.overview:
Shar Honelle was a city in Aelgar, part of the Ten Nations. It is not known if any current cities are built at or near Shar Honelle.

The translation from the Old Tongue is unknown, although Shar means "blood" or "bloodline", so the full name may refer to the heritage of the nation. Modern day Tarabon, which shares some territory with ancient Aelgar, claims heritage from the Age of Legends, so there may be a link there.

Shara.name: Shara
Shara.overview: Shara is the Westlander name for the land east of the Aiel Waste. Various people have different names for this land, such as Shamara, Co'dansin, Tomaka, Kigali, and Shibouya. Shara is bordered to the southwest and south by the Sea of Storms, and to the east by the Morenal Ocean. As with the Westlands, it is bordered to the north by the Mountains of Dhoom and the Great Blight.

Sharaman.name: Sharaman
Sharaman.overview: A a resident of Shara. A variation of Sharan.

Sharan monarchy.name: Sharan monarchy
Sharan monarchy.overview:
The Sharan monarchy have two titles, Sh'boan and Sh'botay, that they call their rulers depending of the gender of the sitting monarch.

When a woman rules Shara, she is called Sh'boan. She has a consort and rules the land for seven years. At the end of her rule, she dies and her consort, now called Sh'botay, rules and chooses a consort for himself. This cycle has repeated itself every seven years since the Breaking of the World, and it is believed that the first of these rulers was male, a Sh'botay. It is publicly unknown how the deaths of each monarch happen, and Sharans have been taught to believe that they occur due to the "Will of the Pattern." In reality the monarchs are terminated covertly by the Ayyad, the female channelers of Shara who are the real power of that country.

In 999 NE, the ruling Sh'boan was Chiape, who had newly been widowed after the death of the previous Sh'botay. She was about to marry Shaofan, but both of them were kidnapped by Graendal, plunging Shara into chaos. It was the first time in millennia that the line of spousal succession was broken.

Sharia.name: Sharia
Sharia.overview: The River Sharia is the river which forms the southern border of Amadicia. It rises out of the hills and mountains of the Shadow Coast south of Amador and flows east into the Eldar.

Sharom.name: Sharom
Sharom.overview:
The Sharom was a floating white sphere located above the university of Collam Daan in V'saine, in the Age of Legends.

The spherical building soared high above the university's silver and blue domes and was over a thousand feet in diameter, a sky-borne pearl that celebrated the triumph of their art. People could reach the building entrance using either air transport or the One Power. Together, Collam Daan and the Sharom were the main site for advanced research, experiments with the One Power, and teaching. The Power was not used in the construction of this great architectural accomplishment, rather it was used for the studies that led to the development of the necessary technologies that kept the Sharom hovering over the city by utilizing the planet's magnetic and gravitational fields. It is said that the creators of the Sharom chose the impractical design "because they could."

When the Bore was created by Beidomon and Mierin Eronaile (Lanfear), researchers at Collam Daan, the Sharom was the location chosen for the experiment. The resulting backlash destroyed the floating Sharom, the building breaking open like an egg. During Rand al'Thor 's visions in the glass columns of Rhuidean, he experiences the destruction of the Sharom through the eyes of a past Da'shain Aiel named Charn. Upon the moment of the Bore's creation, a raging explosion of obsidian-colored flame tore it apart, sending pure white chips spiraling into the air.

Shawl.name: Shawl
Shawl.overview:
The shawl is a vestment worn by all Aes Sedai as an official garment of their rank as full sisters. "Raised to the shawl" is a colloquialism indicating that an Accepted has been elevated to full sisterhood. Although the Great Serpent ring is more widely acknowledged as the symbol of an Aes Sedai, the ring may be worn by Accepted, full sisters, and even women trained by the Tower but who were not raised to sisters for varying reasons. Only full sisters may wear the shawl.

The shawl is commonly described as a piece of fabric edged with a long, silky fringe in the color of an individual sister's Ajah, and with the Flame of Tar Valon set forth in white, which hangs in the center of a sister's back when the shawl is worn. The shawl is worn around the shoulders of an Aes Sedai, or looped over her arms. The shawl is also described as being embroidered with grapevines and flowering apple branches, but the actual color of the fabric from which the shawl is sewn was never revealed.

Before the White Tower Schism, the shawls were rarely worn except on formal occasions. A sister dressed formally would be expected to wear her shawl along with a dress in her Ajah colors. Newly raised sisters also are prone to wearing the shawl frequently, even outside of official occasions. It is speculated that they wear them to demonstrate to their former instructors that they now share a common rank, or that the individual sister wearing it is wearing it as a bit of celebration.

In the wake of later events in the White Tower, with its openly hostile relations between the Ajahs, the Aes Sedai still in Tar Valon wear their shawls whenever they are in mixed groups as a blatant demonstration of their Ajah loyalties, as well as a bit of almost jingoistic pride.

Shayol Ghul.name: Shayol Ghul
Shayol Ghul.overview:
Shayol Ghul (pronounced: SHAY-ol GHOOL) is a great black mountain, once an idyllic island in a cool sea, now the focal point of the Dark One 's power. It is located in the lifeless Blasted Lands, a place which bore the brunt of the War of Power. Within the mountain is the Pit of Doom, accessible only by a narrow stone passage where reality is wet clay to the Dark One; teeth of stone may brush at an intruder's head or close on him entirely, or rise to give honor to a loyal servant of the Shadow.

The Blasted Lands are inaccessible for the most part, for they are past the Great Blight. Entire armies have died fighting the Blight, and it is all the forces of the Borderlands can do to hold it back.

Shea dancer.name: Shea dancer
Shea dancer.overview:
Shea dancers are a group of Seanchan da'covale kept for entertainment. They perform dances called Poses, a series of stances that flow into one another, either in groups of ten to twenty but occasionally perform alone.

They are chosen for their appearance and they are scantly clad, apparently wearing less then a regular da'covale' s sheer robe and wear transparent veils and gaudy jewelry.

Sheathing the Sword.name: Sheathing the Sword
Sheathing the Sword.overview: Sheathing the Sword is a concept that encompasses sword forms.

Sheepstongue root.name: Sheepstongue root
Sheepstongue root.overview:
Sheepstongue root is an herb that can be found in the Two Rivers region. A mixture of sheepstongue root and rannel will perk a person up somewhat, but the significant property is its horrible and lasting taste. A village Wisdom such as Nynaeve may administer the concoction to someone who is claiming they are sick, moping, behaving "like a goose" and generally acting the fool.

According to Mother Guenna, an herbalist Wise Woman, sheepstongue root is also helpful for eye pain.

Shelan.name: Shelan
Shelan.overview: The Shelan are a sept of the Daryne Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Sheldyn.name: Sheldyn
Sheldyn.overview: Sheldyn is an estate in Andor held by the Lady Ellorien Traemane.

Shende Hold.name: Shende Hold
Shende Hold.overview: Shende Hold is the hold of the Jarra sept of the Chareen Aiel. Its Wise One is Sorilea.

Shiagi Hold.name: Shiagi Hold
Shiagi Hold.overview: Shiagi Hold is an Aiel settlement in the Three-fold Land. It is clan hold to the Nakai. Bruan, a clan chief, and Alsera, a Wise One, are from this hold. Alsera told Seana in a dream that Bruan was coming from Shiagi Hold to Alcair Dal as fast as possible after Rand al'Thor went to Rhuidean.

Shiande.name: Shiande
Shiande.overview: The Shiande are one of the twelve Aiel clans. Their clan hold is unknown.

Shield (Constellation).name: Shield (Constellation)
Shield (Constellation).overview: One of the constellations seen over the night skies of the Westlands. Also called Hawkwing ’s Shield.

Shield of the North.name: Shield of the North
Shield of the North.overview:
Shield of the North is a title of the Kandori and Saldaean monarchs. The title alludes to the fact that both nations are in the north and guard against invasion of Trollocs from the Great Blight. Currently, Queen Ethenielle Kirukon Materasu and Queen Tenobia si Bashere Kazadi holds this title.

The shared nature of this title may originate from the old nation of Basharande which existed during the Free Years. Basharande included most of what is present day Saldaea and part of present day Kandor, most importantly the part containing the capital city of Chachin. The ruler of Kandor also holds the Sword of Kirukan, an artefact from the even earlier nation of Aramaelle, which covered modern day Shienar, Arafel and eastern Kandor, again including the region which now contains Chachin. While the cities of Aramaelle would have been destroyed during the Trolloc Wars, it is a valid theory that the rulers of Basharande at one point became rivals with the eastern ruler retaining authority via the ancient blade, while the western ruler retained most of the land. While the Borderlands going to war seems unlikely, a split of equally valid claims to the title seems possible.

Shienar.name: Shienar
Shienar.overview: Shienar (pronounced: shy-NAHR) is one of the four Borderland nations which lie on the threshold of the Great Blight. It is the easternmost of the Borderlands, lying between the Spine of the World and Arafel. The sigil of Shienar is a swooping black hawk. By tradition, the sigil of the reigning ruler is also a sign of Shienar.

Shiota.name: Shiota
Shiota.overview: Shiota was a kingdom of the Free Years. It was founded after the Trolloc Wars out of the former territory of Eharon. During the War of the Hundred Years, it splinted into the kingdom of Altara, with a large chunk of its eastern territory becoming part of Illian.

Sho-wing.name: Sho-wing
Sho-wing.overview:
Sho-wings were one of the many technological wonders that existed during the Age of Legends. They were transportation vehicles that ranged in shape and size, although the most common form was a delta-shape.

Sho-wings were designed for carrying passengers - numbering from few to the hundreds - over large distances, similar to other vehicles known as jo-cars, jumpers, and hoverflies.

Allegedly, immediately after the Breaking began, sho-wings disappeared from existence, and not even tales of them managed to survive to the Third Age. However, Moridin was known to have collected a number of parts to one, which he kept in a secret facility alongside other salvaged technology from the Age of Legends.

Shocklance.name: Shocklance
Shocklance.overview: Shocklances are weapons that were used during the Age of Legends.

Shol Arbela.name: Shol Arbela
Shol Arbela.overview:
Shol Arbela is the capital city of Arafel, in the Borderlands. It is the largest city in the kingdom and serves as the seat of the king, currently Paitar Nachiman. Roads link the city to Chachin in Kandor, Fal Moran in Shienar and Tar Valon.

Shol Arbela is known as the City of Ten Thousand Bells. It is an Arafellin custom for men and women to wear bells in their hair, though it is not known whether this is something more connected with Shol Arbela itself or the nation as a whole.

It is one of the large cities in the Westlands that was neither built by Ogier nor founded on an Ogier-built city.

Shon Kifar.name: Shon Kifar
Shon Kifar.overview:
Shon Kifar is a city in Seanchan, located on the eastern shore.

It is the tenth largest city in the empire. Before journeying to the Westlands aboard the Victory of Kidron, Tuon Athaem Kore Paendrag purchases a damane she named Mylen on the docks of Shon Kifar. This damane is actually an Aes Sedai by the name of Sheraine Caminelle.

Shorara.name: Shorara
Shorara.overview: The Shorara is a sept of the Tomanelle Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Shoufa.name: Shoufa
Shoufa.overview:
A shoufa is a scarf worn by the Aiel, usually the color of sand or rock. Normally, the scarf-like garment is wrapped around the head and neck, leaving only the face bare. Some time during the Breaking of the World, the Da'shain Aiel added black dust-veils to the garments in response to the harsh conditions they experienced in their travels. The first Da'shain to violate the Way of the Leaf were admonished to hide their faces behind their veils as the rest of the Da'shain did not wish to see the faces of their loved ones on killers. When a modern Aiel pulls the attached veil over his or her mouth, it means that he or she is prepared to kill and is the basis for the derogatory phrase "black-veiled Aiel."

In Rand's visions of the past, a shoufa is mentioned as part of the work clothes of the Aiel working in the fields before the Breaking.

Sidon.name: Sidon
Sidon.overview: Sidon was a village in Ghealdan. It was located on the banks of the River Boern.

Sidona.name: Sidona
Sidona.overview: Sidona is a geographical region of the Borderland nation of Saldaea. Its lord is Davram Bashere.

Siege of Caemlyn.name: Siege of Caemlyn
Siege of Caemlyn.overview: Caemlyn was sieged many times in history, the last was during the Fourth Succession War, when Elayne was able to break the siege put by Arymilla Marne 's Armies.

Siege of Tar Valon.name: Siege of Tar Valon
Siege of Tar Valon.overview: The Siege of Tar Valon was the plan to retake the city of Tar Valon by the rebel Aes Sedai led by the Amyrlin Egwene al'Vere. The siege was the first direct move against the White Tower to dethrone the usurper Armylin, Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan.

Sienda.name: Sienda
Sienda.overview:
Sienda is large village in Amadicia east of Amador.

The buildings are of stone and thatch and the dirt streets are crowded with Children of the Light and Guardians of the Gate.

It has two inns, one of which ( The King's Lancer ), was damaged by one of Valan Luca 's giant boar horses.

The second inn is The Light of Truth, where Nynaeve al'Meara, Elayne Trakand, Thom Merrilin and Juilin Sandar stay. It is here where they meet Galad Damodred and later join Valan Luca's Traveling Show, heading for Ghealdan.

Silver Circiut.name: Silver Circiut
Silver Circiut.overview: The Silver Circuit is one of the stadiums in Ebou Dar, Altara, where disputed horse races take place.

Silver Circuit.name: Silver Circuit
Silver Circuit.overview: The Silver Circuit is one of the stadiums in Ebou Dar, Altara, where horse races take place.

Silver Road.name: Silver Road
Silver Road.overview:
The Silver Road is a major highway linking the city of Illian to Lugard, the capital of Murandy. The road is sheltered from the cemaros by the Nemarellin Mountains that line the coast to the west. The road meets the Illian Road in the north, near the River Manetherendrelle.

The Causeway of the Northern Star carries the road into the capital of Illian.

Silverleaf.name: Silverleaf
Silverleaf.overview: Silverleaf is an herb. Nothing is known about it except that it is can be combined with timsin root in a tea to treat headaches. Matrim Cauthon once drank this tea.

Silverpike.name: Silverpike
Silverpike.overview: Silverpike is a fish often mentioned by Siuan Sanche in her fish-related sayings and puns. They travel in schools. Because of the density of fish, being caught in such a school outside of a boat can be very troublesome. Siuan Sanche, and other Tairens, often mention silverpike as dangerous.

Silverwall Keeps.name: Silverwall Keeps
Silverwall Keeps.overview:
The Silverwall Keeps is a massive fortress that lies on the border of Kandor and Arafel. It is built on two sides of Firchon Pass and it looks like an enormous doorway. They are guarded by many archers.

Lan Mandragoran rode through the Keeps as he marched for the Last Battle.

Siswai'aman.name: Siswai'aman
Siswai'aman.overview:
Siswai'aman means "Spears of the Dragon," and sounds much more possessive in the Old Tongue. More accurate may be "The Spears Owned by the Dragon." Aiel who consider themselves siswai'aman wear red headbands with the ancient symbol of Aes Sedai on it. Both men and women wear the headband of the siswai'aman, but no woman who is a Maiden of the Spear has taken part in this yet.

For the first time they appear after the Second Battle of Cairhien, possibly due to Rand proving himself a successor of ancient Aes Sedai in this battle.

The headband is described as scarlet or crimson strips of cloth, worn above the brows, knotted at the temples. The ancient symbol of Aes Sedai sits on the forehead: a disc with a sinuous line separating a white side from a black side. It is the symbol on Rand al'Thor 's banner.

Aiel who carry the spear normally wear nothing on their heads aside from a shoufa, always colored in such a way that the wearer is camouflaged in rocks and shadows. The bright red headbands worn by these warriors is an oddity. Even stranger, there are siswai'aman among the gai'shain who wear the narrow headband. Gai'shain under normal circumstances separate themselves from virtually all personal identity except his or her name for the duration of his or her service. An article declaring an allegiance or a belief is highly unusual. Further, a gai'shain's dedication to touching no weapon extends to clothing: they are never to wear anything that those who touch weapons do, thus their white robes. Finally, some of these gai'shan are seen amongst dragonsworn fighting in Shayol Ghul promising that after the Last Battle they would wear the white again.

Although the headbands make a loud visual statement, no Aiel is comfortable speaking of their existence.

Beyond the physical appearance of the headbands, their significance is most profound. It is remarkable that any Aiel would swear such fealty to a single person as the siswai'aman do the the Dragon. The Aiel typically view Rand al'Thor, the Car'a'carn, as the first among equals, and, like all leaders, not deserving of unalienable command. The siswai'aman break this Aiel ideology by devoting themselves to the will of Rand al'Thor in a way representing very highly a Wetlander's approach to his Lord. It is seemingly the cultural antithesis of Aiel behavior. However, the siswai'aman are rooted in toh. They believe serving Rand expiates their ancestral sins in failing the Aes Sedai.

Siswai.name: Siswai
Siswai.overview: Siswai is a horse owned by Aviendha. In the Old Tongue, Siswai meens "spear."

Skulker.name: Skulker
Skulker.overview: Skulker is the name of the horse owned by Juilin Sandar.

Sleepwell root.name: Sleepwell root
Sleepwell root.overview: Sleepwell root is an herb that can be found in the Two Rivers region. It clears headaches and causes some drowsiness, which makes sleepwell root a good sleep aid.

Smoke Springs Hold.name: Smoke Springs Hold
Smoke Springs Hold.overview: Smoke Springs Hold is the clan hold of the Goshien Aiel, located in the Aiel Waste. The Roofmistress is Dorindha.

Smoke Water.name: Smoke Water
Smoke Water.overview: The Smoke Water is a sept of the Miagoma Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Snake (Constellation).name: Snake (Constellation)
Snake (Constellation).overview: One of the constellations seen over the night skies of the Westlands. The Aiel call this one Dragon.

Snow Goose.name: Snow Goose
Snow Goose.overview: The Snow Goose is a riverboat.

Snowy Dawn.name: Snowy Dawn
Snowy Dawn.overview: Snowy Dawn is a wolf known to Perrin Aybara.

So'jhin.name: So'jhin
So'jhin.overview:
So'jhin are a class of da'covale, hereditary upper servants of the Blood of the Seanchan. They have considerable status, and can have authority over free people, even giving them orders.

The majority of the Imperial bureaucracy was so'jhin, the Voices of the Blood were so'jhin. They could own property and they were only sold as a punishment. With permissions they could marry. Their bloodline would always belong to the same family. Ordinary people did not own so'jhin.

They can be recognized by their half-shaven heads, their remaining hair often plaited into a long braid.

As with many Seanchan words, its roots come from the Old Tongue. The closest translation would be "a height among lowness," though some translate it as meaning "both sky and valley" among several other possibilities.

So Eban.name: So Eban
So Eban.overview:
So Eban is a village in Altara. It is located on the border of Altara and Amadicia, near the River Eldar.

When Nynaeve al'Meara, Elayne Trakand, Juilin Sandar and Thomdril Merrilin are in Sienda, Thom hears of a rumor that King Ailron means to take the eastern bank of the River Eldar, from Salidar to So Eban to Mosra. If this plan succeeds, Pedron Niall, through Ailron, will be able to control the commerce of Ebou Dar.

So Habor.name: So Habor
So Habor.overview: So Habor is a town in northwest Altara.

So Tehar.name: So Tehar
So Tehar.overview:
So Tehar is a small village in Altara. It is a scruffy collection of white-plastered bricks and flies.

Matrim Cauthon, Elayne Trakand, Nynaeve al'Meara and others stayed at The Southern Hoop, an inn in So Tehar, on their way to Ebou Dar.

Soetam.name: Soetam
Soetam.overview: Soetam is one of the animals of the Drowned Lands. It is described as "the ten stone great rat".

Soft Rain at Sunset.name: Soft Rain at Sunset
Soft Rain at Sunset.overview: Soft Rain at Sunset is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it. Lan Mandragoran once used this form to slice open an assassin's face and left eye.

Sohadra.name: Sohadra
Sohadra.overview: Sohadra was a place during the War of Power where Sammael escaped justice.

Sohima.name: Sohima
Sohima.overview:
Sohima was a town in Seanchan.

Recently, the Great Fire of Sohima caused great destruction to the town, destroying most, if not all, of the town. Furyk Karede was in Sohima during the fire. In it he lost a doll named Emela, given to him by Tuon Athaem Kore Paendrag.. His wife Kalia and one of his sons perished in the fire.

Solanje.name: Solanje
Solanje.overview:
Solanje is a town in Arad Doman.

Rodel Ituralde won a victory at Solanje against the Dragonsworn.

Sorelle Step.name: Sorelle Step
Sorelle Step.overview: Sorelle Step was the place of a battle during the Trolloc Wars. It was one of the innumerable battles won by Rashima Kerenmosa, Soldier Amyrlin.

Soremaine.name: Soremaine
Soremaine.overview:
Soremaine is the site of a major battle of the Whitecloak War.

During the engagement, the Children of the Light captured and later ransomed Mattin Stepaneos den Balgar. Though the battle was lost, the Illianer Companions "covered the field," allowing the rest of the army to evade Pedron Niall 's trap. Had the Companions not been successful, Altara, Murandy and maybe even Illian might have become fiefs of the Whitecloaks, according to the musings of Niall.

Sorfa.name: Sorfa
Sorfa.overview: Sorfa is an herb used medicinally by Seanchan. A tincture of sorfa can be applied topically to a wound such as a welt to aid in healing.

Sovin Nai.name: Sovin Nai
Sovin Nai.overview: The Sovin Nai is an Aiel warrior society. The name means "Knife Hands" in the Old Tongue.

Sparrow.name: Sparrow
Sparrow.overview: Sparrow is the horse owned by Toveine Gazal.

Spine of the World.name: Spine of the World
Spine of the World.overview:
The Spine of the World is a vast mountain range that stretches from the Blight in the north to the Sea of Storms in the south, forming the eastern border of the Westlands and separating it from the Aiel Waste and the Termool to the east. The rivers Erinin, Iralell and Gaelin all flow out of the Spine. The Aiel refer to the Spine as the Dragonwall.

The range has two major spurs which extend into the Westlands: Kinslayer's Dagger and the Maraside Mountains, which respectively form the northern and southern borders of the kingdom of Cairhien.

There are several passes through the mountains. The Niamh Passes cross from the Aiel Waste to Shienar. The Jangai Pass crosses from the Aiel Waste into Cairhien. It is also possible to circumvent the Spine to the south through a narrow coastal strip between the mountains and the Bay of Remara, but this route only leads into the hostile swampland known as the Drowned Lands.

There are several Ogier steddings in the Spine. From north to south these are: Qichen, Sanshen, Handu, Chanti, Lantoine, Yongen, Mashong, Sintiang, Taijing, Kolomon, Daiting and Shangtai.

Spine Ridge.name: Spine Ridge
Spine Ridge.overview: The Spine Ridge is a sept of the Miagoma Aiel. The sept hold is unknown.

Spray.name: Spray
Spray.overview:
For the similarly named Sea Folk ship, see White Spray .

The Spray is the river ship that belongs to Bayle Domon. It is eighty feet long with two masts and broad in the beam.

Spring Pole.name: Spring Pole
Spring Pole.overview: A Spring Pole is a long slender trunk of a fir tree shorn of it's branches standing about 10 feet high. It is erected by the women of the village and ignored by the men until the morning of Bel Tine, when they act surprised that the pole is there. At noon of the day of Bel Tine unmarried women dance around the pole entwining it with long colorful ribbons while the unmarried men sing.

Springhorn.name: Springhorn
Springhorn.overview: Springhorn is a leader of a pack of wolves.

Squad.name: Squad
Squad.overview: A squad is a military unit led by a lieutenant consisting of fifty infantry.

Squadron.name: Squadron
Squadron.overview: A squadron is a military unit led by a captain. It consists of five hundred cavalry divided into ten troops.

Square of Tammaz.name: Square of Tammaz
Square of Tammaz.overview:
The Square of Tammaz, also called the Great Square of Tammaz, is a plaza in the city of Illian. The broad square separates the King's Palace and the Great Hall of the Council. It is "surrounded by huge columns of white marble at least fifteen spans tall and two spans thick, supporting nothing but a wreath of carved olive branches at the top."

Hunters of the Horn take their oath and receive a blessing in the Great Square of Tammaz.

Staera.name: Staera
Staera.overview: A staera is a tool used by the Aiel. It is a slim, curved piece of bronze that is used in the sweat tents to scrape off dirt and sweat.

Stag (Constellation).name: Stag (Constellation)
Stag (Constellation).overview: One of the constellations seen over the night skies of the Westlands.

Stair of Jehaan.name: Stair of Jehaan
Stair of Jehaan.overview: The Stair of Jehaan is where the armies of Shienar, Arafel and Kandor met the Trollocs and defeated them after Malkier was overrun by the Shadow in 953 NE. This was likely the largest battle in the Westlands since the War of the Hundred Years. Unfortunately, this was not enough to save Malkier, and the Blight would go on to devour that land. Paitar Nachiman, the current King of Arafel, may be old enough to have fought in this battle as a young man.

Stasis box.name: Stasis box
Stasis box.overview:
A stasis box is a technological device crafted during the Age of Legends. Though little information of these artifacts has survived the Third Age, it is known that items held inside a sealed stasis box will never age, and that time is suspended within the box for as long it remains sealed. Indeed, from the perception of a creature - or object - placed into a stasis box, as soon as the lid of the device closes it immediately re-opens. This bizarre time-defying effect is directly experienced by the gholam which pursues Matrim Cauthon. It is probable that the creature was either placed or tricked into a stasis box during the height of the War of Power, and released in 999 NE. Moreover, it is possible that the ornate container found at the Eye of the World containing the Horn of Valere and the Dragon Banner was a stasis box put into place by Solinda, Oselle and Zorelle Sedai after the destruction of Paaran Disen in the hopes that its unaged contents would be recovered in the far future by the Dragon Reborn.

Sometime prior to 998 NE, Ishamael located a stasis box that contained dozens of zomara, which later serve wine to Darkfriends at the Darkfriend Social. In 999 NE Graendal found a stasis box that contained Streith and Sammael found another which contained "lots of goodies, and something else," - a possible reference to the gholam.

Stayer.name: Stayer
Stayer.overview: Stayer is one of the horses owned by Perrin Aybara.

Steady.name: Steady
Steady.overview: Steady is a horse owned by Rodel Ituralde.

Stedding.name: Stedding
Stedding.overview: Stedding (pronounced: STEHD-ding) are havens for their inhabitants, the Ogier. Ogier who remain outside the stedding too long die of the Longing.

Stepper.name: Stepper
Stepper.overview: Stepper is a horse ridden by Perrin Aybara. Stepper is a dun stallion. Perrin named him so due to his quick feet.

Steward of the Dragon.name: Steward of the Dragon
Steward of the Dragon.overview: The Steward of the Dragon is a title given to those people granted rule over a territory or nation by Rand al'Thor, while there were not available rightful rulers.

Stinger.name: Stinger
Stinger.overview: Stinger is ridden by Silviana Brehon.

Stinkweed.name: Stinkweed
Stinkweed.overview: Stinkweed is a plant that produced a rank smell when crushed.

Stole.name: Stole
Stole.overview:
A stole is a vestment worn by various holders of certain of offices. In the series, it has been shown as primarily a symbol of offices held by women, such as the Amyrlin Seat, the Panarch of Tarabon and the Queen of Andor. The Keeper of the Chronicles also wears a stole as a trapping of her office.

Typically the stole is a wide, flat strip of silk, worn over a dress, hanging from the behind the wearer's neck to trail down the front of her torso. Thus far, all of the stoles mentioned have been worn by women.

Stole of the Amyrlin Seat.name: Stole of the Amyrlin Seat
Stole of the Amyrlin Seat.overview:
The Stole of the Amyrlin Seat is one of the symbolic items of regalia worn by the Amyrlin Seat. It is a long strip of silk, about "a hand wide" that the Amyrlin wears over her dress, that traditionally contains seven bands of color, one for each Ajah. Robert Jordan confirmed the order of these colors for the New Spring graphic novel:

- Blue
- Green
- Yellow
- Red
- White
- Gray
- Brown

These colors are also repeated on the hems of the dresses of Accepted in the White Tower.

The size of the stole is a mystery. It is generally described as "broad," in contrast to the "narrow" stole of the Keeper of the Chronicles. Egwene al'Vere can store the stole in her belt pouch. Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan 's stole is "wide enough to cover her shoulders." Perhaps, like the width of the Keeper's stole, the width of the Amyrlin's is based at least partly on personal preference.

Stole of the Keeper of the Chronicles.name: Stole of the Keeper of the Chronicles
Stole of the Keeper of the Chronicles.overview: The stole of the Keeper of the Chronicles is a symbol of office for the Aes Sedai in the position of Keeper of the Chronicles. It is a strip of fabric in the color of the wearer's Ajah, worn over her dress, hanging from behind her neck and down her torso. The width of the stole is decided by the Keeper.

Stole of the Panarch of Tarabon.name: Stole of the Panarch of Tarabon
Stole of the Panarch of Tarabon.overview: The stole of the Panarch of Tarabon is a symbol of office for the Panarch of Tarabon.

Stole of the Queen of Andor.name: Stole of the Queen of Andor
Stole of the Queen of Andor.overview: Along with the Rose Crown, the stole of the Queen of Andor is a symbol of her role and station.

Stone Falls From the Mountain.name: Stone Falls From the Mountain
Stone Falls From the Mountain.overview: Stone Falls From the Mountain is a sword form. Aside from the name, nothing is known about it. Be'lal used this form against Rand al'Thor in the Stone of Tear during their duel over Callandor.

Stone of Tear.name: Stone of Tear
Stone of Tear.overview:
The Stone of Tear is an immense fortress, believed to be mankind's oldest surviving stronghold and indeed oldest existing structure, having been erected shortly after, or during, the Breaking of the World. It was built by Aes Sedai using the One Power: Earth, Air, and Fire fusing stones together without joint or mortar. The Stone resembles a great mountain and towers over the city of Tear. Only the White Tower is taller.

From the description given in Rand 's trip trough the glass columns of Rhuidean about the time of the Breaking it can be guessed that the Stone was built with the main purpose to host and protect Callandor (see below about the Heart of the Stone).

Stones.name: Stones
Stones.overview: Stones is a two-player game featured prominently in the Wheel of Time universe. It is the same as, or extremely similar to, the real-world game of Go. Each player alternates placing a stone on the board with the intention being to "capture" stones belonging to your opponent.

Stones Fall in the Pond.name: Stones Fall in the Pond
Stones Fall in the Pond.overview: Stones Fall in the Pond is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Stones Falling Down the Mountain.name: Stones Falling Down the Mountain
Stones Falling Down the Mountain.overview: Stones Falling Down the Mountain is a sword form. Aside from the name, nothing is known about it. Rand al'Thor used Unfolding the Fan to counter this form when he was attacked by duplicate reflections of himself in the Stone of Tear.

Stones Falling from the Cliff.name: Stones Falling from the Cliff
Stones Falling from the Cliff.overview: Stones Falling from the Cliff is a sword form. Nothing but the name is known about this form. It was used in the duel between Rand al'Thor and Turak Aladon. The opposing side used this form to counter Ribbon in the Air.

Stones River.name: Stones River
Stones River.overview:
The Stones River is a sept of the Goshien Aiel.

The Stones River sept was part of the High Plain sept until it grew too large to sustain itself.

Stories.name: Stories
Stories.overview: Stories and legends are often told by gleemen which include legendary people.

Storm Shakes the Branch.name: Storm Shakes the Branch
Storm Shakes the Branch.overview: Storm Shakes the Branch is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it.

Storn.name: Storn
Storn.overview: The Storn is a river in Murandy. It flows out of the hills and low mountains along the border with Andor to the north and converges with the Reisendrelle in Lugard. It flows through the country in a south-westerly direction.

Stout.name: Stout
Stout.overview: Stout was the name of Galadedrid Damodred 's warhorse.

Strangers' Markets.name: Strangers' Markets
Strangers' Markets.overview: The three markets open to foreigners in Far Madding.

Street of Joy.name: Street of Joy
Street of Joy.overview: A main thoroughfare in Far Madding. It was really two broad, street streets separated by a measured row of leafless, gray-barked trees.

Streith.name: Streith
Streith.overview:
Streith is a type of material popular during the Age of Legends. It is normally white or silvery in appearance, but changes color and transparency to match the mood of its wearer. The first mention of streith occurs during the Rhuidean flashbacks where the Aes Sedai Solinda is described as wearing an "old-fashioned" streith gown.

Moghedien wore a dress of streith in Tel'aran'rhiod, but Nynaeve did not know what it was. Moghedien's streith was probably a construct of the Dream, as she never wear such a dress in the real world. Moghedien's streith dress "seemed to be mist, sometimes silvery and opaque, sometimes gray and so thin as to show her limbs and body clearly".

The making of streith was lost during the Breaking of the World, but a number of pieces of streith clothing have been found in stasis boxes. In 999 NE Graendal made one such discovery. She eventually wore it during a conversation with Sammael, where its properties were displayed as her emotions changed.

Strength in the One Power among the Kin.name: Strength in the One Power among the Kin
Strength in the One Power among the Kin.overview: This article is about the distribution of One Power strength among the Kin. For a list of all strength rankings and an explanation of the numbering system, see One Power strength rankings. For Aes Sedai and other initiates of the Tower, see Strength in the One Power among Aes Sedai.

Striking the Spark.name: Striking the Spark
Striking the Spark.overview: Striking the Spark is a sword form. Aside from the name, nothing is known about the form. It was used by Rand al'Thor during his duel in the sky over Falme with Ishamael.

Succession Wars.name: Succession Wars
Succession Wars.overview: The Succession Wars are a series of conflicts in the history of Andor. There have been four Succession Wars in the past one thousand years. They should not be confused with the Wars of Cairhienin Succession of neighboring Cairhien.

Sul'dam.name: Sul'dam
Sul'dam.overview:
Sul'dam ( Old Tongue: Leash Holder ) are Seanchan women who can control damane, women who can channel the One Power and are viewed as too dangerous to roam free in society. Sul'dam control damane through the use of an a'dam, a special ter'angreal that looks like a silver leash and bracelet. Using the a'dam, the sul'dam can sense the thoughts and feelings of the damane and also inflict pain or pleasure. When damane try to escape their a'dam, they undergo severe headaches that vanish when they stop thinking of escaping.

In reality, sul'dam are women who could learn to channel but are not born with the spark like damane are. Only recently has this fact come to light, and threatens to tear apart the fabric of Seanchan society, as sul'dam are honored at the same time damane are reviled. An a'dam will control a sul'dam if used against her, even if she does not know how to fully use the One Power. Some sul'dam believe in mutilation (such as the removal of tongues, hands, or feet) to make a damane behave, but this is often viewed as sei'mosiev.

The very idea of persons who channel terrify most Seanchan who believe all who can channel should be chained as chattel and treated as animals—dangerous animals in need of strict training. In fact, der'sul'dam and sul'dam are considered to be exotic animal holders of the highest rank. Some sul'dam see themselves as indulgent by praising their damane, awarding sweets and pats on the head for good behavior as one does a pet cat or dog.

The uniform of a sul'dam is an ankle length dark blue dress with panels of red and silver forks of lightning bolts. They also wear soft boots.

Sulara Hold.name: Sulara Hold
Sulara Hold.overview: Sulara Hold is an Aiel settlement in the Three-fold Land. Niella, first-sister to Aviendha, is from Sulara Hold. She was taken gai'shain by Far Dareis Mai of the Chareen clan during a raid. It is unknown if the hold is held by the Taardad or if ownership changed during the raid.

Sun Lance.name: Sun Lance
Sun Lance.overview: Sun Lance is the horse owned by Bukama Marenellin during the last days of the Aiel War.

Sun Palace.name: Sun Palace
Sun Palace.overview: The Sun Palace, also known as the Palace of the Rising Sun in Splendor, is the royal palace of Cairhien, and the residence of the Cairhienin royal family. It is also the location of the Sun Throne of Cairhien.
aliases: Palace of the Rising Sun in Splendor

Sun Throne.name: Sun Throne
Sun Throne.overview: The Sun Throne is a chair used as the throne for the monarch of Cairhien. It may also be used as a metaphor for the center of political power in Cairhien.

Sunburst root.name: Sunburst root
Sunburst root.overview: Sunburst root is an herb, which, when mixed with ground ivy and five-finger, creates a greasy ointment which is used treat pain and possibly inflammation in areas of bruising.

Sunday.name: Sunday
Sunday.overview:
Sunday is a feastday and festival at midsummer, and is celebrated in many parts of the world. This is the summer solstice, the longest day of the year.

Sunday falls within the month of Amadaine, although it is a separate day not part of the month.

Sunset Convocation.name: Sunset Convocation
Sunset Convocation.overview: The Sunset Convocations are celebrations that occur after the coronation of the Cairhien monarch. A Convocation occurs every third day for the first nine days after the coronation. Only three are known about though the set may continue longer if uninterrupted.

Sunset Gate.name: Sunset Gate
Sunset Gate.overview:
The Sunset Gate is an iron gate on the grounds of the White Tower. It has two gilded suns at the top that give it its name.

In the book New Spring, Siuan and Moiraine go out the Sunset Gate with eight Tower Guards, including the gruff Steler, to start the census in hopes of discovering the identity of the Dragon Reborn.

Supreme Council.name: Supreme Council
Supreme Council.overview: The Supreme Council, also known as the Great Council, is the governing body of the Black Ajah.

Sursa.name: Sursa
Sursa.overview:
Sursa are eating implements, used in pairs. They are common in Arad Doman but sometimes fashion brings their use to other lands.

They are equivalent to chopsticks in the real world.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.overview:
For the ter'angreal owned by Cadsuane Melaidhrin , see Golden swallow .

Swallow was the horse owned by Faile Bashere.

Swearing and Insults.name: Swearing and Insults
Swearing and Insults.overview: Swearing occurs quite often in the books in both someone saying a swear word and someone thinking one. Insults also occur just as often.

Swift (horse).name: Swift (horse)
Swift (horse).overview: Swift is the horse owned by Galina Casban.

Swift (ship).name: Swift (ship)
Swift (ship).overview: The Swift is a river ship, captained by a man named Derne. It is "sleek as the bird" and is speedy true to its name.

Sword-breaker.name: Sword-breaker
Sword-breaker.overview:
A sword-breaker is a real-life weapon ↗ that is notched such that it can easily trap an opponent's sword. If the wielder is proficient enough, the sword-breaker can even trap axes and polearms, possibly disarming the opponent or allowing the user a strike with another weapon. Sometimes sword-breakers (called by some swordcatchers) are also sharpened and can be deadly in their own right in the real world, but this variety is not mentioned in the Wheel of Time.

In the world of the Wheel of Time, sword-breakers appear in use by Hurin and Juilin Sandar, perhaps suggesting the weapon is commonly favored by thief-takers. Hurin usually uses his sword-breaker in conjunction with a short sword or sometimes with a cudgel. Juilin's sword-breaker is described as "much like Hurin's but with short slots to either side of the long one," which he uses along with a bamboo staff. It is "like a short sword but unsharpened, its slots meant to catch a blade."

Juilin's sword-breaker may look more similar to this custom short sword/sword breaker which could be crafted to have "short slots to either side of the long one," " a long slot in the center and the short to either side. This seems to fit the description of his sword-breaker better than one with a comb-like design along one or both sides.

Sword forms.name: Sword forms
Sword forms.overview:
Sword forms are named forms - or "styles" - in which swordsmen are trained to use the sword. Blademasters and Gaidin have a wider knowledge and mastery of the forms. Like real-world parallels, they are not always meant to be used exactly as choreographed in the middle of combat and instead convey a named concept or tactic for the swordsman.

While training, one may use a practice sword instead of a real sword to move through these forms. A practice sword may be sword-shaped piece of wood, or a bundle of thin, loosely bound staves or lathes in place of a blade.

Some, if not all, sword forms are taught in the Seanchan Empire. When Rand al'Thor battles Turak Aladon, Rand recognizes the forms that the High Lord used. They were different from what Rand was taught, but similar enough. It is possible the names might be different as well.

Sword of Kirukan.name: Sword of Kirukan
Sword of Kirukan.overview: The Sword of Kirukan is an ancient blade attributed to the legendary warrior queen Kirukan of Aramaelle.

Sword of the Blightborder.name: Sword of the Blightborder
Sword of the Blightborder.overview: Sword of the Blightborder is a title of the Saldaean monarch. The title alludes to the fact that the nation is on the Blightborder and stands ready to defend the Westlands from Trolloc invasion. Currently, Tenobia si Bashere Kazadi holds this title.

Swordbearer.name: Swordbearer
Swordbearer.overview: Swordbearer or, more completely, Swordbearer to the Throne of the Clouds is a Kandori title for the member of the royal court who, as the title implies, bore the monarch's sword, the Sword of Kirukan.

Swordmaster.name: Swordmaster
Swordmaster.overview:
Swordmaster is an Atha'an Miere title given to the male counterpart of a Wavemistress as head of a clan, although he does not hold as much rule over the clan as she does.

The Swordmaster, usually a former Cargomaster before promotion, holds power over the other Cargomasters of the clan. He directs them in matters of trade and defense.

Swovan Night.name: Swovan Night
Swovan Night.overview: Swovan Night is a holiday falling on Taisham 13. Nothing really is known about the holiday save that pine boughs are used to decorate windows and peoples' hair and there is dancing and music.

T'mat.name: T'mat
T'mat.overview: T'mat is a red fruit that only grows in the Aiel Waste, with its name still being in the Old Tongue.

T'zura.name: T'zura
T'zura.overview: T'zura is a large city in Seanchan. It is located in southern Seanchan where a river exits out into the sea.

Ta'veren.name: Ta'veren
Ta'veren.overview:
Ta'veren (pronounced: tah-VEER-ehn) are people around whom the Wheel of Time specifically weaves the Pattern with all surrounding life-threads. No one is born ta'veren. The Pattern turns them to be one when there is a need and they are only ta'veren until they fulfill their purpose. The plural is also ta'veren.

The concept of ta'veren is reasonably well-known and understood in the Westlands, but obscure if not completely unknown in other lands such as Seanchan, as evidenced by Tuon Athaem Kore Paendrag not being familiar with the term and dismissing it as a superstition.

Taardad.name: Taardad
Taardad.overview: The Taardad are one of the twelve Aiel clans. Their clan hold is Cold Rocks Hold. The Taardad are the staunchest of Rand’s supporters, sending 15,000 of their spears with Rand as he travels to Alcair Dal. They are not friendly with the Shaido Aiel, finding them shifty and underhanded. They were one of the four clans to cross the Dragonwall during the Aiel War. They were led by Janduin during the Aiel War.

Tabac.name: Tabac
Tabac.overview:
Tabac is a plant, widely cultivated for smoking. The leaves are dried and cured for use in pipes, in which they are burned and the smoke from them inhaled.

Two Rivers tabac is generally acknowledged to be some of the best, from as far away as the Aiel Waste.

- Tabac is an analogue to tobacco in our world. It does not appear to have the same health effects, however.

Tai'daishar.name: Tai'daishar
Tai'daishar.overview:
Tai'daishar ("Lord of Glory" in the Old Tongue ), is the name of a great fiery-eyed black gelding Rand al'Thor acquired shortly after his rescue from the Tower Aes Sedai during the Battle of Dumai's Wells. The horse used to belong to Kiruna Nachiman of the Rebel Aes Sedai faction. Rand comments on Tai'daishar's ability to mirror his own mood in any given moment, as shown by Tai'daishar's solid demeanor in the short campaign against Seanchan forces on the borders of Illian.

Tai'daishar accompanied Rand to most places his owner traveled after he acquired ownership of the gelding. These places include: Cairhien, the locations where Rand's forces battled the Seanchan in Altara, Tear, the location where Rand met " The Daughter of the Nine Moons," in Saldaea just north of Maradon, Bandar Eban, Falme, and just outside of Far Madding.

Taien.name: Taien
Taien.overview: Taien was a small town in the eastern end of the Jangai Pass, in Cairhien.

Tain Shari.name: Tain Shari
Tain Shari.overview: The Tain Shari is an Aiel warrior society. The name means "True Bloods" in the Old Tongue.

Taisham.name: Taisham
Taisham.overview: Taisham is the first month in the Farede calendar. In most years, it is equivalent to the real world period from December 22 to January 18. The first day of the year is sometimes known as First Day and it is the second day in the Feast of Lights. The feastday of High Chasaline also occurs during this month.

Tall Bear.name: Tall Bear
Tall Bear.overview: Tall Bear is a wolf and part of Leafhunter 's pack.

Tallan.name: Tallan
Tallan.overview: Tallan is a village in Ghealdan.

Talmour.name: Talmour
Talmour.overview: Talmour was a kingdom of the Free Years. It was founded after the end of the Trolloc Wars, and was established on the former territory of Essenia. It was later absorbed by the growing might of Artur Hawkwing's Empire. The lands it once held are now partially controlled by Tear, but are mostly wilderness.

Tam al'Thor's sword.name: Tam al'Thor's sword
Tam al'Thor's sword.overview: Tam al'Thor's sword is the first sword Rand ever owned, given to him by Tam al'Thor on Winternight after the Trollocs attacked Emond's Field. It was later destroyed when Rand fought Ba'alzamon over Falme.

Tammaz.name: Tammaz
Tammaz.overview: Tammaz is the eighth month in the Farede calendar. In most years, it is equivalent to the real world period from July 7 to August 3. Feast of Fools occurs during this month (in Arad Doman and the Borderlands ), the Genshai occurs on the 8th, and Mabriam's Day on the 18th.

Tanchico.name: Tanchico
Tanchico.overview:
Tanchico is the capital city of Tarabon and one of the oldest known cities in the world. People from Tanchico are called Tanchicans.

Tanchico is spread over the steep hills embracing Tanchico Bay at the mouth of the River Andahar, Three separate peninsulas jut into the harbor: the Verana to the east, the Maseta in the center, and the Calpene nearest the sea. These peninsulas are guarded by a dozen fortresses that surround the harbor, and each peninsula has a "circle" or assembly arena among its buildings. The smallest of these, the Great Circle on the Calpene Peninsula, can hold thousands of people to watch horse races or displays of Illuminations. The largest arena is the King's Circle, located on the Maseta Peninsula. The Panarch's Circle is slightly smaller than the King's Circle and is located on the Verana Peninsula, as is the Panarch's Palace.

Tandar.name: Tandar
Tandar.overview:
Tandar occurs on the ninth day of Maigdhal.

No one is supposed to let Tandar end still holding a grudge or having a disagreement with anyone. Although the intent is that the quarrelers should be reconciled, it is not unknown for festivities to be marred by attempts to meet the letter in quite another way.

Tar Valon.name: Tar Valon
Tar Valon.overview: Tar Valon (pronounced: TAHR VAH-lon; /ˈtɑɹ vəˈlɒːn/ ) is a city located on an island on the River Erinin, within sight of Dragonmount. It is the center of Aes Sedai power and is also the second largest, most populous city in the Westlands. Tar Valon also controls a small amount of territory directly adjacent to it, although it does not have as much land as it did before the War of the Hundred Years. Tar Valon is ruled by the Amyrlin Seat, although the day-to-day bureaucracy is handled by a council of Aes Sedai sisters and civil administrators. The city is notable as the only place where Aes Sedai have wielded officialized administrative power since the War of the Hundred Years. The population of the city in 1000 NE is roughly 500,000. It has remained independent of outside control for its entire existence, although it has suffered several major sieges and even direct assaults.

Tarabon.name: Tarabon
Tarabon.overview: Tarabon is a country situated in the southwest coast of the Westlands. Its capital, Tanchico, is a port situated on the western coast on the Aryth Ocean. Tarabon's eastern border abuts Amadicia, and its northern border is with the Almoth Plain. Its people are called Taraboners.

Tarasin Palace.name: Tarasin Palace
Tarasin Palace.overview:
The Tarasin Palace is located in the center of Ebou Dar, the nominal capital of Altara. It faces the Mol Hara square and is the governing building of the Altaran monarchy.

The ruler of the throne in 998 NE was Queen Tylin Quintara of House Mitsobar, who was murdered by a gholam. She was succeeded by her son Beslan, who accepted Seanchan authority as the foreign armies conquered Ebou Dar.

Tarchrot.name: Tarchrot
Tarchrot.overview:
Tarchrot is a fairly common plant, the leaves of which are poisonous when ingested. However, its extremely bitter flavor and relatively weak poisonous properties makes tarchrot leaf a poor choice for dramatic murder: the victim would detect it in the food and refuse to consume the serving. Alternatively, if administered gradually over the course of time, the victim would die what would appear to be a natural death.

The poisonous herb is sometimes used as a humane method of putting a dog down.

Taren (river).name: Taren (river)
Taren (river).overview: The Taren is a major waterflow that marks the northern and eastern boundaries of the Two Rivers region. It was known by the name Tarendrelle during the time of Manetheren.

Taren Ferry.name: Taren Ferry
Taren Ferry.overview: Taren Ferry is a small town that lies on the northern boundary of the Two Rivers region.

Tarwin's Gap.name: Tarwin's Gap
Tarwin's Gap.overview:
Tarwin's Gap is a mountain pass marking the boundary between the Mountains of Dhoom and the Spine of the World. It had once been part of Malkier, before that nation's fall.

Tarwin's Gap can be considered the location of Rand 's first appearance as the Dragon Reborn when he destroyed the Trolloc Army there after channeling the pool of pure saidin at the Eye of the World.

Tarwin's Gap was also used extensively during the Trolloc Wars to transport Trolloc troops from the Blight into the Westlands.

Tavern puzzle.name: Tavern puzzle
Tavern puzzle.overview: A tavern puzzle is a mechanical puzzle consisting of small metal pieces like rings and other objects that has to be disentangled and put back together. They are forged by blacksmiths to amuse their friends at taverns and inns, and apparently they are a well-known game in the Westlands.

Tcheran.name: Tcheran
Tcheran.overview: Tcheran is a derivative of sha'rah, a complex board game. Not much is known about the board game, other than that it was a strategic boardgame that was simpler than sha'rah and that Moridin preferred sha'rah by far. Semirhage was an indiferent tcheran player.

Tear.name: Tear
Tear.overview: Tear (pronounced: TEER) is one of the richest nations in the land. This comes in part from controlling the third largest port on the Sea of Storms behind Illian and Ebou Dar, at the mouth of the River Erinin. A great deal of Tear's wealth comes from the oil produced on the country's numerous olive ↗ farms. Lucrative trade in grain, fish, and spices also brings money into the rich nation.

Tear (city).name: Tear (city)
Tear (city).overview: The City of Tear is the capital of the nation of the same name.

Tel Norwin.name: Tel Norwin
Tel Norwin.overview: Tel Norwin was the place of a battle during the Trolloc Wars, it was won by the forces of the Light under the command of the Amyrlin Rashima Kerenmosa.

Tempo of Infinity.name: Tempo of Infinity
Tempo of Infinity.overview:
Tempo of Infinity is a work of art from the Age of Legends, created by Ceran Tol. The exact nature of the object is not described in detail, but it is mentioned while Graendal observes artworks on a wall, so perhaps it is a painting of some kind.

The last known location of the object is a room in the apartments that Sammael used in Illian while he was disguised as Lord Brend.

Sammael claims to have found the artwork in a stasis box.

Ten ferrets.name: Ten ferrets
Ten ferrets.overview:
The party of the so called " ten ferrets " is a group of ten Aes Sedai that were sent back to the White Tower by the Salidar Six rebel leaders as a fifth column. All of them were out of the Tower when Siuan was deposed; they were chosen as this would help reduce suspicion. Apparently, they had returned in response to Elaida 's summons of all Aes Sedai.

They have to spy Elaida's activities for the rebel Aes Sedai, and to spread dissent inside the Tower, for example revealing about the Red Ajah 's involvement in setting up Logain Ablar as a false Dragon and Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan 's knowledge of this plot..

The Salidar Six leaders felt that this was one way to prevent sisters from wanting to return to the Tower while, at the same time, destabilizing the Tower from inside and undermining Elaida's position.

Because the Rebel Hall of the Tower was ignorant of this mission, when Egwene knew about it she blackmailed the Salidar Six leaders to give an oath of fidelity to her.

They were two Aes Sedai from each Ajah, save Blue and Red. All of them were discovered by the Black Ajah Hunters, the two Sitters Seaine and Pevara; the first discovered was Zerah Dacan and immediately all of them were captured and forced to sworn an oath of obedience to the Sitters and to help them in the hunt of the Black sisters. The Sitters also make use of them by ordering Meidani to try and re-new a friendship with Elaida.

Since they have sworn on the Oath Rod in front of the Black Ajah Hunters and stated that they are not Black, it is known for certain that none of them are Darkfriends.

When Beonin, who has been spying on the Salidar Aes Sedai, returns to the White Tower, she tells Elaida all about the ferrets. Tarna wants to know if she should have them arrested, but Elaida tells her to simply have them watched, to see who they associate with. She also tells Tarna to have Meidani invited to dinner with her, since she now knows why Meidani has been trying to renew their friendship.

When Egwene finds out about Beonin, she orders her to alarm the ferrets about their situation. Beonin says she has already warned her fellow Greys Meidani and Jennet, Egwene is adamant that Beonin must warn each of the ferrets from the other Ajahs. Beonin flinches, as the conflict between the Ajahs then would have made it difficult and unpleasant, but she promises to obey.

Egwene then tells Meidani her work is appreciated and advices the Black Ajah Hunters that they should release the ferrets from the outlaw oath of obedience to them, despite the circumstances they were forced to obtain it.

They are reluctant at first, but eventually Egwene persuaded the Sitters to remove the ferrets from their oaths, because it was a wrong way to proceed, despite the need of extreme secrecy and security.

The ten sisters chosen are all quite strong in the One Power, between level 16(4) and 19(7), high in the hierarchy and able to open a suitable Traveling gateway. The rebel leaders most likely wanted to send influential Aes Sedai to spread dissent against Elaida, rather than simple spies.

Ten Nations.name: Ten Nations
Ten Nations.overview: Following the Breaking of the World, ten nations emerged as roughly equal powers in the Westlands.

Tenth Tower Company.name: Tenth Tower Company
Tenth Tower Company.overview:
The Tenth Tower Company is a unit of the Tower Guard.

It was nearly wiped out during the Battle of Tar Valon. It almost certainly was replenished by the remaining Younglings, who no longer wished to become Warders.

Terhana Library.name: Terhana Library
Terhana Library.overview:
The Terhana Library is located in Bandar Eban. According to Cadsuane Melaidhrin, it is one of the greatest in the world, and as such, Domani librarians are not uncommon.

Namine Tasil, a Domani Aes Sedai, may have spent some time in the Terhana Library before going to the White Tower, as she chose the Brown Ajah and settled in the library there when she was raised to the shawl.

Termool.name: Termool
Termool.overview: The Termool is a barren desert lying in the southernmost area of the Aiel Waste, north of the Sea of Storms, and east of Stedding Shangtai, Mayene, and the Drowned Lands. Its eastern limits are bounded by an immense canyon known as the Great Rift. The Termool is so dry and desolate that even Aiel will not travel there. The sand dunes of the area are constantly drifting, sometimes reaching heights of three hundred feet. Fierce, sudden windstorms, which can last for several days, are common. As a consequence, water is impossible to find and the Termool is utterly devoid of life.

Tharon.name: Tharon
Tharon.overview: Tharon is a region known for growing wine. Faile offered Perrin wine from Tharon when he returned to Cairhien after the Battle of Dumai's Wells.

The Archers.name: The Archers
The Archers.overview:
The Archers is an inn in Emond's Field in the Two Rivers. For a long time the Winespring Inn has been the only inn in the village, but the swelling in size of the settlement with the influx of many refugees from wars elsewhere has seen demand for a second tavern grow. The Archers was under construction in early 1000 NE when Elayne Trakand and Egwene al'Vere met in the village during a visit to Tel'aran'rhiod, and was noted by Egwene as one of many changes to happen to the village in just the last two years.

The proprietor of the Archers and the attitude of the villagers to the new inn is not known.

The Ball and Hoop.name: The Ball and Hoop
The Ball and Hoop.overview: The Ball and Hoop is an inn in Caemlyn.

The Bellon Ford Inn.name: The Bellon Ford Inn
The Bellon Ford Inn.overview:
Bellon Ford Inn is an inn in the small village of Bellon. It is a large inn with a private dining room. The innkeeper 's name is Alfara.

Bellon Ford Inn is where Elayne Trakand, Nynaeve al'Meara, Thomdril Merrilin, and Juilin Sandar stay after escaping Ronde Macura. Elayne plays a noblewoman named Morelin and Nynaeve plays the part of her maid, Nana, something Nynaeve does not like.

The Blind Pig.name: The Blind Pig
The Blind Pig.overview:
The Blind Pig is an inn located in the Kandori capital of Chachin. It is located within the first ringwall of the city in a disreputable, run-down district.

Moiraine Damodred visited the inn in 979 NE, whilst trying to find Siuan Sanche for an arranged rendezvous. Moiraine was advised to leave before the patrons "had her for dinner."

The Blood.name: The Blood
The Blood.overview: The Blood are those of Seanchan nobility and hold the highest place in Seanchan society.

The Blue Cat.name: The Blue Cat
The Blue Cat.overview:
The Blue Cat is an inn located in Tar Valon, not far from the Great Fish Market in the southwest part of the city. The inn is actually built in the shape of a large, sleeping cat, and is of Ogier design and construction.

It was passed by Moiraine Damodred and Siuan Sanche on their way out of the city to disburse the Amyrlin Seat 's bounty to all newborn infants on the day after the Dragon 's rebirth in late 978 NE.

The Blue Rose.name: The Blue Rose
The Blue Rose.overview:
The Blue Rose is an inn located in the Kandori city of Canluum. In 979 NE, its proprietor was one Racelle Arovni.

The Blue Rose was an old haunt of the Malkieri warrior Bukama Marenellin, who was on intimate terms with its innkeeper. Bukama and al'Lan Mandragoran stayed at the Blue Rose on their way to Chachin and were attacked by Darkfriends there.

The Boar Rushed Downhill.name: The Boar Rushed Downhill
The Boar Rushed Downhill.overview:
For the sword form with a similar name, see The Boar Rushes Down the Mountain .

The Boar Rushed Downhill is a sword form. It was used by either Rand al'Thor or Be'lal during their fight over Callandor. It was used to counter the Cat Dances on the Wall.

The Boar Rushes Down the Mountain.name: The Boar Rushes Down the Mountain
The Boar Rushes Down the Mountain.overview:
The Boar Rushes Down the Mountain is a sword form. It is a series of aggressive strikes raining down from overhead.

Rand al'Thor used this sword form against Turak Aladon, forcing the Seanchan into retreating.

Rand also used this form to break through his sparring partner's Parting the Silk and Lightning of Three Prongs.

The Bunch of Grapes.name: The Bunch of Grapes
The Bunch of Grapes.overview: The Bunch of Grapes is an inn in the Foregate in Cairhien, located just beyond the Jangai Gate. It is owned by Zera.

The Conquest.name: The Conquest
The Conquest.overview: The Conquest is the name given for the invasion and subjugation of the Seanchan home continent by armies loyal to the High King, Artur Hawkwing, and personally led by his son, Luthair Paendrag Mondwin. Within the Seanchan Empire itself, the invasion is referred to as the Conquest or Consolidation, however, in the Westlands, the Consolidation is a separate, but related, event.

The Council of Elders.name: The Council of Elders
The Council of Elders.overview: Elders among the Ogier are the leaders of their society, in many stedding there is a Council of Elders tu rule their group.

The Counsel's Head.name: The Counsel's Head
The Counsel's Head.overview:
The Counsel's Head is an inn in Far Madding situated overlooking the Nethvin Market. It is a nicer establishment than The Crown of Maredo.

Rand, Min, Nynaeve, Lan and Alivia stay at the inn after leaving The Crown of Maredo.

The Courtier Taps His Fan.name: The Courtier Taps His Fan
The Courtier Taps His Fan.overview: The Courtier Taps His Fan is a sword form. Nothing is known about the movements of the form. Rand al'Thor once used this form to cut down a Trolloc and protect Loial after stealing back the Horn of Valere from Padan Fain. Gawyn Trakand flowed through this form while fighting against an unnamed Aiel after the Battle of Dumai's Wells.

The Creeper Embraces the Oak.name: The Creeper Embraces the Oak
The Creeper Embraces the Oak.overview: The Creeper Embraces the Oak is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it. Gawyn Trakand flowed from The Falcon Stoops to The Creeper and into The Moon Rises Over the Lakes while fighting Aiel after the Battle of Dumai's Wells.

The Crown and Lion.name: The Crown and Lion
The Crown and Lion.overview:
The Crown and Lion is an inn in Caemlyn, located on the other side of the city from the Queen's Blessing.

Rand al'Thor passed the inn during his wanderings around the city and gave it as his place of lodging when asked by Elaida so she would find it more difficult to locate him after his unplanned audience with Queen Morgase.

The Crown of Maredo.name: The Crown of Maredo
The Crown of Maredo.overview: The Crown of Maredo is an Inn in Far Madding. It is a modest inn, with two dozen rooms on two floors. The walls are painted yellow and the serving men wear yellow aprons. Rand stays there while waiting to kill Rochaid and Kisman and felt the cooks were very good. The innkeeper is Mistress Nalhera

The Crown of Roses.name: The Crown of Roses
The Crown of Roses.overview: The Crown of Roses was an inn in Caemlyn, the capital city of Andor.

The Cyclone Rages.name: The Cyclone Rages
The Cyclone Rages.overview: The Cyclone Rages is a sword form. Other than the name, nothing is known about it. Gawyn Trakand used this form to defend his vital areas while fighting three Seanchan Bloodknives in the White Tower.

The Dance of the Hawk and the Hummingbir.name: The Dance of the Hawk and the Hummingbird
The Dance of the Hawk and the Hummingbir.overview: The Dance of the Hawk and the Hummingbird, by Teven Aerwin, is a book "which purported to set forth the proper conduct of men toward women and women toward men." Lady Amalisa Jagad 's copy was burnt by Liandrin.

The Dancers.name: The Dancers
The Dancers.overview: The Dancers are a group of hills in Altara, named so during the time of Londaren Cor, capitol city of Eharon, a nation of the time of the Ten Nations, which was situated on the site. The hills are described as three tall hills in a row: "The middle hill had a cleft top, like a wedge cut cleanly out, while the hill on the left had two.”

The Dancing Cartman.name: The Dancing Cartman
The Dancing Cartman.overview:
The Dancing Cartman is an inn located in the village of Four Kings, run by Saml Hake. Jak and Strom are its bouncers.

Rand and Mat play in the common room for a single night, for room and board. They also meet Howal Gode, a Darkfriend, there. In a late-night confrontation Gode tries to persuade them to give up and serve the Dark Lord. It is in this confrontation, as a thunderstorm rages outside, that Rand channels unconsciously, calling down a lightning bolt that destroys the wall to help him and Mat escape.

The Dark One's Eyes (dice).name: The Dark One's Eyes (dice)
The Dark One's Eyes (dice).overview:
For the carrion servants of the Shadow , see Dark One's eyes (carrion) .

The Dark One's Eyes is a name for a roll of five dice where each die shows a single pip in games where it is a losing toss. While the same toss can be a winning toss in other games, such tosses are not referred to as the Dark One 's eyes. The term may apply in situations where it is neither the winning nor losing toss. It is considered unlucky.

The Dead Man's Breath.name: The Dead Man's Breath
The Dead Man's Breath.overview:
The Dead Man's Breath is a Caemlyn tavern with a dark interior. Not much food is served, just strong drinks. Bernherd is the tavernkeeper.

The tavern employed two toughs out front.

The Defender of the Dragonwall.name: The Defender of the Dragonwall
The Defender of the Dragonwall.overview:
For other Defenders, see Defender .

The Defender of the Dragonwall is an inn in the city of Cairhien. It is owned by Master Cuale.

The Dove Takes Flight.name: The Dove Takes Flight
The Dove Takes Flight.overview: The Dove Takes Flight is a sword form. Nothing is known about the form except the name. Rand al'Thor once used it when fighting with Ba'alzamon. The form was also used by Eamon Valda against Galadedrid Damodred during their fight. Galad defended with Kingfisher Circles the Pond.

The Dragon.name: The Dragon
The Dragon.overview:
The Dragon is an inn in the city of Tear.

It is owned by Agardo Saranche. It is a tile-roofed inn with three stories. It is bade of dark gray stone. The sign of the inn is a rough approximation of the marks on Rand al'Thor 's arms, but stylized to look almost like a raken. The common room has a beam ceiling.

Rand al'Thor, Min Farshaw, Nynaeve al'Meara, Alivia, Cadsuane Melaidhrin and a small company of Maiden of the Spear take a room at The Dragon in order to Travel into the Stone of Tear.

The Dragon Reborn.name: The Dragon Reborn
